Bornholm bliver DK's 3. "markedsplads" for handel med el!

Energistyrelsen har netop offentliggjort, at der oprettes en ny budzone p√• Bornholm. N√•r vi s√¶tter #Energi√∏ Bornholm i drift og etablerer en ny elhandelsforbindelse mellem Danmark og Tyskland, skaber vi samtidigt en ny "markedsplads" for handel med el, ogs√• kaldet en budzone. 

#√òbisserne i Energinet har lavet en grundig analyse og vi kan se, at der vil v√¶re en st√∏rre eftersp√∏rgsel p√• overf√∏rselskapacitet, end vi kan levere gennem kablerne. Det skaber en "flaskehals" i markedet, som vi h√•ndterer via en budzone p√• Bornholm. 

Den nye - og 3. budzone i DK - f√•r dog ikke den store betydning for elpriserne p√• Bornholm, da priserne overvejende vil f√∏lge priserne i enten √òstdanmark eller Tyskland. I praksis vil det ikke v√¶re noget den enkelte forbruger kan m√¶rke p√• elregningen.

Den nye budzone tr√¶der f√∏rst i kraft, n√•r Energi√∏ Bornholm g√•r i drift ‚Äì men nu er strukturen i markedet klar - og vi er et lille vigtigt skidt videre mod Energi√∏ Bornholm!
column5:
bornholm will become denmark's third electricity trading hub! 

with the new bidding zone on bornholm, we are creating a platform for electricity trade that includes a connection between denmark and germany as part of the #energi√∏ bornholm project. energinet has conducted a thorough analysis, revealing a market bottleneck due to higher demand for transmission capacity than what the cables can deliver. to manage this bottleneck, we are introducing the bidding zone on bornholm.

this will not significantly impact electricity prices on bornholm, as they will mostly align with prices in eastern denmark or germany. consumers won't notice any difference in their electricity bills. the bidding zone will only become active when the energy island on bornholm is operational, but the market structure is now in place. this marks an important step forward for energi√∏ bornholm!

I dag pr√¶senterede Energy Island Forum sin roadmap om energi√∏er i Europa-Parlamentet. 

Road-mappet skitserer de kritiske skridt til at realisere Europas f√∏rste energi√∏er inden 2030 og l√¶gger desuden grundlaget for langsigtet innovation af energi√∏er frem mod 2050. 

2030-fokus er p√• at f√• de f√∏rste energi√∏er op at k√∏re. Dette omfatter udvikling af lovgivningsm√¶ssige rammer til styring af risici, etablering af EU-finansieringsmekanismer til at st√∏tte projekter, fremme af industrisamarbejde for at fremskynde implementeringen og inddragelse af lokalsamfund for at sikre bred st√∏tte.

N√•r vi ser frem mod 2050, fokuserer Energy Island Forum p√• langsigtet innovation for at udvikle en europ√¶isk h√∏jborg inden for energi√∏-teknologi. 2050-horisonten fokuserer p√• at fremme langsigtet innovation - investering i F&U, udvikling af specialiserede uddannelsesprogrammer, skabelse af et √∏kosystem af ekspertise for energi√∏-teknologier og sikring af projekter, der stemmer overens med klimam√•l og b√¶redygtighed for at g√∏re energi√∏er til en central del af Europas gr√∏nne energifremtid .

For b√•de 2030 og 2050 igangs√¶ttes centrale n√∏gleaktiviteter med roadmap‚Äôen i dag!
column5:
energy island forum has presented a roadmap to realize europe‚Äôs first energy islands by 2030 and to drive long-term innovation in energy island technology by 2050. by 2030, the focus is on operationalizing the first energy islands. this involves establishing regulatory frameworks to manage risks, creating eu funding mechanisms to support projects, fostering industrial collaboration to accelerate implementation, and engaging local communities to secure broad support.

looking ahead to 2050, the roadmap emphasizes long-term innovation to position europe as a global leader in energy island technology. this includes investing in research and development, creating specialized educational programs, building an ecosystem of expertise in energy island technologies, and ensuring projects align with climate and sustainability goals. the objective is to make energy islands a cornerstone of europe‚Äôs green energy future. key activities outlined in the roadmap are being initiated immediately to achieve these goals.

column5:
we, k√§rnfull, believe that nuclear power is a far better alternative to the bornholm energy island project, which would cost danish taxpayers at least 31.5 billion dkk in state subsidies, as estimated by the danish energy agency. this is equivalent to three times the annual budget for the police. 

in contrast, nuclear power projects require no state subsidies. k√§rnfull is prepared to build nuclear power plants in denmark without any financial support from the state. the energy island project on bornholm does not make economic sense, as confirmed by the analysis firm kraka. their senior economist, frederik l√¶ss√∏e nielsen, has publicly challenged proponents to provide a single convincing argument for its construction. 

the challenges with the energy island project include:

1. **massive state subsidies** of at least 31.5 billion dkk.  
2. **no contribution to energy security**, as additional wind turbines in the baltic sea will not solve this issue.  
3. **extremely expensive power-to-x (ptx) production** on bornholm compared to alternative energy sources.  

nuclear power, unlike these costly energy islands, can provide affordable and stable electricity and hydrogen production. by situating nuclear power plants at existing combined heat and power plants, we can avoid further industrializing natural areas.

k√§rnfull next is already developing nuclear power projects in sweden and has expressed interest in doing so in denmark if the current ban on nuclear power is lifted. nuclear power eliminates the need for large-scale energy islands by offering stable electricity, district heating, and hydrogen production.

furthermore, many of our customers have already saved thousands of kroner by switching to electricity contracts with 100% nuclear power, avoiding overpriced fixed-rate agreements or hidden fees. if you are not yet a customer and would like a free price check on your electricity agreement, email us at hej@karnfull.dk or call us at 78708070. üìû
column13: Is nuclear power an alternative to energy islands?

column5:
the energy island project on bornholm has seen significant progress in 2023. we have established the baltic energy island as a commercial foundation with a professional board comprising partners such as √∏rsted, siemens gamesa, port of r√∏nne, beof a/s, dtu, cip foundation, offshore center bornholm, and bornholms regionskommune. 

in may 2023, we inaugurated a large exhibition on energy islands at the historic r√∏nne gl. elv√¶rk, in collaboration with energinet and walk agency. this exhibition has attracted delegations and visitors from around the world, and we encourage continued interest. 

we are exploring the possibility of creating an energy-focused industrial park on bornholm, which is now a priority on our agenda. 

furthermore, we have formalized cooperation between three emerging energy island communities in the baltic sea: bornholm, gotland, and √•land. my personal visits to gotland and √•land in october highlighted the wealth of knowledge we can share and learn from one another. 

in may 2023, we hosted the highly successful energy island summit. this success has led to a dedicated funding allocation in denmark‚Äôs 2024 finance act for the next summit in may 2024, which we are already designing and planning. i promise it will be an exciting event. 

on a personal note, 2023 has also brought me closer to bornholm. i‚Äôve taken on a permanent role as a chief consultant and acquired a small countryside property on the northern part of the island, complete with a lake, cliffs, and a small vineyard. 

i extend my gratitude for the collaboration this year and wish everyone a festive new year. i look forward to many memorable moments in 2024.

üì£ Bornholm skal h√¶ve ambitionsniveauet for erhvervsvenlighed ‚Äì ellers risikerer energi√∏ens potentiale at g√• tabt.

Der har netop v√¶ret h√∏ringsfrist vedr. BRK‚Äôs nye Plan- og Udviklingsstrategi. DI Bornholm har indsendt h√∏ringssvar p√• strategien, der har Energi√∏en som omdrejningspunkt.

DI Bornholm kvitterer for kommunens ambition om at t√¶nke en kommende bornholmsk energi√∏ sammen med lokal v√¶kst og udvikling. 

Men vi er bekymrede for, om Bornholms Regionskommune sigter forbi andre vigtige udviklingsomr√•der ved at g√∏re en eventuel fremtidig energi√∏ til det prim√¶re centerpunkt for en bornholmsk udviklingsstrategi. G√∏r ogs√• Bornholm, som √∏en er i dag, til centrum for de strategiske indsatser med ambitionen om at g√∏re vores √∏ til et af de bedste steder i landet at leve, bo, g√• i skole, arbejde og drive virksomhed. 

DI‚Äôs erhvervsvenlighedsunders√∏gelse placerer √•r efter √•r Bornholm i den absolutte bund blandt landets kommuner, n√•r det kommer til lokal erhvervsvenlighed. Det er et problem nu og her for Bornholms eksisterende erhvervsliv, og det bliver et problem for fremtiden, n√•r Bornholm vil g√∏re sig attraktiv for nye virksomheder og tilflyttere i k√∏lvandet p√• energi√∏en og udnytte nye erhvervsm√¶ssige muligheder. 

üéØ Hvis Bornholm skal g√∏re sig forh√•bninger om at oms√¶tte energi√∏en til lokal v√¶kst, udvikling og arbejdspladser, b√∏r man s√¶tte ind her som den f√∏rste og vigtigste strategiske m√•ls√¶tning i en Plan- og Udviklingsstrategi 2024, i supplement til energi√∏en. 

H√¶v ambitionsniveauet markant for den kommunale erhvervsvenlighed og s√¶t handling bag ordene üí™ . Det vil skabe fundamentet for at f√• skabt den lokale udvikling og v√¶kst, som energi√∏en p√• den lange bane leverer potentiale for ‚Äì og det vil gavne √∏ens eksisterende virksomheder og hele det bornholmske samfund p√• den kortere bane.
column5:
bornholm must raise its ambitions for business friendliness, or the potential of the energy island project risks being lost. while we acknowledge and appreciate the municipality's ambition to integrate the energy island with local growth and development, bornholm‚Äôs regional municipality needs to address other key areas of development. bornholm, as it exists today, should also be a strategic focal point, aiming to become one of the best places in denmark to live, study, work, and run a business.

bornholm consistently ranks at the bottom of denmark‚Äôs municipalities in di‚Äôs business friendliness survey. this is currently a significant problem for local businesses and will become a greater challenge when bornholm seeks to attract new companies and residents in connection with the energy island project. 

to turn the energy island into a driver of local growth, development, and job creation, the first and most critical strategic goal of the 2024 plan and development strategy should be significantly improving municipal business friendliness, in addition to focusing on the energy island.

we urge the municipality to take bold action to elevate business friendliness, as this will establish the foundation for local growth and development in both the short and long term. this approach will benefit bornholm's existing businesses and the wider community, ensuring that the energy island project delivers on its full potential.
column13: Who benefits socially and economically from energy islands? Is it fair?

column3:
Energi√∏ Bornholm: En god investering i Danmarks og Europas fremtid

I jule- og nyt√•rstiden, hvor f√¶llesskabet er i h√∏js√¶det, og hvor vi reflekterer over vores f√¶lles fremtid, er det v√¶rd at s√¶tte fokus p√• projekter, der r√¶kker ud over vores tid og skaber v√¶rdi for kommende generationer. Sammen med Troels Ranis, vicedirekt√∏r i DI Energi, har jeg derfor skrevet et debatindl√¶g i Jyllands-Posten om Energi√∏ Bornholm og projektets betydning for vores f√¶lles fremtid.

Vi har samlet vores perspektiver i tre bundlinjer for Energi√∏ Bornholm:

 Klimam√¶ssigt: Projektet vil i sig selv fortr√¶nge 3 mio. tons CO2 om √•ret, men endnu vigtigere bane vejen for flere energi√∏er, der er afg√∏rende for den gr√∏nne omstilling i EU.

 Industripolitisk: Bornholm vil som eksisterende √∏ v√¶re den ideelle testplatform for fremtidens energi√∏er. Det vil give danske virksomheder en innovationsm√¶ssig fordel i udviklingen af energi√∏-teknologier.

 Sikkerhedspolitisk: Energi√∏ Bornholm vil med sin kombination af elhandelsforbindelse og store m√¶ngder gr√∏n energi v√¶re et vigtigt skridt mod at frig√∏re EU fra russisk energi. Som det er tilf√¶ldet med klimaeffekterne, er projektet som et af de st√∏rste klimaprojekter nogensinde betydningsfuldt i sig selv. Men den st√∏rste effekt ligger igen i, at projektet baner vejen for flere energi√∏er, som samlet set vil v√¶re afg√∏rende for, at Europa kan blive selvforsynende med energi.

Derudover argumenterer vi ogs√• for, at projektet har gode chancer for at v√¶re en god forretning for Danmark. De nuv√¶rende beregninger viser godt nok en negativ samfunds√∏konomi p√• 4 mia. kr., men det skyldes, at Energistyrelsens beregninger har sv√¶rt ved at medregne de mange gevinster, som projektet har p√• grund af sin innovative karakter.
column5:
the energy island bornholm project is a vital investment in the future of denmark and europe. the project offers significant benefits across three key areas:  

1. climate impact: the project will directly displace 3 million tons of co2 annually and pave the way for additional energy islands, which are critical to the eu's green transition.  

2. industrial policy: bornholm, as an existing island, is the ideal testing ground for future energy islands, providing danish companies with an innovation advantage in energy island technologies.  

3. security policy: with its combination of electricity trading connections and large-scale green energy production, energy island bornholm is a crucial step toward reducing the eu's dependency on russian energy. the project's significance lies not only in its immediate impact but in its ability to enable further energy island development, essential for achieving europe's energy self-sufficiency.  

moreover, despite current projections showing a societal economic loss of 4 billion dkk, this figure fails to account for the many long-term and innovative benefits of the project. energy island bornholm has strong potential to be a profitable venture for denmark.
column13: Are energy islands a good investment for innovation and economic growth?

column3:
I dag fik jeg lov til at foretr√¶de for Klima-, Energi- og Forsyningsudvalget p√• Christiansborg.

Vi har med Energi√∏ Bornholm alletiders mulighed for at skabe et udstillingsvindue til resten af verden, samtidig med at vi giver Bornholms udvikling et boost, skaffer flere arbejds- og uddannelsespladser, tiltr√¶kker innovation og nye kompetencer i et omfang, der aldrig tidligere er sket p√• Bornholm.

Det skal v√¶re med til at sikre, at vi har r√•d til gode skoler, b√∏rnehaver og plejehjem, og at vi afleverer en bedre og mere b√¶redygtig verden til de kommende generationer üòä‚ù§Ô∏è
Et kvarter er ikke lang tid, n√•r man har meget p√• hjerte, men der blev lyttet, og jeg fik afleveret Bornholms budskaber om muligheder for kompensation, n√•r vi l√¶gger jord til Energi√∏ Bornholm, lige som der skal t√¶nkes milj√∏, udvikling, innovation og meget andet ind i arbejdet.

Jeg blev flankeret af min kommunaldirekt√∏r Sine Sunesen, konst. direkt√∏r for Baltic Energy Island, S√∏ren M√∏ller Christensen, og bestyrelsesmedlem i DI Bornholm og direkt√∏r for Bornholms Energi & Forsyning, Claus M. Andersen. 

Claus kunne ikke n√• at v√¶re med p√• billedet, da han skulle n√• et fly og ikke ville risikere samme sk√¶bne som mig sidste fredag üòÑ

column5:
bornholm has a unique opportunity with the energy island project to create a global showcase, while significantly boosting bornholm's development. this initiative can provide more jobs, education opportunities, innovation, and attract new expertise to bornholm at an unprecedented scale. these advancements will help ensure that bornholm can afford quality schools, childcare, and eldercare facilities, and leave a better and more sustainable world for future generations.

i emphasized the importance of addressing compensation for bornholm as we provide land for the energy island, while ensuring the project incorporates considerations for the environment, development, and innovation. i had the opportunity to present bornholm's perspectives to the danish climate, energy, and utilities committee, and while the time was limited, i ensured our key messages were heard. 

i was supported by key representatives, including my municipal director sine sunesen, acting director for baltic energy island s√∏ren m√∏ller christensen, and board member of di bornholm and director of bornholms energi & forsyning, claus m. andersen. 

thank you to the committee for listening to our input and giving us the platform to share bornholm's vision for this transformative project.

Med en placering midt i √òsters√∏en med gunstige hav- og vindforhold spiller Bornholm en helt central rolle i Danmarks gr√∏nne omstillingüå± 

Derfor bes√∏gte klima-, energi- og forsyningsminister Lars Aagaard i dag Bornholm sammen med Lea Wermelin (S) og Peter Juel Jensen (V). 

Under bes√∏get m√∏dtes ministeren og MF'erne med Bornholms borgmester Jacob Tr√∏st, gruppeform√¶ndene fra regionskommunens byr√•d og partnerskabet Baltic Energy Island for at dr√∏fte, hvordan den kommende energi√∏ kan underst√∏tte Bornholms udvikling og skabe nye muligheder for bornholmerne. column4: Danish climate, energy and utilities ministry
column5:
bornholm's strategic location in the baltic sea, combined with favorable marine and wind conditions, makes it a cornerstone of denmark‚Äôs green transition.  

to advance this effort, climate, energy, and utilities minister lars aagaard visited bornholm alongside lea wermelin (s) and peter juel jensen (v). during the visit, they met with bornholm‚Äôs mayor, jacob tr√∏st, municipal council leaders, and the baltic energy island partnership. these discussions focused on how the upcoming energy island can support bornholm‚Äôs development and create new opportunities for its residents.

column5: as mayor of bornholm, i fully support delivering a sustainable society to future generations, but we must ensure this development is pursued effectively. the energy island project on bornholm, slated to provide between 3 and 7 gigawatts of green electricity by 2030, is a crucial step in this direction. this project will enable us to harness and store surplus wind energy, ensuring a reliable energy supply even when the wind is not blowing. it also eliminates the inefficiency of idle wind turbines during optimal conditions. the energy island initiative is not just about energy but also about creating jobs, fostering development, and offering new educational opportunities. by learning from skive municipality's bold and timely decisions to attract green businesses, we can implement innovative solutions that drive sustainable development on bornholm. i am grateful to all partners, including bornholm‚Äôs regional municipality, energy providers, educational institutions, ports, business organizations, and local industries, for their dedication to making this vision a reality.

column3:
I takt med, at de oprindelige argumenter for Energi√∏ Bornholm, som eksporteventyr og enorme indt√¶gter, er faldet til jorden, er forsyningssikkerhed i stigende grad blevet et b√¶rende argument for projektet. Problemet er bare, at det ikke er nok til at opveje den d√•rlige samfunds√∏konomi. 

Den seneste rentabilitetsanalyse viser et samfunds√∏konomisk underskud p√• hele 7 mia. kr., men meget tyder p√•, at underskuddet er blevet st√∏rre, da udbuddet af selve vindm√∏llerne for nylig blev udskudt.

Til sammenligning giver et forsigtigt bud p√• gevinsterne ved √∏get forsyningssikkerhed en v√¶rdi p√• cirka 3 mia. kr. alts√• langt fra nok til at opveje det samfunds√∏konomiske tab. 

Derudover er det prim√¶rt udlandskablet til Tyskland, der bidrager til forsyningssikkerheden, og det er sv√¶rt at forestille sig, at det ikke kunne f√•s billigere end via en omvej over Bornholm.

Dansk forsyningssikkerhed m√• derfor siges at v√¶re et d√•rligt argument for projektet.

Energi√∏ Bornholm bidrager dog til den europ√¶iske forsyningssikkerhed. Og derfor er det en politisk afvejning, som man i √∏vrigt b√∏r st√• ved og sige direkte til v√¶lgerne, at man vil bede de danske skatteborgere om at betale for forsyningssikkerheden hos vores rige nabolande.
column5:
the original arguments for energy island bornholm, such as promises of an export boom and massive revenues, have largely fallen apart. as a result, supply security has increasingly become the central justification for the project. however, this is insufficient to offset the poor socio-economic viability.  

the latest profitability analysis shows a socio-economic deficit of 7 billion dkk, and this deficit is likely to have grown due to the recent delay in the tender process for the wind turbines.  

by comparison, a conservative estimate places the benefits of improved supply security at around 3 billion dkk, which is far from enough to balance the socio-economic loss. moreover, the primary contributor to supply security is the cable to germany, which could almost certainly be implemented more cheaply without routing through bornholm.  

therefore, danish supply security is a weak argument for the project.  

energy island bornholm does contribute to european supply security, making this a political decision. politicians should openly acknowledge this and be transparent with voters that danish taxpayers are being asked to fund the energy security of wealthier neighboring countries.
column13: Who benefits socially and economically from energy islands? Is it fair?

Og mens Bornholm som energi√∏ tager form er det planen, at det historiske R√∏nne Elv√¶rk bliver omdannet til et levende hus for studerende, forskere og virksomheder.

column5:
bornholm is the world‚Äôs first energy island!  

during folkem√∏det, i visited the old power plant in r√∏nne, where the technical university of denmark (dtu) and partners from baltic energy island are working to establish a ‚Äòresidential college‚Äô focused on research and education. it is natural for us to integrate lifelong learning into this initiative. i envision the development of further education and training programs with a focus on sustainable energy systems, power-to-x, offshore wind turbines, and the broader green transition. these programs will soon take place on bornholm, incorporating both teaching and hands-on components where participants can experience these technologies directly on-site, including trips to see offshore wind turbines.  

with the establishment of bornholm as the world‚Äôs first large-scale energy island and offshore wind farms in the baltic sea, it will be possible to test future green technologies on bornholm as a living energy laboratory. as bornholm evolves into an energy island, the historic r√∏nne power plant is set to be transformed into a dynamic hub for students, researchers, and companies.  

although the building currently appears a bit raw, the potential for this project is enormous!

bornholm has all the potential to make energy island bornholm a success.

the energy island project can gain broad public support if it ensures local value creation. for bornholm, success means fostering new jobs and business development around the project, contributing to a long-term economically sustainable future for the island. for denmark, the project could achieve national climate goals and lay the foundation for the next major export success by developing technological solutions for energy islands that serve as a model for all of europe.

bornholm is ready to take on this challenge, and the delegation expressed hope that national politicians share the vision and provide the necessary support to kickstart the project. with the right initial assistance, bornholm can drive forward the ambitions to realize these visions.

ùêÖùêöùê§ùêû ùêßùêûùê∞ùê¨ ùêûùê´ ùêûùêß ùê≠ùê´ùêÆùê¨ùê¨ùêûùê• ùêüùê®ùê´ ùêùùêûùêß ùê†ùê´√∏ùêßùêßùêû ùê®ùê¶ùê¨ùê≠ùê¢ùê•ùê•ùê¢ùêßùê†
Lobbyisme er en forventelig og efterh√•nden integreret del af den gr√∏nne omstilling, hvor der p√• nogle omr√•der har vist sig at v√¶re mange milliarder af st√∏ttekroner i spil. Det er naturligvis fair, at man fors√∏ger at flytte den politiske opm√¶rksomhed over p√• netop sin sag, men der er en klar gr√¶nse mellem sandt og falskt, som ikke b√∏r overskrides. 

Direkt√∏ren i Baltic Energy Island er klart g√•et over denne streg, n√•r han den 7. december siger til Bornholms Tidende, at Energi√∏ Bornholm er et godt projekt rent samfunds√∏konomisk. Det er der nemlig absolut intet, der tyder p√•. Energistyrelsens seneste rentabilitetsanalyse viste et samfunds√∏konomisk underskud p√• hele 7 mia. kr., og den seneste udvikling i markedet for havvind tyder p√•, at dette underskud er blevet meget st√∏rre. Samtidig har de √∏konomiske vism√¶nd specifikt anbefalet at droppe Energi√∏ Bornholm p√• baggrund af den negative samfunds√∏konomi.

En ting er, at det fagligt st√∏der os, der dagligt arbejder med at dokumentere beregninger og nidk√¶rt freml√¶gge de bagvedliggende metoder. Men noget andet og langt v√¶rre er, at samfundets opbakning til investeringer i den gr√∏nne omstilling risikerer at forsvinde op i den varme luft.

Det er afg√∏rende for at n√• i m√•l med den gr√∏nne omstilling, at b√•de politikere og befolkningen kan stole p√• de tal og udsagn, der kommer fra b√•de uafh√¶ngige akt√∏rer og lobbyister. Hvis man begynder at opfinde sine egne tal og servere dem som facts, forsvinder trov√¶rdigheden fra alle akt√∏rer, og de politikere, der skal tr√¶ffe beslutninger i en uhyggeligt kompleks situation, f√•r en n√¶rmest umulig opgave i at finde de bedste og mest omkostningseffektive l√∏sninger. 

I sidste ende kan fake news forringe, forsinke og fordyre den gr√∏nne omstilling. Kraka Economics insisterer p√• at f√• en trov√¶rdig og fagligt funderet debat om, hvad der skal prioriteres, og hvad der ikke skal. Det er i sidste ende i alles interesse. 

hashtag#dkpol hashtag#dk√∏ko hashtag#dkgreen hashtag#dkbiz
column5:
kraka economics asserts that fake news poses a significant threat to the green transition and emphasizes the critical need for truthful and reliable information in this complex process. lobbyism is an expected and integral part of the green transition, especially when billions in subsidies are at stake. while it is fair for stakeholders to advocate for their interests, crossing the line between truth and falsehood is unacceptable.

kraka economics strongly criticizes the director of baltic energy island for claiming in bornholms tidende on december 7 that the bornholm energy island project is socially profitable. according to kraka economics, this claim is entirely unsupported. the danish energy agency‚Äôs most recent profitability analysis revealed a social economic deficit of 7 billion dkk for the project, and developments in the offshore wind market suggest that the deficit has grown even larger. furthermore, denmark‚Äôs economic councils have explicitly recommended abandoning the bornholm energy island due to its negative social economic impact.

kraka economics is particularly concerned that such false claims undermine the trust required to advance the green transition. trust in data and statements from independent experts and lobbyists alike is essential for both politicians and the public to support green investments. fabricated numbers presented as facts erode credibility, making it nearly impossible for decision-makers to identify the most cost-effective and impactful solutions in a highly complex situation.

in the long run, fake news can harm, delay, and increase the costs of the green transition. kraka economics calls for a credible and fact-based debate about priorities in the green transition, as this is in everyone‚Äôs best interest.
column13: Who benefits socially and economically from energy islands? Is it fair?

Den politiske aftale bag Energi√∏ Bornholm indebar, at indt√¶gter fra det nu kuldsejlede udbud i Nords√∏en skulle bruges til at finansiere en del af det abnorme st√∏ttebehov, som er n√∏dvendigt for, at nogen vil byde p√• dette projekt. Vores forventning er, at regningen til E√òB nu er minimum 40 mia. kr., da den nylige udskydelse af vindm√∏lleudbuddet p√• energi√∏en tyder p√• en yderligere forringelse af √∏konomien. Samtidig er finansieringselementet p√• forventet 8,7 mia. kr. sandsynligvis ikke-eksisterende med denne nul-budssituation i Nords√∏en, da der n√¶ppe heller kommer bud p√• de resterende 3 GW med budfrist i april.
 
Denne udvikling har f√•et selv brancheorganisationen Dansk Erhverv til at √•bne d√∏ren for, at man udskyder og gent√¶nker energi√∏en. Forligskredsen bag Energi√∏ Bornholm b√∏r hurtigst muligt forholde sig aktivt til denne fortvivlende √∏konomiske udvikling, for inden l√¶nge skal Energinet underskrive kontrakter for det lange kabel mellem Sj√¶lland og Bornholm, og hvis f√∏rst det er gjort, bliver det for alvor dyrt at droppe projektet.

column5:
kraka economics views the bornholm energy island project as an increasingly obvious economic failure, particularly in light of the lack of bids for the 3 gw offshore wind tender in the north sea. the political agreement behind the bornholm energy island assumed that revenues from the now-failed north sea tender would partially finance the significant subsidy requirements for the project. 

kraka economics estimates that the total cost of subsidies for the bornholm energy island now stands at a minimum of 40 billion dkk, as the recent postponement of the wind turbine tender for the energy island indicates further economic deterioration. additionally, the expected financing element of 8.7 billion dkk is likely no longer viable given the zero-bid situation in the north sea, and it is improbable that bids will be received for the remaining 3 gw by the april deadline.

this situation has prompted even the industry organization dansk erhverv to suggest delaying and rethinking the bornholm energy island project. kraka economics calls on the political parties supporting the bornholm energy island to urgently address this dire economic situation. failure to act soon could result in energinet signing contracts for the long cable between zealand and bornholm, making it prohibitively expensive to cancel the project later.
column13: How to finance the energy islands?

column5:
kraka economics highlights that while offshore wind can now be developed without subsidies, a political majority has decided to establish the bornholm energy island with a state subsidy of 31.5 billion dkk. this means that by choosing traditional offshore wind projects instead, denmark could generate the same amount of electricity while saving 31.5 billion dkk.

kraka economics emphasizes that these savings could be redirected toward other political priorities. for example, the denmark democrats could use the 31.5 billion dkk to advance their key policy initiatives.

the analysis underscores that denmark does not need to choose between clean energy and other political goals. by abandoning the bornholm energy island and focusing on unsubsidized offshore wind, denmark could achieve both‚Äîsecuring the same energy output while funding additional priorities.

Gr√∏n omstilling er en mulighed for erhvervsudvikling
Energi√∏en medf√∏rer store muligheder for v√¶kst p√• Bornholm ‚Äì og netop disse potentialer var baggrunden for erhvervsminister Morten B√∏dskovs bes√∏g den 28. august. 

Ministeren bes√∏gte bornholmske virksomheder, der allerede arbejder aktivt med opgaver og potentialer i energi√∏en, bl.a Task Engineering Gmbh, og deltog i et m√∏de med partnerskabet bag erhvervsfyrt√•rn Bornholm p√• R√∏nne Elv√¶rk, hvor fonden Baltic Energy Island holder til.

M√∏det i partnerskabet havde fokus p√• realisering af en gr√∏n energi-erhvervspark i forbindelse med Energi√∏ Bornholms landanl√¶g. Den vil kunne skabe bornholmske arbejdspladser, v√¶re en platform for teknologisk innovation og give inspiration til andre yderomr√•der, der i fremtiden vil l√¶gge areal til gr√∏n energi. Hertil ogs√• vigtigheden af at sikre, at de bornholmske virksomheder gennem samarbejde og professionalisering, kan f√• del i opgaverne i relation til Energi√∏ Bornholm.

Om m√∏det siger Christa Lodahl:
‚ÄùDet er enormt vigtigt at der er fokus p√• de potentialer, den gr√∏nne omstilling og energi√∏en b√¶rer med sig ‚Äì og ikke mindst hvordan vi her p√• Bornholm kan styrke hele √∏en. At erhvervsministeren b√•de forst√•r og st√∏tter vores muligheder og udfordringer, betyder derfor meget.‚Äù

Hos Business Center Bornholm er vi glade for fortsat at v√¶re en del af erhvervsfyrt√•rnet, s√• vi kan sikre mest mulig udvikling, til gavn for Bornholm.
column5:
the green transition presents a significant opportunity for business development. the energy island project brings enormous growth potential to bornholm, as highlighted during minister of industry morten b√∏dskov's visit on august 28.  

the minister visited bornholm-based companies, such as task engineering gmbh, which are already actively engaged with tasks and opportunities related to the energy island. he also participated in a meeting with the partnership behind business lighthouse bornholm at r√∏nne's old power plant, which houses the baltic energy island foundation.  

the meeting focused on creating a green energy business park connected to energy island bornholm‚Äôs onshore facilities. this park could generate local jobs, serve as a platform for technological innovation, and inspire other peripheral regions to develop areas for green energy. key topics included attracting skilled labor and transforming r√∏nne‚Äôs old power plant into a residential college and hub for energy island stakeholders.  

christa lodahl, business director at business center bornholm, presented initiatives targeted at small and medium-sized enterprises (smes). these include increasing innovation capacity among local companies through collaborations with students from institutions like dtu, innovation tracks in biogas and surplus heat, digital mapping, and positioning bornholm as a logistics and service hub. ensuring that bornholm‚Äôs businesses, through collaboration and professionalization, can secure contracts related to energy island bornholm was emphasized.  

christa lodahl stated:  
‚Äúit is crucial to focus on the opportunities brought by the green transition and the energy island, and how we can strengthen the entire island. the industry minister‚Äôs understanding and support for our opportunities and challenges mean a great deal.‚Äù  

at business center bornholm, we are proud to remain part of the business lighthouse initiative to ensure maximum development for the benefit of bornholm.

Det er en politisk katastrofe, at der ikke kom nogen bud p√• de 3 GW havvind i Nords√∏en. Men det er afg√∏rende for den gr√∏nne omstilling i Danmark, at politikerne nu ikke g√•r i panik, selvom alt efterh√•nden er brudt sammen - fra PtX til havvind. Ukloge beslutninger p√• stribe har f√∏rt os et sted hen, vi ikke burde v√¶re. 
 
Politikerne b√∏r bruge markedets afvisning af 3 GW havvindudbud som en chance til at begynde forfra og g√∏re det rigtigt:

 ‚óæ Design et mere simpelt og klassisk udbud, som vi kender det fra tidligere. Et, hvor der ikke er sk√¶ve ansvarsforhold, og hvor eventuelle forsinkelser betales af den, som er √•rsagen hertil. Hvor bydere ‚Äì da rentabilitet svinger omkring nul kroner ‚Äì b√•de f√•r lov at konkurrere med bidrag til statskassen og bidrag fra statskassen. Der b√∏r v√¶re en reel markedsafpr√∏vning. 
 
 ‚óæ Statsligt ejerskab er un√∏dvendigt og opfundet i den politiske malstr√∏m, bl.a. gennem d√•rlig r√•dgivning af politikerne. Det g√∏r det un√∏digt kompliceret og uklart for opstillerne, hvad de kan forvente. Der er ingen grund til, at staten skal drive havvindsvirksomhed. S√¶rligt ikke som minoritetsejer uden indflydelse. Staten og danskerne kan f√• del i gevinsterne via beskatning eller i selve udbudsprocessen. Desuden b√∏r man fravige modellen med at p√•l√¶gge opstillerne risici, de ikke selv kan p√•virke.
 
 ‚óæ Planl√¶g i den rigtige r√¶kkef√∏lge: Udbud og eftersp√∏rgsel skal f√∏lges ad, s√• Danmark har nu mulighed for ogs√• at f√• afklaring p√• brintr√∏r og PtX. Det har markedsakt√∏rerne efterspurgt, og de har en god pointe her. Det hele er hidtil foreg√•et i silokamre, ingen samt√¶nkning af de forskellige elementer af klimapolitikken - det er opskriften p√• katastrofe. En katastrofe, som koster mange penge og menneskelige spildte ressourcer. 
 
 ‚óæ Lav udbud i mere j√¶vnt stabilt tempo i takt med, at markedet signalerer appetit, s√• man undg√•r flaskehalsproblematikker. Udstik i stedet en langsigtet og gennemskuelig retning, der betrygger markedet i, at der er en kontinuerlig forretning.
 
Klima-, Energi- og Forsyningsminister Lars Aagaard kan dog grundl√¶ggende ikke se, hvordan forl√∏bet kunne have v√¶ret bedre, siger han til Jyllands-Posten. Det m√• siges at v√¶re b√•de skr√¶mmende naivt og en enormt d√•rlig undskyldning ‚Äì der har floreret rygter om utilfredshed med udbuddet og potentielt manglende bud l√¶nge. Det er p√• tide, at han sammen med regeringen tager fat i rorpinden i stedet for blot at lukke √∏jnene og h√•be p√• det bedste. 
 
Det er vigtigt at huske, at udbud stadig er den rette vej at g√•. Det m√• staten ikke fravige i fremtidige udbygningsplaner af vedvarende energi. Selv i det tilf√¶lde, at havvind kr√¶ver en vis st√∏tte, b√∏r man stadig gennemf√∏re det med udbud, men s√• l√¶nge man bev√¶ger sig i et st√∏tteregime, er det endnu mere afg√∏rende at diskutere, hvor meget havvind man vil k√∏be til resten af Europa.

column5:
kraka economics views the lack of bids for 3 gw of offshore wind in the north sea as a political and structural failure but also as an opportunity to reset denmark‚Äôs approach to the green transition. kraka economics recommends the following actions to rectify the situation and improve future renewable energy projects:

1. simplify the auction design: design a simpler and more conventional tender process that avoids imbalanced responsibilities and places financial accountability for delays on the responsible party. the tender should allow bidders to compete for both contributions to the state and subsidies, creating a fair market test.

2. eliminate state ownership: state ownership in offshore wind is unnecessary and complicates the process. politically driven models, such as partial state ownership with minimal influence, add confusion for developers. instead, denmark can capture economic gains through taxation or during the tender process without operating as a minority owner.

3. coordinate supply and demand: align auctions with clear plans for hydrogen pipelines and power-to-x (ptx) infrastructure. market actors have long called for integrated planning rather than the current disjointed approach, which wastes resources and creates inefficiencies.

4. stabilize auction timelines: conduct tenders at a steady pace aligned with market demand to avoid bottlenecks and ensure the industry has confidence in a predictable long-term strategy.

kraka economics criticizes denmark‚Äôs climate, energy, and utilities minister lars aagaard for downplaying the failures of the tender process despite longstanding warnings of its flaws. kraka economics urges the government to take proactive leadership to correct these issues rather than continuing to overlook them.

finally, kraka economics emphasizes that tenders remain the optimal approach for renewable energy expansion. even if offshore wind requires subsidies, tenders should be used to determine the level of support while also evaluating how much capacity denmark should develop for export to europe.

these adjustments, kraka economics argues, will create a more efficient, cost-effective, and reliable framework for denmark‚Äôs green transition.

column3:
S√•dan skrev De √∏konomiske vism√¶nd om Energi√∏ Bornholm i deres efter√•rsrapport 2024. I samme omb√¶ring anbefalede de, at man medtager flere effekter i den samfunds√∏konomisk vurdering, bl.a. forsyningssikkerhed.

Vi har derfor fors√∏gt at sandsynligg√∏re, om gevinsterne ved √∏get forsyningssikkerhed er nok til at forsvare projektets skrantende √∏konomi. Til det er svaret nej. 

Det skyldes grundl√¶ggende:
‚óæ Projektet har et samfunds√∏konomisk underskud p√• 7 mia. kr., mens et forsigtigt bud p√• projektets forbedring af forsyningssikkerheden har en v√¶rdi p√• cirka 3 mia. kr.
‚óæ En analyse fra Energinet viser f√¶rre problemer med effekttilstr√¶kkeligheden (om der er str√∏m nok) fremadrettet, end tidligere antaget.
‚óæ Det er prim√¶rt udlandskablet til Tyskland, der bidrager til forsyningssikkerheden. Det er dog sv√¶rt at forestille sig, at det ikke kunne f√•s billigere end via en omvej over Bornholm.
‚óæ Klimar√•det har tidligere p√•peget, at udlandsforbindelser ikke er den mest effektive m√•de at √∏ge forsyningssikkerheden, da solen skinner, og vinden bl√¶ser p√• nogenlunde samme tid i vores nabolande. Der er derfor stor sandsynlighed for, at de vil mangle str√∏m p√• samme tidspunkter.

Selv hvis nye samfunds√∏konomiske beregninger mod forventning viser positiv samfunds√∏konomi, b√∏r man som altid sammenligne med alternativer, der l√∏ser samme opgave. Her er det ikke vores vurdering, at Energi√∏ Bornholm er det projekt, der l√∏ser opgaven bedst.

Vi vurderer derfor, at √∏get forsyningssikkerhed n√¶ppe er tilstr√¶kkeligt til at forsvare energi√∏en. N√•r det er sagt, er det en god ide at f√• emnet gennemanalyseret af Energistyrelsen. Der er dog ikke lang tid til, at Energinet skal underskrive kontrakter p√• infrastruktur fx elkablet mellem Sj√¶lland og Bornholm, og derfor er det vigtigt, at man s√¶tter hele projektet p√• pause, indtil analyserne er f√¶rdige. Det bliver nemlig markant dyrere at droppe projektet, hvis man f√∏rst har indg√•et kontrakter p√• dyr infrastruktur.

column5:
kraka economics argues that increased energy security does not justify the poor economic viability of the energy island bornholm project. the key points underlying this conclusion are:

1. economic deficit: the energy island bornholm project has a societal economic deficit of 7 billion dkk, while the potential improvement in energy security is conservatively valued at only 3 billion dkk.

2. decreasing urgency for energy security: analysis from energinet indicates that future concerns about power adequacy are less severe than previously believed.

3. inefficient contribution from foreign interconnectors: the interconnector to germany contributes most to energy security, but the same result could likely be achieved at a lower cost without routing through bornholm.

4. limited effectiveness of foreign interconnectors: the danish climate council has noted that interconnectors to neighboring countries are not the most effective way to improve energy security because weather conditions (like sunshine and wind) tend to align across the region, meaning power shortages are likely to occur simultaneously.

kraka economics emphasizes that even if new calculations unexpectedly show a positive societal economic outcome, alternative solutions should always be considered. in this context, kraka economics does not believe that the energy island bornholm project is the optimal choice for enhancing energy security.

kraka economics recommends pausing the energy island bornholm project to allow time for a thorough analysis by the danish energy agency. however, kraka economics warns that contracts for costly infrastructure, such as the electrical cable between zealand and bornholm, are imminent. if these contracts are signed, it will become significantly more expensive to cancel the project later. therefore, the government must act swiftly to halt the project until all analyses are completed.
column13: Energy security: will we have a stable energy supply?

I fredags havde vi forn√∏jelsen af bes√∏g fra Folketinget. Klima-, Energi- og Forsyningsordf√∏rer Anne Paulin og Besk√¶ftigelsesordf√∏rer Henrik M√∏ller var p√• bes√∏g.
Kim Nielsen, formand for Partnerskab for B√∏lgekraft var ogs√• inviteret med.
Michael Henriksen viste rundt p√• kontoret og gav en status p√• udviklingen hos Wavepiston og b√∏lgeenergisektoren.
Vi fik snakket om klima-, energi- og forsyningspolitik og hvordan b√∏lgeenergi kan v√¶re en del af l√∏sningen til at n√• vores energi- og klimam√•l, herunder det store potentiale, der ligger i forbindelse med energi√∏erne i Nords√∏en. P√• det allerede afsatte omr√•de kan vi √∏ge kapaciteten med 2 GW og sikre gr√∏n str√∏m til yderligere 1 ‚Äì 2 mio. husstande.
Vi har brug for flere vedvarende energiressourcer, og b√∏lgeenergi komplementerer vind og sol. Energien er til r√•dighed st√∏rre del af tiden, er mere stabil, er nemmere at forudsige, er tidsm√¶ssigt forskudt ift. vind, og b√∏lgerne ruller ogs√• om natten. Vi skal i gang, ogs√• i Danmark.
Mange tak for bes√∏get og den gode stemning, Anne og Henrik. Vi ser frem til et godt samarbejde om l√∏sninger til klima- og energikrisen og sikre stor besk√¶ftigelse i Danmark indenfor vedvarende energi.

column5:
wavepiston believes that wave energy can play a significant role in addressing denmark's energy and climate goals, particularly in relation to the north sea energy islands. by utilizing the already allocated area, wavepiston asserts that wave energy capacity could increase by 2 gw, providing green electricity to an additional 1‚Äì2 million households. 

wavepiston emphasizes that wave energy is a crucial complement to wind and solar power, offering several advantages: it is available for longer periods, more stable, easier to predict, operates on a different time schedule than wind energy, and continues to generate power at night. wavepiston calls for immediate action to integrate wave energy into denmark's renewable energy strategy, highlighting its potential to create substantial employment opportunities in the renewable energy sector while tackling the climate and energy crises.

column5: the danish ministry of climate, energy, and utilities is collaborating with polish authorities to initiate analyses for a potential international energy connection between poland and energy island bornholm. the visit by poland's deputy minister for climate and environment, mi≈Çosz motyka, focused on discussing ways to enhance cooperation between poland and denmark in expanding renewable energy in the baltic sea and improving energy security. the planned connection between poland and denmark could significantly contribute to the goals of the marienborg declaration, strengthening collaboration in the baltic sea region and bolstering energy security for both countries and the broader region.

NYHEDSBREV: HVORDAN UDPEGER ENERGINET STEDER TIL H√òJSP√ÜNDINGSSTATION‚ùìü§∑‚ôÄÔ∏è

Hvordan er jordbundsforholdene‚ùì Er der diger og fortidsminder‚ùì Hvad med boliger og veje, kabler og r√∏r‚ùì 

Der er mange hensyn at tage, n√•r Energinet skal finde det bedst egnede sted til ny h√∏jsp√¶ndingsstation. Lige nu er processen i gang for de nye anl√¶g, der skal opf√∏res p√• land i forbindelse med Energi√∏ Bornholm og Energi√∏ Nords√∏en. Energi√∏erne er et k√¶mpe skridt p√• vejen mod den gr√∏nne omstilling.

Og gr√∏n omstilling har en pris, for s√•dan en h√∏jsp√¶ndingsstation fylder godt i landskabet. 

Energinet har peget p√• omr√•der p√• Bornholm, p√• Sj√¶lland og i Jylland som velegnede til nye anl√¶g. Hvordan vi finder frem til de steder, der er mest velegnede, kan man l√¶se mere om i Energi√∏ernes nyhedsbrev
column5: energinet is currently identifying the best locations for new high-voltage stations required for the danish energy islands, including energy island bornholm and energy island north sea. this process considers factors such as soil conditions, the presence of dikes and historical landmarks, as well as proximity to housing, roads, cables, and pipelines. the energy islands represent a significant step in denmark's green transition, though establishing high-voltage stations has a visual impact on the landscape. energinet has identified potential areas on bornholm, zealand, and jutland for these facilities. further details about the site selection process are available in the energy islands newsletter.

column3:
I dag kan vi sammen med √òrsted og Per Aarsleff A/S l√∏fte sl√∏ret for vores visioner for Nords√∏ens Energi√∏.

N√•r vi bygger en energi√∏ i Nords√∏en handler det ikke kun om at bygge et nyt stykke Danmark. Det handler i h√∏jere grad om, hvordan vi g√∏r det danske energisystem robust, n√•r det en dag er baseret udelukkende p√• vedvarende energi.

Vores l√∏sning er et modul√¶rt koncept: en lille indd√¶mmet √∏, der udbygges med fleksible moduler, som l√∏bende kan tilf√∏jes og udskiftes efter behov. Helt konkret kan disse moduler bygges p√• land og derefter sejles ud i Nords√∏en og kobles til √∏en. Det er i princippet ikke meget anderledes end at tage en ny legoklods fra kassen og bygge ud.

Danmark f√•r p√• den m√•de en energi√∏, der allerede fra start er klar til en ukendt teknologisk fremtid, og som i √•rtier fremover kan v√¶re krumtappen i Danmarks verdensledende tilgang til klimahandling. 

Samtidig passer investeringen godt til ATP, der som Danmarks st√∏rste, gr√∏nne investor har fokus p√• at skabe reel, b√¶redygtig forandring gennem langsigtede, balancerede beslutninger og gr√∏nne investeringer.

‚ÄùVi tror p√•, at fleksibiliteten i vores koncept er en stor fordel og skaber en rigtig god, klimavenlig energil√∏sning. Det er helt afg√∏rende, n√•r vi g√•r ind i en langsigtet investering som denne,‚Äù siger Claus Wiinblad, vicedirekt√∏r i ATP.

‚ÄùGrundlaget er til stede for at skabe et fornuftigt, risikojusteret afkast, og samtidig investerer vi i den gr√∏nne omstilling. P√• den m√•de matcher Nords√∏ens energi√∏ b√•de ATP‚Äôs klimaambitioner og m√•ls√¶tningen om at skabe de bedst mulige pensioner.‚Äù 

P√• billedet: Rasmus Errboe, Regionsdirekt√∏r for Kontinentaleuropa i √òrsted, Claus Wiinblad og Jesper Kristian Jacobsen , administrerende direkt√∏r i Per Aarsleff A/S,
column5:
atp, in collaboration with √∏rsted and per aarsleff a/s, envisions the north sea energy island as more than just a physical construction‚Äîit is a critical step in strengthening denmark‚Äôs energy system to operate entirely on renewable energy in the future. the proposed solution is a modular concept: a small reclaimed island that can be expanded with flexible modules built on land and transported to the north sea for integration. this modular approach allows adaptability to future technological advancements, ensuring the energy island remains a cornerstone of denmark‚Äôs climate leadership for decades.

as denmark‚Äôs largest green investor, atp emphasizes the importance of sustainable, long-term decisions. the flexibility of this modular design offers a climate-friendly energy solution, aligning with atp‚Äôs commitment to creating meaningful, sustainable change. according to claus wiinblad, vice director at atp, this project balances atp‚Äôs climate ambitions with its goal of achieving risk-adjusted returns and delivering the best possible pensions while advancing the green transition.
column13: Are energy islands a good investment for innovation and economic growth?

column3:
I dag har √òrsted + ATP og partnere pr√¶senteret sit koncept for Nords√∏ens Energi√∏. Det bliver en √∏ i konstant udvikling, selv efter den er bygget f√¶rdig. Et dynamisk stykke Danmarkshistorie, der er designet til at blive krumtappen i den gr√∏nne omstilling.
 
Nords√∏ens Energi√∏ best√•r af en lille indd√¶mmet √∏, der udbygges med fleksible moduler, som l√∏bende kan tilf√∏jes og udskiftes efter behov. Moduler bygges p√• land og tilkobles √∏en, s√• den let kan opgraderes til at forbinde mere end de 10 gigawatt havvind, der er Danmarks nuv√¶rende ambition, ligesom den kan tilpasses til at rumme den rivende udvikling inden for Power-to-X og andre teknologier i b√•de 2030 og 2050.
 
‚ÄùMed dette koncept har vi taget kendte teknologier og byggemetoder og sammensat dem p√• en ny, intelligent og banebrydende m√•de tilpasset det barske milj√∏ i Nords√∏en. Det betyder, at vi kan give danskerne en energi√∏, som kan sikre en enorm skalering af havvind, som fra start er klar til fremtidige behov‚Äù, siger Jesper Kristian Jacobsen, administrerende direkt√∏r i Aarsleff, der leder entrepren√∏rkonsortiet, som udover Aarsleff best√•r af Van Oord fra Holland og Bouygues Construction fra Frankrig.
 
Visionen er at bygge mere end bare en √∏. Vi vil skabe en √∏, der er i konstant udvikling. En fremtidssikret √∏, hvor der vil v√¶re ubegr√¶nset plads til innovation og tilpasning, i takt med at den gr√∏nne omstilling udvikler sig.
column5:
√∏rsted, atp, and their partners have presented a concept for the north sea energy island, envisioned as an ever-evolving project even after its initial construction. this dynamic piece of denmark‚Äôs history is designed to be the cornerstone of the green transition.

the north sea energy island will start as a small reclaimed island, expandable with flexible modules that can be added or replaced as needed. these modules are constructed on land and seamlessly connected to the island, enabling scalability to handle more than denmark's current ambition of 10 gigawatts of offshore wind. the design also supports advancements in technologies such as power-to-x, making it adaptable to needs in both 2030 and 2050.

according to jesper kristian jacobsen, ceo of aarsleff, the concept combines known technologies and construction methods in an innovative way suited for the harsh north sea environment. this ensures the delivery of an energy island capable of significant offshore wind scaling and prepared for future requirements. the vision is to build more than just an island‚Äîa future-proof hub for innovation and adaptation as the green transition progresses.

EN STATION TAGER FORM üíö
Hjertet i Energi√∏ Bornholm - omformerstationen syd for Aakirkeby - har flyttet sig endnu et skridt fra tegnebr√¶t mod virkelighed:
I denne uge har vi p√• et borgerm√∏de pr√¶senteret Energinets bud p√•, hvordan hele landanl√¶gget skal se ud. 

Det var den forel√∏bige kulmination p√• en proces med to workshops, hvor bornholmerne har kunnet dele deres bekymringer og ideer til, hvordan stationen skal udformes.
Landanl√¶gget bliver stort, og ikke alle er glade for design og placering. Men vi har fors√∏gt at indarbejde mange af de input, vi har f√•et undervejs - og at tage hensyn til naboer og omgivelser.

Der kan stadig blive √¶ndret lidt p√• nogle detaljer. Det bliver dog dette udkast - med dets principper for stationens udseende og indpasning i landskabet - som danner grundlag for den ans√∏gning om lokalplan, som Energinet snart sender til Bornholms Regionskommune. Efter administrativ og politisk behandling gennemf√∏res en offentlig h√∏ring, inden lokalplanen kan vedtages, formentlig til juni n√¶ste √•r.
column5:
energinet is making progress on the development of the energy island bornholm's onshore converter station, located south of aakirkeby. this week, energinet presented its proposal for the design of the entire onshore facility at a public meeting, marking a significant step from concept to reality.

the proposal is the result of a process that included two workshops where local residents from bornholm shared their concerns and ideas about the station's design. while the facility will be large, and not everyone is satisfied with its design and location, energinet has incorporated many of the inputs received during the process, striving to address the concerns of neighbors and the surrounding environment.

some minor adjustments may still be made to the details. however, the current draft, with its principles for the station‚Äôs appearance and integration into the landscape, will form the basis for the local planning application that energinet will soon submit to bornholm‚Äôs regional municipality. following administrative and political review, a public hearing will be conducted before the local plan is expected to be adopted, likely by june next year.

column5:
jesper thiesen questions the presence of responsible political leadership in addressing climate challenges, highlighting serious delays and shortcomings in denmark's energy transition. the recent tender for 6 gw of offshore wind capacity received no applications, reflecting the lack of preparedness and investment in critical technologies and infrastructure. 

the ambitious goal of reducing denmark‚Äôs co2 emissions by 70% to meet the paris agreement targets appears increasingly unattainable. the north sea energy island project has stalled, with its foundational technology and infrastructure unlikely to be operational before 2030. similarly, power-to-x technologies remain far from being ready for industrial-scale deployment, requiring substantial investment that has not been prioritized.

jesper thiesen criticizes reliance on biofuels, which worsen denmark‚Äôs co2 balance, and emphasizes the need for a shift from superficial measures to substantive investments in renewable energy and battery storage. he warns that with the current trajectory, the cop21 target of limiting global warming to 1.5 degrees celsius is unrealistic, and even staying below 2 degrees is doubtful.

thiesen advocates for honesty about the challenges ahead, calling for discussions on mitigating consequences, such as protecting denmark from rising sea levels, and reinvigorating efforts to position the country as a global leader in green innovation. he highlights the predictable risks of inadequate bids and overreliance on biofuels, stressing the urgency for actionable leadership to ensure denmark fulfills its climate ambitions.
column13: Who benefits socially and economically from energy islands? Is it fair?

column3:
I dag er samarbejdet omkring energi√∏er i √òsters√∏en blevet styrket med underskrivelse af Letter Of Intent. 

Gotland, √Öland og Bornholm har mange af de samme udfordringer og ikke mindst muligheder ‚Äì for vi st√•r alle over for at se ind i en fremtid som energi√∏, hvor vi i l√∏bet af f√• √•r vil rykke fra periferi til centrum af en ny energivirkelighed.

Sammen skal vi finde ud af, hvordan vi h√•ndterer den nye virkelighed, hvor den gr√∏nne omstilling ikke blot er lokal, men en central foruds√¶tning for den gr√∏nne omstilling i hele EU.

Jeg gl√¶der mig over det nye samarbejde og de muligheder, det giver os.

- continuing the residential college bornholm program to enhance energy island-related skills among university students, vocational trainees, and employees in bornholm businesses.

Det er blot nogle f√• af de fund, som allerede er dukket op af den bornholmske muld, siden Bornholms Museum i maj 2023 begyndte ark√¶ologiske forunders√∏gelser ved Aakirkeby, hvor landanl√¶gget til #Energi√∏Bornholm skal bygges.

Et √•r og 350 s√∏gegr√∏fter senere har museet nu afsluttet den f√∏rste af to etaper af de ark√¶ologiske unders√∏gelser. 
I et omr√•de p√• knap 120 hektar har Bornholms Museum - p√• baggrund af forunders√∏gelserne - peget p√• et omr√•de p√• mere end 35 hektar til udgravninger. 

Udgravningerne kommer til at blive de st√∏rste nogensinde p√• Bornholm. Museet er nu i gang med at planl√¶gge, hvorn√•r og hvordan det skal g√• for sig. En stor opgave. Men ogs√• en enest√•ende mulighed for at afd√¶kke og sikre viden om Bornholms fortid.

Forunders√∏gelserne har allerede givet overblik over kulturlandskabet i omr√•det op til 6.000 √•r tilbage. De har vist spor tilbage til bondestenalderen, hvor agerbruget kom med de f√∏rste b√∏nder over √òsters√∏en - samt til bronzealder, jernalder og vikingetid. column5:
energinet highlights the unique archaeological insights provided by the energy island bornholm project. since may 2023, bornholms museum has conducted preliminary archaeological investigations at aakirkeby, where the onshore facility for energy island bornholm will be built. these investigations have already uncovered a wealth of artifacts, including flint tools from the stone age, a miniature cannon, and a spindle whorl from the viking age.

after a year and 350 exploratory trenches, the first of two investigation phases has been completed. out of a 120-hectare area surveyed, more than 35 hectares have been identified for excavation, marking the largest archaeological dig ever undertaken on bornholm. the museum is now planning the timeline and methods for this significant endeavor, which offers an unparalleled opportunity to uncover and preserve knowledge of bornholm‚Äôs history.

the investigations have already mapped cultural landscapes dating back 6,000 years, revealing traces of the neolithic period, when agriculture arrived via the first farmers crossing the baltic sea, as well as artifacts from the bronze age, iron age, and viking age. finds include flint tools, pottery shards, coins, jewelry, weapons, over 100 houses, settlements, and several graves.

the danish government has decided to explore new concepts for the energy island in the north sea because building an artificial island is too costly and risky for the state. the focus is now on a solution where the core infrastructure of the energy island‚Äîsuch as electrical converters and systems for receiving and transmitting offshore wind power to multiple countries‚Äîcould be placed on platforms made of steel.

column5:
i think denmark should proceed with building the world‚Äôs first true energy island, as this is a unique and groundbreaking project. the energy island has the potential to become the most significant public-private partnership in danish history. 

private actors such as pfa, pensiondanmark, andel, and copenhagen infrastructure partners are ready to invest both capital and effort to turn this vision into reality. the energy island will serve as a hub for 10 gw of offshore wind power while providing harbor and housing facilities for maintenance ships and personnel. additionally, it will foster large-scale innovation in energy storage and power-to-x technologies.

i think the comparison to a traditional steel platform is best summarized by tommy ahlers, who explains that when the costs of constructing 3 gw of offshore wind power are the same, the energy island provides far more flexibility and opportunities for future development. therefore, it makes sense to prioritize the island, which is more innovative and could position denmark to lead in creating an entirely new industry, gaining valuable experience as the first nation to build such an island.

column5:
we believe the energy island bornholm project should be stopped due to its financial risks and lack of economic viability. energy island bornholm, initially presented as a profitable initiative, is now expected to be neither socio-economically nor project-economically sustainable. current calculations reveal a funding gap, with a support requirement of 31.5 billion dkk, despite the possibility of establishing other offshore wind projects without subsidies. politicians have set a subsidy ceiling of 17.6 billion dkk, leaving a shortfall of 14 billion dkk.

we believe the ongoing tendering process, for a project that appears underfunded, is highly risky. parts of the project have already been put to tender, and more tenders are expected throughout 2024. this means contracts may be signed before determining if the project is even feasible, potentially resulting in significant costs to withdraw.

this is one of three stories in our newsletter, which also explains, based on the latest productivity report from the economic councils of the wise, how green state subsidies benefit individual companies but increase the overall cost of the green transition for society. 

additionally, we appeal to politicians, media, and other stakeholders to rely on expert advice when addressing complex issues like the green transition.

if you also find it challenging to navigate the complexities of the green transition, we encourage you to subscribe to our newsletter. it provides economic analyses and commentary on current green transition challenges. you can sign up here: https://bit.ly/3vzopzm

we carefully evaluate multiple factors when determining the best locations for new high-voltage stations. these include soil conditions, the presence of dikes or ancient monuments, proximity to housing and roads, as well as existing cables and pipelines. 

this process is currently underway for new facilities being built onshore as part of energy island bornholm and energy island north sea. these energy islands represent a significant step forward in the green transition, but the transition does come with its challenges‚Äîsuch as the considerable landscape impact of high-voltage stations.

we have identified suitable areas on bornholm, zealand, and jutland for these new facilities. for a detailed explanation of how we select the most suitable locations, you can read more in the energy islands newsletter.

I dag kan vi sammen med √òrsted og Per Aarsleff A/S l√∏fte sl√∏ret for vores visioner for Nords√∏ens Energi√∏.

N√•r vi bygger en energi√∏ i Nords√∏en handler det ikke kun om at bygge et nyt stykke Danmark. Det handler i h√∏jere grad om, hvordan vi g√∏r det danske energisystem robust, n√•r det en dag er baseret udelukkende p√• vedvarende energi.

Vores l√∏sning er et modul√¶rt koncept: en lille indd√¶mmet √∏, der udbygges med fleksible moduler, som l√∏bende kan tilf√∏jes og udskiftes efter behov. Helt konkret kan disse moduler bygges p√• land og derefter sejles ud i Nords√∏en og kobles til √∏en. Det er i princippet ikke meget anderledes end at tage en ny legoklods fra kassen og bygge ud.

Danmark f√•r p√• den m√•de en energi√∏, der allerede fra start er klar til en ukendt teknologisk fremtid, og som i √•rtier fremover kan v√¶re krumtappen i Danmarks verdensledende tilgang til klimahandling. 

Samtidig passer investeringen godt til ATP, der som Danmarks st√∏rste, gr√∏nne investor har fokus p√• at skabe reel, b√¶redygtig forandring gennem langsigtede, balancerede beslutninger og gr√∏nne investeringer.

‚ÄùVi tror p√•, at fleksibiliteten i vores koncept er en stor fordel og skaber en rigtig god, klimavenlig energil√∏sning. Det er helt afg√∏rende, n√•r vi g√•r ind i en langsigtet investering som denne,‚Äù siger Claus Wiinblad, vicedirekt√∏r i ATP.

‚ÄùGrundlaget er til stede for at skabe et fornuftigt, risikojusteret afkast, og samtidig investerer vi i den gr√∏nne omstilling. P√• den m√•de matcher Nords√∏ens energi√∏ b√•de ATP‚Äôs klimaambitioner og m√•ls√¶tningen om at skabe de bedst mulige pensioner.‚Äù
column5:
today, together with √∏rsted and per aarsleff a/s, we are unveiling our vision for the north sea energy island.

building an energy island in the north sea is not just about creating a new piece of denmark‚Äîit is about ensuring that denmark‚Äôs energy system becomes resilient and fully based on renewable energy. 

our solution is a modular concept: a small, enclosed island that can be expanded with flexible modules, which can be added or replaced as needed. these modules can be constructed on land and then transported by sea to connect with the island. it‚Äôs similar to adding a new lego brick to an existing structure.

this approach provides denmark with an energy island designed to adapt to an unknown technological future and serve as the cornerstone of denmark‚Äôs world-leading climate strategy for decades to come.

the investment aligns perfectly with atp's focus as denmark‚Äôs largest green investor. our commitment is to drive sustainable change through long-term, balanced decisions and green investments.

"we believe the flexibility of this concept is a significant advantage, delivering a climate-friendly energy solution. flexibility is crucial in a long-term investment like this," says claus wiinblad, deputy director at atp.

"the foundation is in place to ensure a sound, risk-adjusted return, while simultaneously contributing to the green transition. in this way, the north sea energy island aligns with atp‚Äôs climate ambitions and our goal of securing the best possible pensions."

the heart of energy island bornholm‚Äîthe converter station south of aakirkeby‚Äîhas taken another step closer to becoming a reality. 

this week, we presented energinet's proposal for the complete onshore facility at a public meeting. this marks a significant milestone in a process that included two workshops where bornholm residents shared their concerns and ideas about the station's design.

the onshore facility will be large, and we understand that not everyone is happy with its design or location. however, we have made an effort to incorporate many of the inputs we received throughout the process and to consider the neighbors and the surrounding environment.

while some details may still change, this draft‚Äîwith its principles for the station‚Äôs appearance and integration into the landscape‚Äîwill form the basis for the local planning application that energinet will soon submit to bornholm‚Äôs regional municipality. following administrative and political review, a public consultation will be conducted before the local plan can be adopted, likely by june next year.

rwe denmark is proud to have won the historic thor offshore wind farm tender in 2021, which is a milestone not just for rwe but for offshore wind energy in denmark as a whole. regarding the future of energy production in denmark, the planned hydrogen pipeline between denmark and germany is a critical factor. this pipeline would ensure that surplus electricity from upcoming energy production can reach areas with a demand for energy. it allows for the conversion of surplus electricity into hydrogen, which can then be exported to germany and other european countries.

it is essential for the industry and denmark's green transition that the danish government provides clarity on the regulation of the hydrogen pipeline, including the cost of using the infrastructure. denmark is an exciting market for rwe, and rwe is deeply committed to advancing the green transition. rwe looks forward to continuing dialogue with the government and other authorities to create the best conditions for future offshore wind and hydrogen projects.

Vi b√∏r tage ved l√¶re af de kommuner, der er mestre i dette felt. üí°üèòÔ∏è

NEKST's anbefalinger peger i den rigtige retning, men har ikke nok fokus p√• √∏konomisk bel√∏nning lokalt. Det er vigtigt man i forhandlingerne om Energiparkernes rammer sikrer tilstr√¶kkelig lokal √∏konomisk gevinst, kombineret med nogle af anbefalingerne fra NEKST'en. üí∞‚úÖ

Landvind er vigtigst og langt billigt, og kan kombineres med solceller ‚òÄÔ∏è nogle steder. Forholdet er p√• √•rsplan cirka 65-70 procent vind, cirka 20-25 procent solcelle str√∏m og resten (1000-2000 timer) p√• fleksible kraftvarmev√¶rker baseret f.eks p√• biogas.
column4: Brian Vad Mathiesen, professor of energy planning at Aalborg University
column5:
the danish energy island projects must align with realistic energy needs and practical implementations. denmark‚Äôs ambitious goal to quadruple land-based renewable energy production to generate 48 twh of electricity by 2030 is unnecessary unless energy consumption expands significantly beyond 4-6 gw for electrolysis in power-to-x and data centers. other uses, like electric vehicles, heat pumps, and industrial electrification, are relatively minor in comparison to power-to-x demands. additionally, exporting more renewable energy is impractical since neighboring countries generate renewable energy at the same times.  

political ambitions to enable a fourfold increase in renewable energy are commendable, but private investors must drive this transformation while ensuring a balance between consumption and production. achieving this requires greater emphasis on local engagement, local economic rewards, and improved local planning processes. denmark should draw lessons from municipalities excelling in these areas.

nekst‚Äôs recommendations are a step in the right direction but lack sufficient focus on local economic incentives. it is crucial to secure adequate local economic benefits in negotiations about energy park frameworks, supplemented with selected nekst recommendations.

land-based wind power remains the most critical and cost-effective solution and can be complemented by solar power in certain areas. on an annual basis, approximately 65-70% of electricity should come from wind, 20-25% from solar power, and the remaining 1000-2000 hours from flexible combined heat and power plants powered by biogas.

column3:
Det er m√•ske det mest banebrydende projekt, vi har landet i de 15 √•r, vi har v√¶ret v√¶rt for forsknings- og demonstrationsprojekter, udtaler Claus M. Andresen, direkt√∏r i Bornholms Energi & Forsyning.
 
Kraftvarmev√¶rket p√• Skansevej i R√∏nne kommer snart til at l√¶gge bygninger til projektet Second Life for Powerplants. 

En r√¶kke europ√¶iske pionerer indenfor energiteknologi har teamet op for at l√∏se den st√∏rste udfordring i den b√¶redygtige omstilling: at opsamle og lagre energi fra sol og vind, s√• der ogs√• er str√∏m og varme p√• overskyede dage uden s√¶rligt meget vind. Budgettet er p√• 100 millioner kr. EU har bidraget med en st√∏tte p√• 60 mio. kroner.

Ideen bag Second Life for Powerplants er at genbruge kraftv√¶rkernes oprindelige teknologi ‚Äì og bygge videre p√• medarbejdernes kompetencer. Derfor genbruges dampturbine, generator, kontrolsystemer og adgangen til elnettet og fjernvarmenettet. Kraftv√¶rket f√•r tilf√∏rt tre nye forskellige lagringsteknologier: Et saltlager, brugte elbils-batterier og et h√∏jteknologisk svinghjuls-batteri (flywheel). Konceptets hjerte er et stykke avanceret styringssoftware, der skal s√∏rge for, at der i fremtiden altid vil v√¶re varme og str√∏m til r√•dighed ‚Äì selv p√• en overskyet dag, hvor flagene h√¶nger.

-         Vi vil f√• en uvurderlig viden om, hvordan vi i fremtiden skal h√•ndtere og gemme sol og vind - og hvordan vi effektivt kan sikre balance i elsystemet. Vi vil f√• h√•ndfast viden om, hvad der kr√¶ves for, at vi for alvor kan drage nytte af b√•de sol og vind - uden at det skulle blive v√¶sentligt dyrere for bornholmere. Vi vil f√• tydelige indikationer p√•, hvad der skal til af investeringer for, at vi endegyldigt kan sige farvel til olien og nedfase flisen, forklarer Claus M. Andersen. 

Claus M. Andersen peger p√•, at de erfaringer, projektet h√∏ster p√• Bornholm, let kan kopieres andre steder og g√∏re det langt lettere, billigere og hurtigere f.eks. at konvertere et polsk kulkraftv√¶rk til at v√¶re fremtidens fleksible energilager med sol og vind. 

-         At vi kan lande s√•dan et projekt p√• Bornholm, kunne indikere, at vi m√•ske b√∏r overveje at skrue lidt op for forventningerne til, hvor meget ekstra aktivitet p√• √∏en, den bornholmske energi√∏ kommer til at skabe, slutter Claus M. Andersen.
column5:
the second life for powerplants project may be the most groundbreaking initiative we have hosted in the 15 years bornholms energi & forsyning has been involved in research and demonstration projects. the combined heat and power plant on skansevej in r√∏nne will soon house this initiative, which brings together european pioneers in energy technology to address the greatest challenge in the sustainable transition: capturing and storing solar and wind energy to ensure power and heat availability on cloudy, low-wind days. 

with a budget of 100 million dkk, including 60 million dkk in eu funding, the project aims to repurpose the original technology of power plants and build on the existing expertise of their employees. this includes reusing steam turbines, generators, control systems, and connections to the electricity and district heating networks. the plant will integrate three innovative storage technologies: a salt storage system, used electric vehicle batteries, and a high-tech flywheel battery. at the heart of the concept is advanced control software designed to ensure a continuous supply of heat and electricity, even on cloudy, windless days.

this project will provide invaluable insights into managing and storing solar and wind energy, maintaining balance in the electricity system, and determining the investments needed to fully phase out oil and reduce the reliance on wood chips. it will demonstrate how we can make maximum use of solar and wind power without significantly increasing costs for bornholm residents.

furthermore, the experiences gained on bornholm can be easily replicated elsewhere, such as converting a polish coal plant into a flexible energy storage facility for solar and wind power. hosting such a project on bornholm suggests we may need to raise expectations regarding the additional activities the energy island bornholm will bring to the region.

at √∏rsted and atp, we believe that a modular concept for the energy island is the best solution for denmark.  

we envision an enclosed island at the center of a dynamic piece of infrastructure capable of accommodating the rapid advancements in green technologies. we are confident that the modular concept is also the fastest way to deliver green electricity from the energy island as early as possible, because the modular design allows parts of the offshore wind capacity to be connected while the rest of the island is still under construction.  

we are very excited to share more thoughts about the project as it progresses and to engage with all stakeholders involved. in the meantime, you can learn more on our new website: nords√∏ens energi√∏ | √∏rsted, atp & partners.

headwinds can be beneficial, especially when a change in direction is needed. the delay of the north sea energy islands highlights a critical need to reassess the unrealistic narratives in danish climate policy. the energy island is not a bad idea‚Äîit has potential‚Äîbut the project is so extensive that imposing unrealistic, politically-driven timelines ultimately causes harm. delays are understandable, but this initiative, along with the hydrogen 'mirage,' diverts resources from the civil service, discards proven solutions, and erodes public support.

we already have effective solutions using existing technologies. these should be prioritized, with the civil service focused on their deployment. innovation and new development require time and should be aimed at driving exports‚Äînot solving immediate climate challenges. addressing climate issues must take precedence over technological ambition. headwinds are a welcome reminder that we must rethink our direction.

there seems to be some confusion between the royal couple's visit to bornholm to discuss the bornholm energy island and the article proposing a delay for the north sea energy island. while the two projects share the name energy island, they are otherwise quite different.

development often requires change, and change often requires ideas. while development should not occur unnecessarily, stagnation is rarely desirable. delaying the north sea energy island project and seeking co-financing appears to be the right decision. however, the bornholm energy island should remain separate from this discussion and not be included in the same considerations.
