Energi√∏en p√• Bornholm blev i Klimaaftalen fra 2020 pr√¶senteret som et lukrativt eksporteventyr med n√¶rmest uanede potentialer. Men her i 2024 har realiteterne indfundet sig, og √∏konomien i projektet ligger kuldsejlet hen.
En kreds af politikere er dog ikke klar til at tage konsekvenserne af, at l√∏ftet om en gylden indtjeningsmulighed har √¶ndret sig til en truende stor milliardudgift. Politikerne bag aftalen holder fast i energi√∏en ved at bringe nye argumenter frem, som mest af alt afsl√∏rer sl√∏set omgang med danskernes penge.

Fx at Energi√∏ Bornholm skal gennemf√∏res for Europas og Tysklands skyld. Eller for at skabe 5.300 √•rsv√¶rk p√• Bornholm, der i s√• fald vil f√• en pris p√• cirka 6 mio. kr. stykket.

L√¶s Frederik L√¶ss√∏e Nielsens indl√¶g p√• Altinget.dk, hvor han bl.a. forklarer, hvorfor de ellers fornuftige argumenter som dansk forsyningssikkerhed og lavere elpriser ikke holder i denne sammenh√¶ng.

At argumentere mod Energi√∏ Bornholm er lidt som at k√¶mpe mod dragen hydra fra gr√¶sk mytologi. Hver gang √©t argument falder til jorden, dukker to nye frem. Det ene mere s√∏gt end det andet.

Hvis der ikke var s√• mange penge p√• spil, ville det n√¶sten v√¶re beundringsv√¶rdigt, at tilh√¶ngerne med samme entusiasme kan reklamere for projektet med europ√¶isk forsyningssikkerhed og √•rsv√¶rk p√• Bornholm til 6 mio. kr. pr. stk., som da projektet blev betegnet som et lukrativt eksporteventyr. Alts√• fra en hyldest af udsigten til store indt√¶gter til heppekor for enorme udgifter.
column5:
the energy island project on bornholm has transformed from a supposedly lucrative export venture into a massive financial liability. the project's economics have completely collapsed since its presentation in the 2020 climate agreement, where it was portrayed as having almost limitless potential.

instead of acknowledging this failure, politicians continue supporting the energy island by introducing new, deeply flawed arguments. these politicians are trying to justify spending billions of danish kroner by claiming the project should proceed for the sake of europe and germany, or to create 5,300 jobs on bornholm at an astronomical cost of approximately 6 million kroner per job.

even seemingly reasonable arguments about danish energy security and lower electricity prices don't hold up under scrutiny in this context. the project's supporters keep generating new, increasingly far-fetched justifications - like a hydra growing two new heads each time one is cut off. they've shifted from celebrating potential profits to cheerleading for enormous expenses with equal enthusiasm.

this constant generation of new, weak arguments to defend the project shows a reckless disregard for danish taxpayers' money. what was initially sold as a profitable export venture has become an extremely expensive burden that can't be justified by any of the new rationales being put forward.

column3: At Sweco, we are absolutely thrilled! We have won the contract as technical advisor for the Danish Energy Agency in the development of the energy island in the North Sea - the first of its kind in the world! It is an incredibly exciting project - historically large, incredibly ambitious, and crucially important for Denmark's future energy supply, storage, and export of green energy to the rest of the world. The Energy Island has the potential to become Denmark's next wind success story and will contribute to building new knowledge and valuable experiences that will eventually help us and the rest of the world on the journey towards climate neutrality. We are proud, happy, and humble to have been assigned this major societal task, which shows that Sweco ranks among the world's best in marine constructions.

Let‚Äôs finally bury the idea of the Energy Island in the North Sea once and for all, so Denmark can move forward with a cost-effective green transition.

The fact that it takes a Belgian decision, apparently, to get politicians off the fence regarding the Energy Island in the North Sea, seems strikingly convenient. But regardless of the reason, it‚Äôs perfectly fine for Danish taxpayers. From the very beginning, the project has appeared troubling from a socio-economic perspective, and the most recent official calculations show a deficit of 50 billion DKK ‚Äì a figure that is likely even higher now.

No Belgian climate minister will ever cover that financial gap, and therefore, Frederik L√¶ss√∏e Nielsen‚Äôs message to Ingeni√∏ren and Sybille Hildebrandt is clear:  

"The sooner the band-aid is ripped off, the better. We are wasting each other‚Äôs time, money, and political capacity by pretending everything is fine. These administrative resources could be used much more effectively elsewhere."

Sidenhen har analyser fra Energistyrelsen vist et forventet st√∏ttebehov p√• hele 31,5 mia. kr., hvoraf det politisk er besluttet, at man h√∏jst vil betale 17,6 mia. kr. Men trods det store underskud bliver der ufortr√∏dent arbejdet videre med projektet.

Denne insisteren p√• at forts√¶tte med et √∏konomisk katastrofalt projekt virker endnu mere underlig, n√•r man tager h√∏jde for, at projektet prim√¶rt bidrager med √∏get eksport til udlandet. Allerede i 2030 forventes elproduktionen at overstige det indenlandske forbrug, hvis man ser bort fra PtX-produktion. Dette sp√¶nd mellem Danmarks str√∏mproduktion og det indenlandske elforbrug forventes derudover at stige st√∏t frem til 2050.

Energi√∏ Bornholm bidrager s√•ledes hovedsageligt til √∏get eksport, og som vist p√• figuren forventes Danmark at v√¶re nettoselvforsynende fra 2030 og frem b√•de med og uden Energi√∏ Bornholm. Det betyder, at hvis projektet gennemf√∏res, ender danskerne med at betale adskillige milliarder for et projekt, der prim√¶rt bidrager med billigere str√∏m og PtX-produkter til vores rige nabolande.

‚úã Dette er blot et af de mange argumenter, der er for at droppe Energi√∏ Bornholm. L√¶s mere i vores rapport ‚ÄùEnergi√∏ Bornholm ‚Äì En √∏konomisk katastrofe i slowmotion‚Äù - du finder et link til rapporten i kommentarfeltet. hashtag#dkpol hashtag#dkmedier hashtag#energi√∏ hashtag#dkgreen hashtag#denmark hashtag#danmark
column5:
the bornholm energy island was originally approved under the condition of profitability ‚Äì meaning it should, at the very least, be economically self-sustaining or generate revenue for the state. however, subsequent analyses by the danish energy agency have shown that the project will require an expected subsidy of 31.5 billion dkk, with the political decision being to limit the contribution to 17.6 billion dkk. despite this significant deficit, work on the project continues relentlessly.

this insistence on pushing forward with such an economically disastrous project becomes even more puzzling when you consider that the primary benefit of the project is increased exports to foreign markets. by 2030, electricity production is expected to exceed domestic consumption, excluding ptx production. this gap between denmark's electricity production and domestic consumption is expected to steadily increase through 2050.

therefore, the bornholm energy island mainly contributes to increased exports, and as shown in the figure, denmark is expected to be net self-sufficient from 2030 onward, with or without the energy island. this means that, if the project proceeds, danes will end up paying billions for a project that mainly provides cheaper electricity and ptx products to our wealthy neighboring countries.

‚úã this is just one of many reasons to abandon the bornholm energy island project. read more in our report 'energi√∏ bornholm ‚Äì a slow-motion economic disaster' ‚Äì you can find a link to the report in the comments section.

ENERGI√ò NORDS√òEN: INGEN PAUSER HER 
 
Regeringen har i dag besluttet, at nye koncepter for Energi√∏ Nords√∏en skal unders√∏ges. 
 
Det skyldes, at en kunstig √∏ bliver for dyr og risikabel for staten, set i forhold til, at den kun skal rumme energi√∏ens hjerte - alts√• elinfrastrukturen, herunder de omformeranl√¶g, der skal modtage str√∏mmen fra havvindm√∏llerne og sende den videre over store afstande til flere lande.

Da jeg her i morges samlede en stor del af de #√∏bisser i Energinet, som arbejder med Energi√∏ Nords√∏en, havde mit budskab derfor ikke meget med pauser at g√∏re. Selvom jeg kan se, det er s√•dan, mange medier tolker dagens nyhed: At Energi√∏ Nords√∏en s√¶ttes p√• pause.
 
Nuvel, det g√¶lder ikke for os i Energinet - heller ikke for dem, vi skal samarbejde med i Energistyrelsen og i Klima-, Energi- og Forsyningsministeriet om at afd√¶kke, hvorvidt en l√∏sning med platforme er den rigtige vej frem.
 
Selv er jeg ret sikker p√•, det er det, der skal til for at Energi√∏ Nords√∏en b√•de kan blive mere simpel og mere √∏konomisk b√¶redygtig. 
 
Hos os #√∏bisser i Energinet holder vi ikke pause. Vi skal holde sommerferie, javel, men bagefter vi f√•r nok at se til - og vi kl√∏r p√• med krum hals.

the danish government has decided to explore new concepts for the north sea energy island because constructing an artificial island is too expensive and risky, given its limited role in hosting the energy island's core infrastructure, such as converter stations for handling electricity from offshore wind turbines. instead, the focus is on assessing whether platforms (steel structures) can fulfill this role more economically and effectively. 

contrary to media reports suggesting a pause in the north sea energy island project, energinet is not taking a break. alongside partners at the danish energy agency and the ministry of climate, energy, and utilities, we are committed to evaluating whether the platform-based solution is the right approach. i personally believe that platforms offer a simpler and more financially sustainable path forward for the project. while we will take summer holidays, energinet's work will continue with full dedication thereafter.

bornholms energi og forsyning, through its new subsidiary bornholms vedvarende energi a/s, is dedicated to advancing bornholm‚Äôs green transition by investing funds from the sale of the electricity grid into renewable energy projects. one-fifth of the funds will be reserved for capital security, while the remainder will support sustainable initiatives.

the initial focus is on small and medium-sized projects, such as solar panel installations and battery solutions, aimed at improving energy supply security and reducing renewable energy costs for bornholm residents. larger projects, like the bornholm energy island, are planned for the future, but the immediate goal is to generate tangible value for the community through these smaller initiatives.

bornholms vedvarende energi a/s values local engagement and has actively sought input from residents, including ideas for installing solar panels on public buildings and optimizing energy usage in wastewater treatment facilities. the company is committed to fostering bornholm‚Äôs sustainable future and appreciates the strong support from the community for its green ambitions.

column3:
I artiklen herunder er der fra politisk side bekymring for, at udskydelsen vil g√• ud over Danmarks 2030-m√•l. Det er der dog ikke nogen grund til, for projektet bidrager i forvejen ikke til det m√•l. 

Det skyldes at deadline for anl√¶g af projektet er 31. december 2030. Energistyrelsen forventer alts√• i forvejen ikke, at vindm√∏llerne begynder at producere str√∏m f√∏r 2031. Selvom 2030-m√•let opg√∏res som et tre√•rigt gennemsnit, vil CO2-gevinsterne fra den gr√∏nne str√∏m i 2031 n√¶ppe opveje de udledninger, der naturligvis er i forbindelse med anl√¶gsarbejdet i 2029 og 2030.

N√•r det er sagt, skal danske politikere naturligvis heller ikke l√∏se punktm√•l med millarddyre infrastrukturprojekter. S√•danne projekter skal som altid vurderes p√• baggrund af deres samfunds√∏konomi og ved at sammenligne med alternative l√∏sninger, der giver samme gevinster.
column5:
there is political concern that the delay will affect denmark's 2030 climate goals. however, this concern is unfounded because the project was not expected to contribute to those goals in the first place. the project's construction deadline is set for december 31, 2030, and the energy agency anticipates that the wind turbines will not begin producing electricity before 2031. even though the 2030 goal is measured as a three-year average, the co2 benefits from the green electricity in 2031 are unlikely to offset the emissions resulting from construction work in 2029 and 2030.

that said, we assert that danish politicians should not attempt to meet specific targets with exorbitantly expensive infrastructure projects. such projects must always be evaluated based on their societal economics and compared to alternative solutions that provide similar benefits.

column3:
We had a truly inspiring 2 day-meeting with the German delegation on Energy Island Bornholm to exchange views and perspectives on the Baltic Region as a key renewable energy provider and how we can strengthen our regional collaboration even further. 
 
Reinhard Meyer, Minister of Economic Affairs, Infrastructure and Labor in Mecklenburg-Vorpommern was accompanied by Michael Kellner, Parlamentary Secretary in the Federal Ministry for Economic Affairs and Climate Action, State Secretary Heiko Mira√ü and CEO Stefan Kapferer from 50Hz Electrical. 
 
We had fruitful discussions on renewable energy production and infrastructure in the Baltic Sea region and what opportunities it also generates on a community level.
With the massive future demand for renewable energy, we will need even more integrated connections to be cost effective in the green transition. 
This requires a new level of coordination and cross-country collaboration. Energy Island Bornholm is a major showcase and will prove as stepping stone towards more energy hubs/hybrid solutions.
 
Bornholm and R√∏nne Historic Power Plant demonstrated again its relevance as a meeting venue fueling these important discussions one of which was a very interesting exchange on progress so far - and what challenges lie ahead - by the two CEO's of the TSO's, Stefan Kapferer and Thomas Egebo. 
A visit to Energinet‚Äôs site for the transformer/convertor station in true RE-weather with sunshine and a warm wind was a perfect addition to the program.
 
Mecklenburg-Vorpommern and Bornholm will in the future be physically connected via the Energy Island Bornholm project, and over the past days we established a similar strong and close connection on the personal level. 
It was fantastic to experience the German interest, willingness to share knowledge and constructive approach on how to explore collaboration opportunities.
Thank you for visiting ‚Äì we look forward to continuing the conversation. 
 
Thank you to all participants that made the visit a success:
Reinhard Meyer, Michael Kellner, Heiko Mira√ü, Stefan Kapferer, Hanne Storm Edlefsen, Thomas Egebo, Lillian Rasch Madsen, Linda Kofoed Persson, Sine Sunesen, Ulrik Stridb√¶k, Samuel Magid, Mox Murugan, S√∏ren M√∏ller Christensen, Mette Sk√∏t and many more.
column5:
the two-day meeting with the german delegation on energy island bornholm was an inspiring exchange of ideas and perspectives on establishing the baltic region as a key renewable energy provider. discussions focused on enhancing regional collaboration, renewable energy production, and infrastructure in the baltic sea, as well as the community-level opportunities arising from these developments.

reinhard meyer, minister of economic affairs, infrastructure and labor in mecklenburg-vorpommern, led the german delegation, which included michael kellner, parliamentary secretary in the federal ministry for economic affairs and climate action, state secretary heiko mira√ü, and stefan kapferer, ceo of 50hertz electrical. fruitful conversations highlighted the importance of integrated connections to meet the growing demand for renewable energy and the need for improved cross-country coordination to ensure cost-effective solutions for the green transition. energy island bornholm serves as a critical showcase for energy hubs and hybrid solutions.

the visit included an insightful discussion between the ceos of 50hertz and energinet, stefan kapferer and thomas egebo, regarding progress and challenges in the project. a site visit to energinet‚Äôs transformer/converter station added to the program and underscored the significance of this initiative. 

the energy island bornholm project will physically connect mecklenburg-vorpommern and bornholm in the future, and the past days strengthened personal and professional connections between participants. the german delegation demonstrated significant interest, a willingness to share knowledge, and a constructive approach to exploring collaboration opportunities. 

we are grateful for this successful visit and look forward to continuing the dialogue. special thanks to all participants who contributed to this productive exchange.

column5:
bornholms energi og forsyning achieved a profit of 83 million dkk in 2023, enabling a return of 22 million dkk to the residents of bornholm. this result stems from investments in district heating, water, and wastewater infrastructure, which have generated an unprecedented return. 

the 22 million dkk will stabilize the prices of water, heating, and wastewater services despite rising costs due to inflation. furthermore, the surplus strengthens our ability to make significant future investments necessary for the green transition.

one key focus is leveraging the opportunities provided by energy island bornholm. this includes utilizing excess heat from the transformer station planned for south bornholm or a potential power-to-x facility. in both cases, surplus heat could be integrated into the bornholm district heating network.

the strong financial results from 2023 position bornholms energi og forsyning to make long-term, impactful decisions that maximize value for bornholm, its residents, and the shared sustainable future. as director claus m. andersen stated, this financial standing ensures readiness to seize opportunities and drive progress for bornholm.

Det giver udsigt til at blive en gr√∏n hub samt status som internationalt energim√¶ssigt fyrt√•rn midt i √òsters√∏en, hvor der er et potentiale p√• helt op til 93 gigawatt (GW) havvind. Som det f√∏rste projekt af sin art s√• vil det √•bne nye d√∏re for Bornholms erhvervsliv.
Baltic Energy Island er sat i verden for at forl√∏se dette enorme potentiale. S√∏ren M√∏ller Christensen er nyudn√¶vnt konstitueret direkt√∏r for den erhvervsdrivende fond Baltic Energy Island, og han er ikke i tvivl om projektets potentiale.
‚ÄùDet er sv√¶rt at overvurdere den betydning, som de forskellige offshore-projekter vil kunne f√• for det bornholmske erhvervsliv,‚Äù begynder han og forts√¶tter:
‚ÄùDe oplagte muligheder er selvf√∏lgelig underentrepriser i de store anl√¶gsprojekter i forbindelse med landanl√¶gget, men ogs√• n√•r mulige PtX-projekter skal anl√¶gges. Derudover er der R√∏nne Havns rolle som udskibningshavn for havvindm√∏ller, og der vil i fremtiden v√¶re behov for en s√•kaldt O&M havn (Operation and Maintenance).‚Äù
S√∏ren M√∏ller Christensen forklarer, at arbejdet med at indhente inspiration til O&M-havnen er godt i gang.
‚ÄùEn delegation fra Bornholm bes√∏gte for nylig Grimsby i England, hvor der er en O&M-havn, som servicerer 5 GW vind. Den besk√¶ftiger over 500 mand ‚Äì vi f√•r til sammenligning 6,9 GW, hvis alle felter udbygges. Perspektiverne er dog videre endnu. R√∏nne Havn unders√∏ger, sammen med et stort partnerskab, mulighederne for at etablere en Green Bunker Hub i R√∏nne Havn, der kan forsyne skibsfarten i √òsters√∏en med gr√∏nne br√¶ndsler. Vi f√•r store m√¶ngder af gr√∏n str√∏m. Hvad vil det betyde for de bornholmske virksomheders udviklingsmuligheder? Og hvilke nye virksomheder kan vi tiltr√¶kke? Hvis vi derudover f√•r produktion af gr√∏nne br√¶ndsler p√• Bornholm ‚Äì PtX ‚Äì √•bner der sig endnu et erhvervsomr√•de, hvor der ogs√• vil v√¶re store m√¶ngder af overskudsvarme, som kan bruges til fjernvarme og erhvervsm√¶ssigt eksempelvis i gartnerier. Endelig har vi mulighed for at l√∏fte Bornholm som test√∏ til et nyt niveau, fordi Bornholm bliver verdens f√∏rste energi√∏ ‚Äì ny teknologi vil blive brugt og testet for f√∏rste gang her p√• Bornholm.‚Äù

Om 15 √•r vil der v√¶re en helt anden √∏ erhvervsm√¶ssigt end i dag. Vi vil se en √∏ med nye jobfunktioner, flere indbyggere, markant forh√∏jet innovationskraft og med nye virksomheder som kommer til samt eksisterende virksomheder kommer til at st√• styrkede. Det kommer til at bidrage til at √¶ndre den demografiske udvikling i en positiv retning og dermed er det en udvikling, der i h√∏j grad kommer vores samfund til gavn.

Christa Lodahl
Christa Lodahl
H√∏jt ambitionsniveau
N√•r der er tale om et projekt, der bliver det f√∏rste af sin art p√• hele kloden, s√• handler det om at holde tungen lige i munden, n√•r det lokale erhvervsliv skal tilgodeses og v√¶re med helt fremme. Det vil kr√¶ve en skarp indsats fra alle involverede bornholmske parter, men det er en indsats, der er umagen v√¶rd.
Det forklarer Business Center Bornholms erhvervschef Christa Lodahl.
‚ÄùDet er en enest√•ende mulighed af en st√∏rrelse, som en √∏ som Bornholm formentlig kun f√•r √©n gang. Derfor er der overordnet tre elementer, som vi skal lykkes med. Udviklingen skal v√¶re bred og til gl√¶de for hele Bornholm. Erhvervslivet skal have et stort rygst√∏d ud af det. Derudover skal vi v√¶re skarpe p√• at have fokus p√• de muligheder, som er her og nu for Bornholm, men ogs√• de muligheder, der vil opst√• i horisonten. Vi skal ganske enkelt have mest muligt ud af Energi√∏en,‚Äù siger hun.
‚ÄùVi skal p√• lokalt niveau sikre, at Bornholm f√•r mest muligt ud af det potentiale, b√•de direkte og indirekte, og derudover er vi Danmarks spydspids for gr√∏n teknologiudvikling og udvikling af fremtidens energisystem samtidig med, at hele verden kigger med. Vi har en forpligtelse til at indg√• samarbejder, dele viden og erfaringer, s√• vi sammen kan l√∏se de store klimaudfordringer vi st√•r overfor internationalt. Der er store, nationale akt√∏rer i partnerkredsen bag Baltic Energy Island, men det er ogs√• vigtigt med akt√∏rer, som forst√•r at tr√¶kke mest mulig v√¶rdi ud af disse potentialer til gavn for det bornholmske samfund. Det er derfor ogs√• en kerneopgave for Business Center Bornholm at v√¶re med til at ruste det lokale erhvervsliv til at kunne byde ind p√• den lange r√¶kke af opgaver og muligheder, som opst√•r nu samtidig med, at vi skal omstille vores energisystemer. Vi skal simpelthen have et meget h√∏jt ambitionsniveau i vores indflyvning til mulighederne foran os.‚Äù

Dr√∏mmen skal realiseres
Der er nemlig ganske enkelt ikke r√•d til at hvile p√• laurb√¶rrene og forvente, at de gode muligheder realiserer sig selv, siger S√∏ren M√∏ller Christensen.
‚ÄùOmvendt ‚Äì hvis vi intet g√∏r ‚Äì risikerer vi, at hele eventyret ender med nogle underentrepriser til anl√¶gsopgaverne og drift af et PtX-anl√¶g. Vi er derfor n√∏dt til sammen ‚Äì politikere, erhvervsliv og borgere ‚Äì at dr√∏fte, hvad vi vil med de muligheder, som vi st√•r med,‚Äù siger han og uddyber:
‚ÄùDet kan v√¶re en motor for b√•de den bornholmske erhvervs og samfundsudvikling ‚Äì og for uddannelsesomr√•det. Det kr√¶ver dog, at vi p√• Bornholm beslutter, at vi vil have mest muligt ud af Energi√∏ Bornholm og de nye projekter √∏st for Bornholm. Vi skal arbejde for at g√∏re Bornholm til √òsters√∏ens gr√∏nne tankstation, vi skal v√¶re servicehavn for vindm√∏llerne, og vi skal igangs√¶tte planl√¶gning, s√• der er plads til nye gr√∏nne virksomheder, der vil lokalisere sig p√• Bornholm pga. store m√¶ngder gr√∏n str√∏m og overskudsvarme. Og vi skal sikre os, at de kommende √•rs store internationale opm√¶rksomhed og interesse fra forskere bliver omsat til uddannelser p√• Bornholm og innovation i vores virksomheder.‚Äù
column5:
the danish parliament has approved bornholm to become the world's first energy island, positioning us as a green energy hub and international leader in the baltic sea. this groundbreaking project, with a potential capacity of up to 93 gigawatts of offshore wind, will open up new opportunities for bornholm's businesses.

baltic energy island is poised to unlock this immense potential. s√∏ren m√∏ller christensen, the interim ceo of baltic energy island, is confident about the project's impact. he emphasizes that the offshore projects offer a range of opportunities, from subcontracts in large-scale construction to involvement in future ptx projects. additionally, r√∏nne harbor is set to become a key hub for wind turbine shipments and an o&m (operation and maintenance) harbor.

we're already exploring the development of an o&m harbor, drawing inspiration from successful models like grimsby in england. the potential for r√∏nne harbor to become a green bunker hub, supplying the baltic sea with green fuels, is also promising.

with a surplus of green energy, we can attract new businesses and support the growth of existing ones. bornholm can become a global testing ground for innovative technologies.

in the next 15 years, we envision a transformed island with new jobs, a growing population, and increased innovation. this will positively impact our demographics and community.

to fully realize this potential, we need a collective effort from all stakeholders. businesses must be proactive in seizing opportunities. we must position bornholm as the baltic sea's green energy hub, attract new green industries, and support education and innovation.

it's crucial that we don't rest on our laurels. we must actively shape our future and ensure that bornholm maximizes the benefits of the energy island. by doing so, we can create a thriving economy and a sustainable future for our island.
column13: Who benefits socially and economically from energy islands? Is it fair?

column3:
Efter min tilbagekomst til Danmark i 2020 fik jeg muligheden for at lede de geofysiske og geotekniske forunders√∏gelser for den planlagte energi√∏ i Nords√∏en for Energinet. Et storstilet projekt af en st√∏rrelse ikke set tidligere og med meget fokus fra politisk side ogs√•. Men i denne podcast forklarer projekt direkt√∏r Hanne Storm Edlefsen fra Energinet p√• fornemste vis hvad status er p√• nuv√¶rende tidspunkt.

column5:
after returning to denmark in 2020, i had the opportunity to lead the geophysical and geotechnical investigations for the planned energy island in the north sea for energinet. this is a large-scale project of an unprecedented size, attracting significant political attention. initially, the north sea project was highlighted as one that would involve the construction of an artificial island 100 km out in the north sea. 

over the next two years, many developments have changed the situation significantly, and it is now clear that an artificial island will not be built. however, there are many rumors circulating, and various things are being said. in this podcast, energinet's project director, hanne storm edlefsen, provides a clear and thorough explanation of the current status. i highly recommend spending 30 minutes listening to this; a fun detail at the end is how the journalist was surprised to receive such clear and straightforward answers.

bornholms energi og forsyning played a key role in the discussion about the success of energy islands during an event on thursday. the event featured children reporters, lars aagaard, the minister for climate, energy and utilities, ditte juul j√∏rgensen from the european commission, and claus m. andersen, the ceo of bornholms energi og forsyning and chairman of baltic energy island, who moderated the conversation.

the central question was: how can we succeed with energy islands? the responses included insights from various speakers:
- ditte juul j√∏rgensen emphasized the importance of learning from the successes of offshore wind projects in the north sea.
- lars aagaard highlighted denmark's dependence on eu cooperation and the country's responsibility for managing such a large maritime territory.
- children reporter benjamin expressed a desire to see the energy island on bornholm within a year.

this event contributed to the ongoing conversation about the future of energy islands and the role they play in denmark's energy transition.

column5:
at the 2022 people's meeting, the focus was on the energy island project. the day started with morning coffee at r√∏nne's old power plant, a building over 100 years old that is now protected. the power plant was once inaugurated by visionary people who made it possible to provide electricity to the citizens of r√∏nne. while those visionaries may not have used the term "sector coupling," they quickly realized that the excess heat from electricity production could be used to ensure that r√∏nne‚Äôs residents could take hot baths at a bathing facility built nearby. 

yesterday, we discussed the transformation of the power plant into the national center for green energy, which will focus on the development and communication of the energy island project. today's debate centered around the energies involved in the national context, with many excellent questions from the audience regarding the energi√∏ bornholm project. the discussion was led by a dynamic panel, including jacob tr√∏st, glenda napier, hanne storm edlefsen, and rasmus errboe, with an equally engaging moderator, claus m. andersen.

column5:
i'm paying over 10 kroner per kilowatt-hour for electricity, and yet people are being asked to support expensive and inefficient projects like power-to-x for aviation fuel. it's absurd that people are agreeing to this without understanding that the efficiency of such projects is less than 20%. 

meanwhile, politicians are hesitant to make the necessary investments, viewing them as expenses rather than investments. why aren't we focusing on more practical solutions, like building a high-efficiency power cable through bornholm, sweden, and denmark? this could provide nearly free electricity to all of the nordic countries. it's clear that everyone is just focused on their own electricity bills and not on the bigger picture.

"Bedste bud er underskud p√• 10 milliarder
Beregninger fra Klima-, Energi- og Forsyningsministeriet viser, at det nuv√¶rende bedste bud er et samfunds√∏konomisk underskud p√• 2 mia. kr., som dog forventes d√¶kket af EU-st√∏tte p√• 2 mia. kr., og et projekt√∏konomisk underskud p√• 10 mia. kr.

column5:
who's the mastermind behind this decision?

the best estimate is a 10 billion kroner deficit. calculations from the ministry of climate, energy, and utilities show that the current best estimate is a socioeconomic deficit of 2 billion kroner, which is expected to be covered by eu support of 2 billion kroner. however, there is also a projected economic deficit of 10 billion kroner for the project itself. 

this means that the project is likely to require subsidies of around 10 billion kroner, or at the very least, the danish state will have to cover some portion of the private risk. 

i'm concerned about the financial implications of this project. it seems like we're being asked to take on a significant financial risk with limited potential for return.

Vi er derfor g√•et sammen med forskere, Bornholms Regionskommune og virksomheder inden for vind- og energisektoren i #BalticEnergyIsland om at teste og udvikle nye l√∏sninger for #energi√∏er og energisystemer globalt, der skal til for blandt andet at kunne realisere det store potentiale for havvind i √òsters√∏en.

column5:
energinet is excited to announce a new partnership for green energy and development. the green transition requires new knowledge, technology, and innovation, especially in energy systems, and energinet can both contribute to and learn from this process.

we have joined forces with researchers, bornholm's regional municipality, and companies in the wind and energy sector in the baltic energy island project to test and develop new solutions for energy islands and global energy systems. this initiative aims to realize the significant potential for offshore wind in the baltic sea.

this announcement comes at a great time. denmark and germany have just agreed to increase offshore wind capacity from energy island bornholm from 2 to 3 gw, benefiting our german neighbors as well. today, denmark is hosting a summit in the baltic sea region to strengthen cooperation on energy supply across the countries around the baltic sea.

column3:
Die Zukunft der Windenergie: F√∂rderung statt Stellenabbau

Deutschland will bis 2030 nicht mehr als 7,5 Milliarden Tonnen CO2 aussto√üen. Und anscheinend sind wir auf einem guten Weg dorthin. Zumindest hat paradoxerweise der Klimawandel daf√ºr gesorgt: mit intensiver Sonneneinstrahlung und starkem Wind wurde in 2019 erstmals mehr Strom aus alternativen Energietr√§gern erzeugt als aus Kohle- und Kernkraftwerken zusammen. Gleichzeitig hatte erst k√ºrzlich die Denkfabrik Agora Energiewendebekanntgegeben, dass der Anteil der erneuerbaren Energien am Stromverbrauch 2019 auf nahezu 43 Prozent gestiegen sei. 

Das h√∂rt sich alles gut an, aber dennoch d√ºrfen wir nicht vergessen, dass die Bundesregierung an den fossilen Energietr√§gern festh√§lt. Wir sind immer noch der gr√∂√üte Verursacher von Treibhausgasen in Europa. Das beweist das Ranking der Umweltorganisation ‚ÄûTransport & Environment". Von den zehn gr√∂√üten CO2-Emittenten in der EU belegen deutsche Kohlekraftwerke die Pl√§tze zwei bis acht. 

Dabei gibt es mit der Windenergie doch eine deutlich klimaschonendere Methode zur Energiegewinnung. Anstatt diese zu f√∂rdern, werden dem Ausbau von Onshore-Windkraftwerken Steine in den Weg gelegt, die auf den ersten Blick nicht sichtbar sind. Die Aufforderung des BWE Regionalverband Elbe-Weser-Nord z.B. nach Offenlegung der Quelldaten im nieders√§chsischen Artenschutzleitfaden in Bezug auf Abstandsregelungen zu WEAs wurde von Beh√∂rdenseite schlichtweg ignoriert. Stattdessen √§u√üert ein Beh√∂rdenmitarbeiter seine Meinung zum Artenschutz und zu Abstandsregelungen bei WEA in den Gremien zur √úberarbeitung des nieders√§chsischen Artenschutzleitfadens, ohne die erforderlichen wissenschaftlichen Grundlagen zu liefern.  Und wird hier auch noch ernst genommen. Durch die Verflechtung von privaten und beh√∂rdlichen Aufgaben entsteht ein erheblicher Interessenskonflikt, der zu fehlerhaften beh√∂rdlichen Entscheidungen f√ºhrt. So werden viele Projekte z.B. gerade in Niedersachsen aufgrund absurder Abstandsempfehlungen, ohne wissenschaftliche Grundlagen, nicht umgesetzt oder mit hohen Kosten und langen Rechtsstreitigkeiten nur beschr√§nkt umgesetzt. Das sorgt daf√ºr, dass wichtige Arbeitspl√§tze und damit auch Know-how verloren gehen. Wie bei der Enercon GmbH, dem gr√∂√üten Windanlagenbauer Deutschlands, der zuletzt massiv Stellen abbauen musste. Oder wie bei der Insolvenz von AMBAU hier in Cuxhaven oder bei Senvion in Bremerhaven. Das ist eine Katastrophe f√ºr die Branche und den Landkreis. Und das ist erst der Anfang: denn viele Zulieferfirmen werden den Druck aus der Branche und den Wegfall der Auftr√§ge erst noch zu sp√ºren bekommen.

Als Gr√ºnder und Vorstandsvorsitzender der UMaAG sowie als Vorsitzender des BWE e.V. Regionalverband Elbe-Weser-Nord verfolge ich diese Entwicklung mit Sorge und Unverst√§ndnis. Unsere Energieversorgung muss umgebaut werden. Die Zukunft der Windenergie liegt mehr denn je in den H√§nden der Politiker. Hier sind konkrete Ma√ünahmen zur Fl√§chenausweisung mit verbindlichen Vorgaben f√ºr die Landkreise gefordert, klare Standards zum Artenschutz auf wissenschaftlicher Basis sowie die Einf√ºhrung einer elektronischen Bauakte mit Beteiligung der Tr√§ger √∂ffentlicher Belange. 

Wenn die Regierung ihre Klimaziele wirklich erreichen m√∂chte, dann muss sie radikaler gegen die fossilen Brennstoffe wie Braun- und Steinkohle vorgehen und endlich auf Windkraft setzen. Deshalb fordere ich die Politik auf umgehend zu handeln und den Ausbau der Windenergie tatkr√§ftig zu unterst√ºtzen: mit weniger B√ºrokratie, mit effizienteren Genehmigungsprozessen und mit klaren, wissenschaftlich fundierten Vorgaben f√ºr Genehmigungsbeh√∂rden.

as the founder and ceo of umaag and chairman of bwe e.v. regionalverband elbe-weser-nord, i urge the government to support wind energy with less bureaucracy, efficient approval processes, and clear, scientifically-based guidelines. immediate action is needed to achieve climate goals and fully commit to wind power.

the netherlands is setting an inspiring example by dividing its offshore tender areas into more investor-friendly units. this aligns with a demand of the federal offshore wind energy association (bwo) for further expansion in the german north sea. 

the netherlands enterprise agency announced that two areas, each planned for 2 gigawatts of installed capacity, have been split into four areas of 1 gigawatt each. these areas, ijmuiden ver gamma and nederwiek i, will now be developed as sub-areas a and b. 

i fully support this approach by the authorities and their reasoning. it addresses increased supply chain costs and the recent low number of bids from developers, thereby reducing financial risks for investors. this is the kind of signal the offshore wind industry needs to drive sustainable expansion. i hope for similar actions from german policymakers.

in germany, we saw low interest in offshore wind tenders during the august auction, with only five bids for three areas. this is partly due to very dense spatial planning, which results in a low number of full-load hours. smaller 1-gigawatt areas would have positive effects here as well. it is encouraging that the german government has announced an evaluation of the tender design, and we are eager to contribute our proposals.

in the meantime, i look forward to more details about the dutch tenders, which the netherlands enterprise agency is set to release in the fourth quarter of 2024.

In the future, a large part of the gas networks will no longer be needed. We have examined the regulation of this infrastructure in various European countries. Based on this, here are our recommendations:

‚û°Ô∏è Grid development plans must be compatible with climate goals.  
‚û°Ô∏è Regulations must allow for the decommissioning of gas networks. The current regulatory framework is focused on continuous expansion.  
‚û°Ô∏è Heating plans should become more specific and designate gas phase-out areas.  
‚û°Ô∏è Consumer protection must be redefined. Low-income households must not be left behind.
column5:
in the future, a significant portion of the gas networks will no longer be necessary. we have analyzed the regulation of gas infrastructure across various european countries. based on our findings, we recommend the following:

- grid development plans must align with climate goals.
- regulations should facilitate the decommissioning of gas networks, as the current regulatory framework is still focused on continual expansion.
- heating plans must become more detailed and designate areas for the phase-out of gas.
- consumer protection must be redefined to ensure that low-income households are not left behind in the transition.

column3:
Energy Islands in Denmark: An Economic Disaster in Slow Motion
 
Last week, Denmark‚Äôs two energy island projects, North Sea and Bornholm, were once again deemed uneconomical. Now, with Germany showing interest, the projects are further confirmed as potential disasters.
 
Previously, I reported that the North Sea energy island had been postponed by at least three years after Belgium withdrew its interest in the project. The Danish Minister of Climate Lars Aagaard informed the press that Denmark would now seek to involve Germany as a co-investor.
 
On Friday, the Danish business media outlet B√∏rsen released statements from the German Federal Ministry for Economic Affairs and Climate Action. According to the ministry, Germany has a strong interest in the project, and it fits well into the future German energy transition.
 
The German ministry cited Denmark‚Äôs other energy island project at Bornholm as an example of why such a partnership could be beneficial. However, this is where the problems begin, as Energy Island Bornholm is already known as an economic disaster in its own right.
 
A senior economist Frederik L√¶ss√∏e Nielsen at Kraka Economics called it "window-dressing" to suggest that there is a realistic chance of Germany covering the expected billion-dollar deficit from the North Sea Energy Island. Why would they do so when the Belgians have already backed out?
 
Earlier this week, the well-renowned think tank Kraka Economics published a report titled "Energy Island Bornholm: An Economic Disaster in Slow Motion." Kraka also criticized the North Sea project back in 2021, recommending that the government should pull the plug.
 
The Danish Energy Agency has estimated that Energy Island Bornholm will require around $5 billion in state aid to become a reality, while Energy Island North Sea will need $7.5 billion. This brings the total state aid requirement for the energy islands to $12.5 billion.
 
Denmark has already poured several billion dollars into renewable energy over the last two decades. Between 2000 and 2023, renewable energy received $16.5 billion in state aid. From 2024 to 2035, an additional $7.5 billion will be provided in state aid for renewables, bringing the total to $24 billion.
 
Considering the existing state aid, the energy islands will bring the total state aid for renewables in Denmark to $36.5 billion since 2000.
 
At the same time, there is no longer a financial incentive to build offshore wind farms in Denmark. Earlier this year, PwC Danmark released a report stating that costs have risen by 30-40% since 2021, making offshore projects unprofitable for investors.
column5: denmark's two energy island projects, north sea and bornholm, are destined to be economic disasters. both projects have been deemed uneconomical multiple times, with the bornholm project already acknowledged as a failure. the danish government is now attempting to involve germany as a co-investor, but this is highly questionable. the german interest may be more about window-dressing than genuine financial commitment, as the projects are already facing significant deficits, and even belgium has withdrawn from the north sea project. the state aid required for these energy islands is staggering, totaling $12.5 billion, adding to the already substantial $24 billion spent on renewable energy in denmark since 2000. the energy islands will bring the total state aid for renewables to $36.5 billion, yet there is no longer a financial incentive to build offshore wind farms due to rising costs that have made such projects unprofitable for investors.

During the Joe Biden Leaders Summit on Climate change one of the key messages brought to the virtual table by many world leaders, was their investment in renewable energy.

Renewable energy is on course to provide at least 15% of the global energy mix by 2040. An example of how offshore renewables are already contributing to the energy mix, in 2020 offshore wind in the UK contributed to some 24.8% of all electricity supplied to the whole of the United Kingdom.

Solar energy once an expensive form of renewables, has seen costs cut by up to 80% over the past decade, making the technology more efficient & more affordable.

column3:
Vind√ò, the consortium of Danish pension funds and utility companies potentially investing in the Danish energy island concept, has chosen a contracting partnership for their project concept. Copenhagen Infrastructure Partners (CIP), acting as project managers on behalf of Vind√ò, have selected ACCIONA, DEMA, MT H√∏jgaard International and Boskalis to develop the project. Collectively known as the Njord Group, these four contractors have an impressive track record in marine construction projects.

CIP are building their team ahead of the Danish Energy Agency‚Äôs upcoming tender process. Expected to launch by the end of Q3 in 2022, the Agency will request bids for the project to be up and running by 2030. Thomas Dalsgaard, Partner in CIP, said, ‚ÄúACCIONA, Boskalis, DEME and MT H√∏jgaard International display, individually and as a group, extensive and complementary experience and equipment, and have successfully developed and constructed many similar projects around the world. We are very pleased to enter into this partnership with such a strong set of partners.‚Äù

The energy island will be 80-100km from the Danish west coast. An initial 3 GW of offshore wind power is expected, with a future potential of up to 10 GW. In addition, the island will act as a bundling point for several wind farms. Using High-Voltage Direct Current (HVDC) technology to bring together separate farms and transport the electricity to Denmark. A harbour facility will act as a staging point for operations and maintenance (O&M) activities in the area. Vind√ò are also planning to include energy storage and green hydrogen production.

‚ÄúCopenhagen Infrastructure Partners has thoroughly screened the most experienced experts and the world‚Äôs best-suited contract partners for the Energy Island project. We are confident that the NJORD Group offers the experience and capabilities needed for a successful project execution in a safe and reliable manner, even in a harsh marine environment far offshore in the Danish North Sea.‚Äù, added Dalsgaard.
column5: copenhagen infrastructure partners (cip) has carefully selected the njord group, consisting of acciona, dema, mt h√∏jgaard international, and boskalis, to develop the danish energy island project. these contractors bring substantial and complementary experience in marine construction, having successfully completed similar projects worldwide. i am confident that the njord group has the necessary expertise, resources, and equipment to execute this project safely and reliably, even in the challenging offshore conditions of the danish north sea. with a planned initial 3 gw of offshore wind power, potential for up to 10 gw, and additional plans for energy storage and green hydrogen production, the energy island project is a crucial part of denmark's renewable energy future.

"We had a truly inspiring 2 day-meeting with the German delegation on Energy Island Bornholm to exchange views and perspectives on the Baltic Region as a key renewable energy provider and how we can strengthen our regional collaboration even further. 
 
Reinhard Meyer, Minister of Economic Affairs, Infrastructure and Labor in Mecklenburg-Vorpommern was accompanied by Michael Kellner, Parlamentary Secretary in the Federal Ministry for Economic Affairs and Climate Action, State Secretary Heiko Mira√ü and CEO Stefan Kapferer from 50Hz Electrical. 
 
We had fruitful discussions on renewable energy production and infrastructure in the Baltic Sea region and what opportunities it also generates on a community level.
With the massive future demand for renewable energy, we will need even more integrated connections to be cost effective in the green transition. 
This requires a new level of coordination and cross-country collaboration. Energy Island Bornholm is a major showcase and will prove as stepping stone towards more energy hubs/hybrid solutions.
 
Bornholm and R√∏nne Historic Power Plant demonstrated again its relevance as a meeting venue fueling these important discussions one of which was a very interesting exchange on progress so far - and what challenges lie ahead - by the two CEO's of the TSO's, Stefan Kapferer and Thomas Egebo. 
A visit to Energinet‚Äôs site for the transformer/convertor station in true RE-weather with sunshine and a warm wind was a perfect addition to the program.
 
Mecklenburg-Vorpommern and Bornholm will in the future be physically connected via the Energy Island Bornholm project, and over the past days we established a similar strong and close connection on the personal level. 
It was fantastic to experience the German interest, willingness to share knowledge and constructive approach on how to explore collaboration opportunities.
Thank you for visiting ‚Äì we look forward to continuing the conversation."
column5:
the energy island bornholm project is a key initiative for renewable energy production and infrastructure in the baltic sea region, and it serves as a showcase for advancing energy hubs and hybrid solutions. strengthening cross-country collaboration and coordination is essential to meet the massive future demand for renewable energy in a cost-effective manner.

over the course of two days, we had inspiring and fruitful discussions with the german delegation, including representatives like reinhard meyer, michael kellner, heiko mira√ü, and stefan kapferer. together, we explored opportunities for regional collaboration, discussed progress and challenges, and exchanged knowledge on renewable energy initiatives. the personal and professional connections established during this visit are as important as the physical connection that will be created between mecklenburg-vorpommern and bornholm through the energy island project.

the discussions emphasized the importance of integrating renewable energy infrastructure and leveraging community-level opportunities. bornholm and the r√∏nne historic power plant continue to play a pivotal role in facilitating these important dialogues. we are inspired by the german delegation‚Äôs constructive approach and commitment to exploring collaboration opportunities and look forward to continuing this dialogue as we work together on the green transition. thank you to everyone who contributed to making this meeting a success.
column13: European cooperation and its importance to energy island projects.

entering into a closer dialogue with germany regarding the realization of the north sea energy island is an excellent idea. germany will, in any case, be one of the largest consumers of green electricity, making it highly logical to strengthen cooperation. there is already a successful collaboration on the bornholm energy island, which should be further leveraged for mutual benefit. 

however, it is regrettable that this delay could postpone the entire timeline by up to three years. the green transition requires speed and timely execution. when project timelines keep shifting, it becomes difficult to plan the production of wind turbines, cables, and transformer stations essential for the energy island. this situation demands a high degree of flexibility from the industry. 

therefore, it is crucial to maintain the ambition of transforming the north sea into a "power hub" for all of europe. achieving this goal will require massive infrastructure expansion, with energy islands playing a key role in the solution.

Energi√∏ Bornholm bliver dyr med samfundstab, og Energi√∏ Nords√∏en helt urentabel og skrinlagt. P√• grund af forbindelserne. Men disse omkostninger regnes ikke med. 

Vi ser med sp√¶nding frem til meldinger om Energi√∏ Bornholm, som mildest talt ikke ser godt ud fra de analyser der florerer. Dyrere at bygge og m√•ske mindre provenu fra havvindsudbud at bygge den for. Skatteborgerne skal ikke lide last. 

Vi kunne ogs√• bare fjerne forbuddet mod atomkraft og regne p√• det. Men det vil Dan og vennerne fra √∏nske√∏en ikke..
column5:
the danish energy island projects are failing, as demonstrated by the abandonment of the north sea energy island. despite earlier claims by dan j√∏rgensen that these projects would be faster and cheaper than nuclear power, this has proven untrue. j√∏rgensen should focus less on vanity projects and more on fulfilling the cop28 commitment to accelerate nuclear power development, which he signed. 

in reality, nuclear power is more advanced and reliable. 

a system based on unstable energy sources, such as wind, heavily relies on international energy trade. the cost of such a system should account for the expenses involved in creating these international connections, which are often excluded from the calculations. energy island bornholm is expected to be expensive with significant societal losses, while the north sea energy island has been scrapped due to connection costs making it entirely unprofitable.

there is growing concern about energy island bornholm, as current analyses indicate higher construction costs and possibly lower revenue from offshore wind auctions to finance it. taxpayers should not bear the financial burden of such projects.

denmark could simply lift the ban on nuclear power and properly evaluate its potential, but dan j√∏rgensen and his allies in the "wishful thinking island" camp refuse to consider this rational alternative.
column13: Is nuclear power an alternative to energy islands?

column5:
the danish energy island project on bornholm has the potential to succeed on multiple fronts:  

public support: the project will thrive with widespread local support if we ensure that it creates tangible value for the local community.  
economic development: the project can be a success for bornholm if it generates new jobs and promotes business development, fostering long-term economic sustainability for the island.  
national and global impact: the project can also be a success for denmark by helping us achieve national climate goals and paving the way for the next major export opportunity. by developing innovative solutions for the world's first energy island, we can make this project a role model for all of europe.  

bornholm is ready to move forward, but we need our national politicians to share this vision and provide us with the initial support necessary to kickstart the process. with the right start, we will ensure the motor on bornholm runs to achieve these ambitious goals.

üí∞ Statsst√∏tte p√• minimum 31,5 mia. iflg. Energistyrelsen.

column5:
the energy island project on bornholm is an inefficient and costly initiative that requires at least 31.5 billion dkk in government subsidies, equivalent to three times the annual budget for denmark‚Äôs police force. k√§rnfull energi opposes the energy island project for the following reasons:  

1. **economic viability**: according to analysis firm kraka, the energy island lacks economic justification due to high costs, reliance on subsidies, and the availability of cheaper alternatives for producing power-to-x (ptx) energy.  
2. **energy security**: adding more offshore wind turbines in the baltic sea does not enhance energy security.  
3. **cost efficiency**: ptx production on bornholm would be extremely expensive compared to production using other energy sources.  

k√§rnfull energi advocates for nuclear power as a superior alternative to the energy island concept. nuclear energy can provide affordable, stable electricity, district heating, and hydrogen production without requiring government subsidies. by situating nuclear power plants near existing combined heat and power facilities, denmark can avoid further industrialization of natural areas.  

k√§rnfull energi is already developing nuclear projects in neighboring regions and is willing to bring similar projects to denmark if the current ban on nuclear energy is lifted. many k√§rnfull energi customers have saved significant amounts by switching to 100% nuclear power agreements, avoiding hidden fees and overpriced contracts.

column5:
nuclear power is a better alternative to the energy island bornholm project and can save danish taxpayers at least 31.5 billion dkk, which is the estimated amount of state funding required for the energy island according to the danish energy agency. this amount equals three times the annual budget of the danish police. 

there is no need for state subsidies for energy. k√§rnfull energi is ready to build nuclear power plants in denmark without any state support. 

the energy island bornholm project lacks economic justification, as concluded by analysis firm kraka. senior economist frederik l√¶ss√∏e nielsen from kraka has publicly requested a single strong argument for establishing the energy island bornholm, noting that the project faces so many challenges that it no longer makes sense:
- üí∞ a minimum of 31.5 billion dkk in state subsidies, according to the danish energy agency.
- üîå adding more wind turbines in the baltic sea does not improve energy security.
- üíß producing ptx on bornholm would be extremely expensive, as it is cheaper to produce ptx using other energy sources than offshore wind.

at k√§rnfull, we have long questioned the excessively expensive energy island projects. in contrast, nuclear power can deliver cheap and stable electricity and hydrogen without requiring industrialization of natural areas. 

k√§rnfull next is already developing nuclear projects in sweden and is interested in doing the same in denmark if the ban on nuclear power is lifted. nuclear power would eliminate the need for large-scale energy islands by providing stable production of electricity, district heating, and hydrogen. by locating nuclear power plants at existing power plant sites, we can avoid further industrializing nature. 

additionally, many of our customers have saved significant amounts of money by switching to electricity contracts with 100% nuclear power, avoiding overpriced fixed-rate plans or hidden fees. nuclear power offers a practical, economical, and sustainable energy solution for denmark.

column5:
visit to 'energy island' üèùÔ∏è  
together with the ownership group behind greenport north, i visited jens peter lunden's gr√∏ngas facility near hj√∏rring.  

it was an incredibly inspiring visit, showcasing immense development since its establishment in 2001. the facility produces green energy in the form of electricity, heat, biogas, and now also hydrogen.  

in 2014, as a local politician, i visited jens peter and was highly skeptical about the installation of three wind turbines at the biogas plant. it was during that visit that i first heard about the vision to create an 'energy island.' my colleagues in the city council group and i were eventually convinced of the project's potential. today, nearly 10 years later, we see the vision realized.  

i am grateful that a significant majority in the city council had the political courage to approve the project at the time. i am especially proud that we have so many enterprising companies, such as gr√∏ngas, tirelessly working towards green transition and development. üçÄüôåüèªüòä

the energy island project near hj√∏rring showcases the impressive progress that can be achieved through green energy initiatives. since its establishment in 2001, jens peter lunden‚Äôs gr√∏ngas has grown significantly, producing electricity, heat, biogas, and now hydrogen.  

initially, in 2014, i was skeptical about the proposal to install three wind turbines near the biogas plant. however, after learning about the broader vision of creating an energy island, i, along with my colleagues in the municipal council, was convinced of the project‚Äôs potential.  

today, nearly a decade later, the energy island concept has become a reality, and i am proud that the municipal council had the courage to support the project back then. i am especially grateful for the entrepreneurial spirit of companies like gr√∏ngas, which are driving the green transition and fostering innovation.
column13: Are energy islands a good investment for innovation and economic growth?

column3: Let us be complete in the justifications. Belgium is still willing to.connect to the island and to pay its share of the interconnector but why should a third party country participate in the financing of the island , of the windfarms connected to the island or in the connections of those same windfarms to the island???? If Danemark wants to realize its export potential of excess capacity and trade a "commodity " ( electrons) , it should finance the "mining" and transformation of this commodity by itself. The export infrastructure ( interconnector) can then be partially financed by the receiving party. This only seem logical.
column5:
let us ensure comprehensive justifications. belgium remains willing to connect to the energy island and to pay its share of the interconnector. however, why should a third-party country contribute to financing the island itself, the wind farms connected to the island, or the connections of those wind farms to the island?  

if denmark aims to realize its potential for exporting excess capacity and trading a 'commodity' (electrons), it should take responsibility for financing the 'mining' and transformation of this commodity independently. the export infrastructure, such as the interconnector, can then be partially financed by the receiving party. this approach seems only logical.
column13: How to finance the energy islands?

column3: We must succeed with the first energy islands! It was very promising to discuss energy islands in Brussels last week. While fair cost-benefit-sharing was one of the main topics, there was also a strong focus on succeeding with the first projects without any further delays. column3:
Energi√∏ Nords√∏en har fra starten v√¶ret et vision√¶rt projekt, der kan bidrage til Europas gr√∏nne omstilling og forsyningssikkerhed. N√•r vi vil lave projekter, vi ikke har pr√∏vet f√∏r, s√• er der mange veje, snubletr√•de og sv√¶re valg at tr√¶ffe undervejs. Det g√¶lder ogs√• for energi√∏en. Derfor dette lidt lange skriv ‚Äì jeg h√•ber, du vil l√¶se med, for s√• store projekter indeholder mere end en hurtig overskrift.

Man kan godt dr√∏mme om et fedt projekt. Det er sv√¶rere at realisere det. Vi har derfor fra start p√• tv√¶rs af Folketingets partier v√¶ret enige i, at √∏konomien i projektet skal v√¶re ansvarlig. Vi skal ikke gennemf√∏re projektet for enhver pris ‚Äì og derfor meldte jeg allerede sidste sommer ud, at vi vil √¶ndre projektet, s√• prisen kommer ned. Sidste sommer l√∏d regningen for det oprindelige projekt p√• mere end 50 mia. kr. for statskassen. Det har aldrig v√¶ret den politiske intension. 
 
En stor del af form√•let med energi√∏en er at sende str√∏mmen til andre lande, og vi har derfor arbejdet sammen med Belgien. Danmark f√•r d√¶kket vores behov fra andre projekter, og derfor m√• danske skatteborgere ikke h√¶nge p√• en urimelig stor del af regningen, der ikke modsvares af gevinster for Danmark og danskerne. 

Det har vi diskuteret med Belgien helt op til det belgiske parlamentsvalg inden sommerferien, og vi har ikke kunnet finde en vej sammen, der var fornuftig og acceptabel for Danmark. Hvis en ny belgisk regering (n√•r en s√•dan er p√• plads‚Ä¶.) p√• et tidspunkt banker p√• vores d√∏r og er med p√• en mere balanceret fordeling af projektets omkostninger og gevinster, s√• er vores d√∏r selvf√∏lgelig √•ben. Det m√• ske p√• belgisk initiativ.
 
Vi har derfor ogs√• arbejdet p√• andre muligheder.  Og det er meget positivt, at is√¶r Tyskland viser stor interesse for at blive tilkoblet energi√∏en. Vi er s√• langt i dialogen med Tyskland, at vi prioriterer vores indsats for at realisere projektet i retning af et samarbejde med Tyskland ‚Äì s√• energi√∏en f√•r et elkabel til Danmark og et til Tyskland. 

N√•r vi har brugt tid p√• at √¶ndre i projektet, s√• bliver tidspunktet for en mulig realisering skubbet ud i tid. Det kommer n√¶ppe bag p√• nogen. S√•dan er virkeligheden. Og vi bliver n√∏dt til at lytte til tyskerne om hvad de har af behov og √∏nsker til kapacitet, tidsplan osv. Man kan jo se tyskerne som en kunde, der √∏nsker at k√∏be sig ind i et gr√∏nt projekt, og det er selvsagt den tyske eftersp√∏rgsel efter str√∏mmen og mulighed for at udbygge deres el-infrastruktur, der vil blive udslagsgivende for, hvorn√•r projektet kan realiseres. 

Det er gl√¶deligt, at der har vist sig en vej med Tyskland, der potentielt kan g√∏re √∏en billigere for Danmark. Nu skal projektet konkretiseres, s√• vi f√•r et grundlag, vi kan tr√¶ffe politiske beslutninger ud fra. Det arbejder vi p√• h√∏jtryk p√•, og s√• tager vi den derfra. 

Tak for at l√¶se helt til ende üòä
column5:
energy island north sea has always been a visionary project with the potential to contribute significantly to europe's green transition and energy security. however, when undertaking projects of this scale that are unprecedented, we face numerous challenges, obstacles, and difficult decisions. this applies to the energy island as well.  

from the start, across all political parties in the danish parliament, we agreed that the project's finances must be responsible. this project cannot proceed at any cost. last summer, the original project's price tag was estimated at over 50 billion dkk for the state budget, which was never the political intention. as a result, i announced last summer that we would revise the project to reduce its costs.  

one of the primary purposes of the energy island is to export electricity to other countries. while denmark‚Äôs own energy needs are covered by other projects, danish taxpayers must not bear an unreasonable portion of the costs without corresponding benefits.  

we discussed this extensively with belgium until their parliamentary elections last summer. unfortunately, we could not find a mutually beneficial and acceptable path forward. however, should a new belgian government approach us with a more balanced cost-benefit proposal, we remain open to dialogue.  

in the meantime, we have explored other possibilities, and it is very encouraging that germany has shown strong interest in connecting to the energy island. our dialogue with germany has progressed to the point where we are now prioritizing cooperation with them. this would involve connecting the island with an electricity cable to both denmark and germany.  

revising the project has inevitably delayed its potential realization, which should come as no surprise. we also need to listen to germany regarding their needs, capacity requirements, and timeline. essentially, germany is like a customer seeking to invest in this green project. their demand for electricity and infrastructure upgrades will heavily influence when the project can move forward.  

it is promising that cooperation with germany could potentially make the energy island less costly for denmark. our focus now is to concretize the project so that we have a solid basis for political decision-making. we are working intensively on this and will proceed from there.  

thank you for reading to the end. üòä
column13: How to finance the energy islands?

column3:
Energi√∏ Bornholm: En god investering i Danmarks og Europas fremtid

I jule- og nyt√•rstiden, hvor f√¶llesskabet er i h√∏js√¶det, og hvor vi reflekterer over vores f√¶lles fremtid, er det v√¶rd at s√¶tte fokus p√• projekter, der r√¶kker ud over vores tid og skaber v√¶rdi for kommende generationer. Sammen med Troels Ranis, vicedirekt√∏r i DI Energi, har jeg derfor skrevet et debatindl√¶g i Jyllands-Posten om Energi√∏ Bornholm og projektets betydning for vores f√¶lles fremtid.

Vi har samlet vores perspektiver i tre bundlinjer for Energi√∏ Bornholm:

1Ô∏è‚É£ Klimam√¶ssigt: Projektet vil i sig selv fortr√¶nge 3 mio. tons CO2 om √•ret, men endnu vigtigere bane vejen for flere energi√∏er, der er afg√∏rende for den gr√∏nne omstilling i EU.

2Ô∏è‚É£ Industripolitisk: Bornholm vil som eksisterende √∏ v√¶re den ideelle testplatform for fremtidens energi√∏er. Det vil give danske virksomheder en innovationsm√¶ssig fordel i udviklingen af energi√∏-teknologier.

3Ô∏è‚É£ Sikkerhedspolitisk: Energi√∏ Bornholm vil med sin kombination af elhandelsforbindelse og store m√¶ngder gr√∏n energi v√¶re et vigtigt skridt mod at frig√∏re EU fra russisk energi. Som det er tilf√¶ldet med klimaeffekterne, er projektet som et af de st√∏rste klimaprojekter nogensinde betydningsfuldt i sig selv. Men den st√∏rste effekt ligger igen i, at projektet baner vejen for flere energi√∏er, som samlet set vil v√¶re afg√∏rende for, at Europa kan blive selvforsynende med energi.

Derudover argumenterer vi ogs√• for, at projektet har gode chancer for at v√¶re en god forretning for Danmark. De nuv√¶rende beregninger viser godt nok en negativ samfunds√∏konomi p√• 4 mia. kr., men det skyldes, at Energistyrelsens beregninger har sv√¶rt ved at medregne de mange gevinster, som projektet har p√• grund af sin innovative karakter.
column5:
energy island bornholm is a solid investment in the future of denmark and europe. during the holiday season, as we reflect on shared values and our collective future, it‚Äôs important to highlight projects that go beyond our time and create value for generations to come. together with troels ranis, deputy director of di energi, i wrote an op-ed in jyllands-posten on the significance of energy island bornholm for our shared future.  

we have outlined three key bottom lines for energy island bornholm:  

1Ô∏è‚É£ **climate impact**: the project will displace 3 million tons of co2 annually and, more importantly, pave the way for additional energy islands, which are crucial for the eu's green transition.  

2Ô∏è‚É£ **industrial policy**: bornholm, as an existing island, is the ideal test platform for future energy islands. this will provide danish companies with a significant innovation advantage in developing energy island technologies.  

3Ô∏è‚É£ **security policy**: energy island bornholm, with its combination of electricity trade connections and large amounts of green energy, is a vital step toward reducing the eu's dependence on russian energy. while the project is significant as one of the largest climate initiatives ever, its greatest impact lies in paving the way for additional energy islands, which are critical for europe to become energy self-sufficient.  

additionally, we argue that the project has a strong chance of being a good economic investment for denmark. current calculations show a negative social economy of 4 billion dkk. however, this is due to challenges in fully accounting for the project's many benefits, particularly its innovative aspects, in the danish energy agency's calculations.
column13: Are energy islands a good investment for innovation and economic growth?

column3:
Vi jagter teknologiske nyheder fordi vi h√•ber. M√•ske ogs√• fordi vi kollektivt har indset, at vi som verden er n√∏dt til at agere p√• FNs klimarapport og alle de andre videnskabelige fakta, der entydigt peger i retning af et indtr√¶ngende behov for gr√∏n omstilling.

Regeringens klimapolitik n√¶vnes sj√¶ldent uden brugen af ordet "hockeystav", og sammenh√¶ngen er formodentlig ikke at skabe en sammenligning med begge de danske ishockeylandsholds nylige overraskende gode OL-resultater, desv√¶rre. Derimod bruges "hockeystav" p√• samme m√•de som i analyser af virksomheders budgetforventninger, hvor v√¶ksten "er rundt om hj√∏rnet", i bedste fald, og alts√• ikke her og nu.

Men vi har brug for resultater her og nu. Og min pointe med dette skriv er, at vi ikke vinder klimakampen p√• flere hj√∏rnespark, hockeystave eller andre fortrampede sports-metaforer.

Dan J√∏rgensen tror p√• en energi-√∏ i Nords√∏en. Den best√•r af store dele teknologi, som vi dr√∏mmer om, men reelt ikke har. Jeg f√∏ler mig hensat til H C Andersens eventyret "Kejserens nye kl√¶der" og efterlyser flere af denne vigtige fort√¶llings plot-m√¶ssige hovedperson, -nemlig den lille dreng, der peger og siger, at Kejseren ikke har noget t√∏j p√•. Vi har ikke Power to X-l√∏sningen, der modvirker et gigantisk energitab. Vi vil ikke tale om, at det vil koste mindst lige s√• meget at udvide energinettet til at flytte energien fra Nords√∏en, som at bygge selve energi-√∏en. Hvis den da kan bygges i det land, som ikke i tre √•rtier kunne f√• IC4-tog til at k√∏re.

I morges blev jeg tagget i et opslag, der bebudede, at man nu har udviklet solcellepaneler der virker i m√∏rke. Det var skam venligt ment, og tak igen for det. Men det er, desv√¶rre men evident, noget forvr√∏vlet sludder, der vildleder mere end det vejleder. Solceller virker ved fotoner. Fotoner findes i lys. Slut. "Nyheden" her, som vildleder mere end vejleder, er at man kan udnytte varmeforskellen i solcellepanelet mellem dag og nat og omdanne dette til str√∏m og derved g√∏re lagring un√∏dvendig. Jeg kan kun grine ad det... Det str√∏m der kan produceres p√• denne m√•de i et panel m√•les i mili-Watt! Det er t√¶t p√• ingenting, men World Economic Forum udbasunerer, at med f√• "tweaks" (kneb), s√• kan det nemt blive til mere. Nej, det kan ej. Ikke i kommerciel skala.

Nyheder er nyheder og skaber interesser fordi de beskriver noget nyt. Desv√¶rre fjerner det et n√∏dvendigt fokus p√•, at vi allerede har det der skal til. Renovering af eksisterende vindm√∏ller, s√• de leverer flere Watt og solceller p√• eksisterende tage (som ikke kr√¶ver yderligere investeringer i det monopoliserede elnet) vil bringe Danmark frem til m√•ls√¶tningen. Endda uden at tage mere af naturen end vi allerede har.

Nye og flere havvindm√∏ller, hav-solcelleparker og mark-anl√¶g repr√¶senterer alle det marginale etableringsmarked, hvor den etableringsm√¶ssige gr√¶nseomkostningen er skyh√∏j, fordi elnettet skal udbygges markant hvert eneste sted. Og det er forbrugeren der skal betale via elregningen. Og naturen.

"-Jamen, Jens. Du vil jo bare s√¶lge flere af dine solceller!" Ja, gerne. Jeg valgte ikke denne virksomhed tilf√¶ldigt, men fordi jeg oprigtigt mener, at solceller (b√•de standard solpaneler og Solartag) er den konkret nemmeste og meningsfulde m√•de, som almindelige danskere og virksomheder SELV kan skabe gr√∏n omstilling p√•. Og samtidig begr√¶nse ufatteligt store samfundsm√¶ssige investeringer i et monopoliseret elnet, hvor ingen kan fort√¶lle, hvad det reelt koster at flytte 1 kWh fra et sted til et andet. Og uden at √∏del√¶gge mere natur. Og spare penge.

Men vildledende nyheder om teknologi (som kun liiige mangler lidt) vil redde os, klimaet og jorden ender med at fjerne fokus, ogs√• politisk, p√• det vi forl√¶ngst skulle have gjort og som ligger lige foran os, -og virker, i dag. Hj√∏rnespark og hockeystave flytter den vigtigste udfordring i verden l√¶ngere ud i fremtiden, hvor de ansvarlige politikere forl√¶ngst er videre i andre jobs, men efterlader os p√• en klimam√¶ssig br√¶ndende platform.
column5:
the green transition requires immediate and practical action, not reliance on unproven or speculative technologies. the focus on projects like the north sea energy island, which hinge on technologies that do not yet exist, such as effective power-to-x solutions, distracts from viable and immediate solutions. these projects entail massive costs, including the construction of an expanded energy grid to transport energy from the north sea, costs that are comparable to or exceed those of the energy island itself.  

existing technologies, like renovating wind turbines to improve efficiency and installing solar panels on existing rooftops, offer practical and effective pathways to achieve denmark‚Äôs climate goals without additional investments in the monopolized energy grid or further disruption to natural environments. these solutions are available today and do not require speculative developments or high-risk financial commitments.  

relying on misleading news about speculative technological breakthroughs, such as solar panels that allegedly work in the dark, detracts from addressing proven solutions. for example, claims about night-functioning solar panels producing measurable energy are misleading, as the energy produced in this way is negligible and not scalable for commercial use.  

the promotion of green energy must prioritize solutions that ordinary people and businesses can adopt directly, such as solar panels and solar-integrated roofing. these options reduce dependence on costly grid expansions, protect nature, and save consumers money, while contributing meaningfully to the green transition. denmark does not need extravagant projects like the north sea energy island to meet its climate goals; it needs a focused, immediate deployment of proven renewable energy technologies.
column13: Are there more cost-effective ways to reach the emissions targets?

column3:
Jeg har derfor stillet beslutningsforslag B91 til Folketinget. Jeg foresl√•r at regeringen skal neds√¶tte en kommission som skal unders√∏ge mulighederne for anvendelse af atomkraft i den danske energiforsyning. 

Sagen er nemlig den, at Danmark skal have massive m√¶ngder gr√∏n vedvarende energi i form af vind og sol. Det st√∏tter LA til fulde. Men man kan ikke bygge et energisystem p√• de to kilder alene. Helt banalt har de for store udsving. En overskyet og vindstille juleaften ville resultere i en kedelig r√• fl√¶skesteg. Noget skal alts√• balancere disse udsving. Udsving som kun bliver st√∏rre i takt med at vi udvider andelen af vind og sol. 

Indtil nu er planen at omdanne overskuddet p√• solrige bl√¶sevejrsdage til lagret energi. PtX eller forskellige former for "batterier" - samt at t√¶nde gaskedler op n√•r VE produktionen er lav. En masse kontrastabiliserende tiltag. Det er altsammen fint. 

Men der er ogs√• andre m√•der, at skabe stabile gr√∏nne base-loads i systemet. En overflod af billig gr√∏n str√∏m er m√•let üå±

Europa kommer ikke uden om kernekraft. Mange andre lande har det allerede. Mange udbygger. Dem som reducerer fortryder. Danmark importerer, men holder aktivt muligheden lukket. 

Desv√¶rre er debatten om kernekraft af historiske √•rsager fyldt med fordomme og misinformation herhjemme. Det √∏nsker jeg, at g√∏re op med.
column5:
i have proposed decision proposal b91 to the danish parliament, suggesting that the government establish a commission to investigate the potential use of nuclear power in denmark‚Äôs energy supply.  

denmark requires significant amounts of renewable energy from wind and solar, which liberal alliance fully supports. however, it is impossible to build a reliable energy system solely on wind and solar due to their inherent fluctuations. for example, a cloudy, windless christmas eve could leave households without adequate energy supply. as denmark increases its reliance on wind and solar, these fluctuations will only become more pronounced, making it essential to balance the energy system.  

currently, the plan is to store surplus energy generated on sunny and windy days using power-to-x technology or various types of batteries and to utilize gas boilers when renewable energy production is low. while these stabilizing measures are important, there are alternative ways to create stable, green baseload energy. the goal must be an abundance of affordable green electricity.  

nuclear power is an unavoidable component of europe‚Äôs energy future. many countries already use nuclear power, are expanding its use, or regret reducing their reliance on it. denmark, however, actively prohibits nuclear power despite importing it from other countries.  

unfortunately, denmark‚Äôs debate on nuclear power is clouded by historical prejudices and misinformation. i aim to challenge and correct these misconceptions, enabling an informed discussion about the potential role of nuclear energy in denmark‚Äôs green transition.
