De har vigtige og meget relevante input til det arbejde, vi laver i Energistyrelsen med eksempelvis milj√∏vurderinger. Uden de lokales kendskab til n√¶rmilj√∏et kan det blive sv√¶rt at f√• en ordentlig fornemmelse af centrale hensyn, der skal tages, inden vi g√•r i gang med at bygge √∏en
column5: it is incredibly meaningful to have conversations with the people who live on bornholm and are familiar with the area. these individuals provide important and highly relevant input for the work we are doing at the danish energy agency, particularly in areas like environmental assessments. without the local knowledge of the environment, it would be difficult to gain a proper understanding of the key considerations that need to be addressed before we begin the construction of the energy island.

column3:
I dag pr√¶senterede Energy Island Forum sin roadmap om energi√∏er i Europa-Parlamentet. 

Road-mappet skitserer de kritiske skridt til at realisere Europas f√∏rste energi√∏er inden 2030 og l√¶gger desuden grundlaget for langsigtet innovation af energi√∏er frem mod 2050. 

2030-fokus er p√• at f√• de f√∏rste energi√∏er op at k√∏re. Dette omfatter udvikling af lovgivningsm√¶ssige rammer til styring af risici, etablering af EU-finansieringsmekanismer til at st√∏tte projekter, fremme af industrisamarbejde for at fremskynde implementeringen og inddragelse af lokalsamfund for at sikre bred st√∏tte.

N√•r vi ser frem mod 2050, fokuserer Energy Island Forum p√• langsigtet innovation for at udvikle en europ√¶isk h√∏jborg inden for energi√∏-teknologi. 2050-horisonten fokuserer p√• at fremme langsigtet innovation - investering i F&U, udvikling af specialiserede uddannelsesprogrammer, skabelse af et √∏kosystem af ekspertise for energi√∏-teknologier og sikring af projekter, der stemmer overens med klimam√•l og b√¶redygtighed for at g√∏re energi√∏er til en central del af Europas gr√∏nne energifremtid .

For b√•de 2030 og 2050 igangs√¶ttes centrale n√∏gleaktiviteter med roadmap‚Äôen i dag!
column5:
today, the energy island forum presented its roadmap on energy islands at the european parliament. 

the roadmap outlines the critical steps to realize europe‚Äôs first energy islands by 2030 and also lays the foundation for long-term innovation in energy islands towards 2050. 

the 2030 focus is on getting the first energy islands operational. this includes the development of regulatory frameworks to manage risks, establishment of eu financing mechanisms to support projects, promotion of industry collaboration to accelerate implementation, and involving local communities to ensure broad support.

looking towards 2050, the energy island forum focuses on long-term innovation to develop europe as a leader in energy island technology. the 2050 horizon emphasizes investment in research and development, creation of specialized educational programs, building an ecosystem of expertise in energy island technologies, and ensuring projects align with climate goals and sustainability, making energy islands a central part of europe‚Äôs green energy future.

key activities for both 2030 and 2050 are launched with the roadmap today!

Den politiske aftale bag Energi√∏ Bornholm indebar, at indt√¶gter fra det nu kuldsejlede udbud i Nords√∏en skulle bruges til at finansiere en del af det abnorme st√∏ttebehov, som er n√∏dvendigt for, at nogen vil byde p√• dette projekt. Vores forventning er, at regningen til E√òB nu er minimum 40 mia. kr., da den nylige udskydelse af vindm√∏lleudbuddet p√• energi√∏en tyder p√• en yderligere forringelse af √∏konomien. Samtidig er finansieringselementet p√• forventet 8,7 mia. kr. sandsynligvis ikke-eksisterende med denne nul-budssituation i Nords√∏en, da der n√¶ppe heller kommer bud p√• de resterende 3 GW med budfrist i april.
 
Denne udvikling har f√•et selv brancheorganisationen Dansk Erhverv til at √•bne d√∏ren for, at man udskyder og gent√¶nker energi√∏en. Forligskredsen bag Energi√∏ Bornholm b√∏r hurtigst muligt forholde sig aktivt til denne fortvivlende √∏konomiske udvikling, for inden l√¶nge skal Energinet underskrive kontrakter for det lange kabel mellem Sj√¶lland og Bornholm, og hvis f√∏rst det er gjort, bliver det for alvor dyrt at droppe projektet.
column5:
the missing bid for 3 gw of offshore wind in the north sea further weakens the economic viability of energy island bornholm as an open economic endeavor. 

the political agreement behind energy island bornholm involved using revenues from the now failed north sea offshore wind tender to finance part of the massive subsidy requirement necessary to attract bids for the project. kraka economics expects the cost for energy island bornholm to now be at least 40 billion dkk, given the recent delay of the wind turbine tender for the energy island, which indicates a further deterioration of the project's economy. at the same time, the expected financing element of 8.7 billion dkk is likely non-existent due to the zero-bid situation in the north sea, with no bids expected for the remaining 3 gw with the upcoming deadline in april.

this development has even led the industry organization dansk erhverv to suggest postponing and rethinking the energy island. the political coalition behind energy island bornholm should urgently address this dire economic situation. soon, energinet will need to sign contracts for the long cable between zealand and bornholm, and once that is done, it will become prohibitively expensive to cancel the project.

column3:
Hvad er Energinets rolle egentlig ‚Äì faglig embedsmand eller lobbyist?

Det er bekymrende, n√•r embedsv√¶rket tager stilling i politisk varme kartofler i den offentlige debat. Senest er Energinets direkt√∏r for megaprojekter, Hanne Storm Edlefsen, igen ude at forsvare energi√∏projekterne, der begge har enorme samfunds√∏konomiske underskud og dermed stiller danskerne d√•rligere. Den d√•rlige √∏konomi har endda f√•et de √∏konomiske vism√¶nd til at anbefale at droppe projektet, hvis ikke der kan fremvises positiv samfunds√∏konomi. Der er alts√• ingen tvivl om, at projektet er st√¶rkt udfordret.

Det forplumrer derfor debatten, n√•r en h√∏jtst√•ende embedsmand her i artiklen p√• dr.dk og i andre sammenh√¶nge negligerer valide argumenter, som store milliardudgifter, og i stedet fremf√∏rer meningsl√∏se argumenter som, at projektet jo har en lang levetid. For det har ganske enkelt intet med sagen at g√∏re: Projekter med negativ samfunds√∏konomi stiller danskerne ringere og b√∏r droppes - uanset hvor lang eller kort levetid projektet har.
 
Det betyder faktisk noget, n√•r en direkt√∏r for Energinet udtaler sig, fordi Energinets medarbejdere med rette har ry som upartiske, saglige og fagligt dygtige mennesker, og derfor er det ekstremt giftigt for debatten, at en direkt√∏r gentagne gange fremst√•r som energi√∏projekternes st√∏rste lobbyist.  

DR‚Äôs historie handler om pr√¶cist det, vi l√¶nge har advaret mod i Kraka Economics: At regningen for at droppe Energi√∏ Bornholm vokser for hver dag, politikerne t√∏ver med at l√¶gge projektet i graven.
 
700 mio. kr. er indtil videre brugt p√• bl.a. forunders√∏gelser og modning af projektet, og den regning forventes gradvist at stige til 1,2 mia. kr.
 
Det er jo ikke i sig selv hverken underligt eller kritisabelt, at det koster penge at forberede etableringen af store, dyre anl√¶gsprojekter. Men det er til geng√¶ld kritisabelt at forts√¶tte med at h√¶lde penge ned i det hul, Energi√∏ Bornholm udg√∏r. Der er overvejende sandsynlighed for, at projektet slet ikke gennemf√∏res, fordi politikerne har sat 14 mia. kr. mindre af til det, end Energistyrelsen forventer, at der er behov for.  
 
Det sandsynlige pengespild bliver desuden kun endnu v√¶rre, s√• snart de f√∏rste deludbud (af fx kabler) afg√∏res i starten af 2025, for de kontrakter er naturligvis ikke gratis at rive over, n√•r man ultimativt finder ud af, at projektet ikke kan gennemf√∏res inden for den fastlagte st√∏tteramme.

Projektets levetid er i denne sammenh√¶ng flintrende ligegyldigt. Og det er bekymrende, hvis debatten bliver afsporet med vr√∏vleargumenter.
column5:
kraka economics is concerned about energinet‚Äôs role, questioning whether the organization acts as a neutral expert or as a lobbyist. it is troubling when civil servants take positions in politically sensitive issues in public debates. recently, hanne storm edlefsen, energinet‚Äôs director for megaprojects, defended the energy island projects, which are facing huge economic deficits and putting danes at a disadvantage. even economic experts have recommended abandoning the projects unless positive economic outcomes can be demonstrated. there is no doubt that the projects are severely challenged.

it muddles the debate when a high-ranking civil servant, like edlefsen, dismisses valid concerns such as large financial costs and instead offers irrelevant arguments, such as the long lifespan of the projects. the lifespan of a project does not address the issue: projects with negative societal economics harm danes and should be abandoned, regardless of their duration.

kraka economics emphasizes that statements from energinet‚Äôs director carry weight because energinet is recognized for being impartial and professional. it is harmful to the debate when a director repeatedly appears as the energy island projects‚Äô chief lobbyist.

as kraka economics has long warned, the costs of abandoning energy island bornholm are escalating daily as politicians hesitate to terminate the project. so far, 700 million dkk has been spent on preliminary studies and project development, with the total expected to rise to 1.2 billion dkk. while it‚Äôs normal for large infrastructure projects to incur costs during the preparation phase, continuing to pour money into a doomed project is problematic. there is a high probability the project will not be completed because politicians have allocated 14 billion dkk less than what the energy agency estimates is needed.

this financial waste will only worsen once the first sub-tenders (for things like cables) are awarded in early 2025. these contracts will come with termination costs when it is inevitably realized that the project cannot be completed within the established subsidy limits.

the project‚Äôs lifespan is irrelevant in this context. it is worrying if the debate is derailed by nonsensical arguments.

In the past few weeks I have had numerous conversations with customers and candidates from the DACH region. It became clear: the energy transition is making progress and is having a significant impact on the labor market. 

Here is an overview of the most exciting developments:

üîã Energy transition 2024: Our future is taking shape! üåø

‚Ä¢ Battery technology is experiencing an upswing: Government funding and private investments are driving innovations for e-mobility and energy storage.
‚Ä¢ Intelligent power grids are becoming increasingly sophisticated: Germany is a pioneer in the use of AI and grid optimization.
‚Ä¢ Mobility of the future: E-cars, autonomous driving and environmentally friendly means of transport are changing how we get around.
‚Ä¢ Green hydrogen in focus: The IPCEI Hy2Infra program is funding 33 hydrogen projects in Germany with 5.64 billion euros. These projects span the entire value chain and drive the hydrogen economy forward.

Job prospects:
‚Ä¢ Specialists in the areas of IT development and operations (DevOps), engineering and project development are particularly in demand. 
‚Ä¢ Salaries are attractive ‚Äì experienced managers can expect to earn between ‚Ç¨150,000 and over ‚Ç¨200,000. 
‚Ä¢ The funding of hydrogen projects also creates new, exciting career opportunities for project developers and other specialists in this area. 

Trends in the world of work:
‚Ä¢ By the end of 2024, 90% of companies want to have more presence in the office again.
‚Ä¢ Flexibility, individual career paths and contemporary additional benefits are very popular.
column5:
i believe the energy transition is having a profound impact on the labor market, especially in the renewable energy sector. the rise of battery technology, combined with government-supported innovations in energy storage, is essential for advancing wind energy. developments in intelligent power grids, enhanced by ai, are optimizing renewable energy integration, while the growing focus on green hydrogen plays a critical role. programs like the ipcei hy2infra are funding hydrogen projects that work in synergy with wind power.

in this rapidly evolving sector, there is a strong demand for specialists in it development, engineering, and project development. experienced professionals in these fields are earning high salaries, reflecting the industry's competitive nature. flexibility and personalized career paths are becoming increasingly important trends as we adapt to this dynamic workforce landscape.

column3: üåç News from Austria: Gas prices rise again üåç The sudden halt in gas supplies from Russia presents Austria with a major challenge. For the first time in decades, no gas is flowing from Russia - a clear break with the past that shows how dependent the energy supply has been for a long time. But this upheaval is also an opportunity to fundamentally transform our energy system. While OMV emphasizes that the gas storage facilities are over 90% full for the winter, the current situation is uncertain. Liquefied natural gas and other imports offer short-term solutions, but sustainable, CO‚ÇÇ-free technologies are needed to remain independent and stable in the long term. ùóõùó≤ùóø ùòÄùó≤ùòÅùòáùòÅ ùòÇùóªùòÄùó≤ùóøùó≤ ùóîùóóùóòùó¶ ùóßùó≤ùó∞ùóµùóªùóºùóπùóºùó¥ùó∂ùó≤ ùóÆùóª. By using thorium and state-of-the-art molten salt reactors, we are creating a future-proof, scalable and, above all, safe alternative to fossil fuels. Our system does not produce transuranic elements, but fission products that decay in a short time - a quantum leap in terms of sustainability and safety. This innovation is an enormous opportunity not only for Austria, but for the entire world. column5: the sudden halt of gas supplies from russia highlights the urgent need for energy independence and the transition to sustainable, co‚ÇÇ-free technologies. the reliance on liquefied natural gas and imports offers only short-term solutions. florian wagner advocates for a transformative approach using thorium and molten salt reactors as a scalable, future-proof, and safe alternative to fossil fuels. these reactors produce fission products that decay quickly rather than long-lasting transuranic waste, representing a significant leap in sustainability and safety. i see this as an opportunity for austria and the world to adopt green technologies for true energy independence. i invites active participation in driving the energy transition through initiatives like the "thorium ticket."

column3:
In the H2Mare hydrogen lead project, the Helmholtz Centre Hereon is also concerned with the possible environmental influences of offshore electrolysis that will occur in the future. In principle, it is assumed that the environmental impact of offshore production of green hydrogen will be lower than on the mainland, provided that seawater is desalinated in both variants.

However, the extent of the environmental impact of hydrogen production on the high seas depends largely on the concrete implementation of the electrolysis and desalination plants. The North Sea can better process the water extraction for the electrolysis and the discharge of the cooling water mixed with the salt brine if they are distributed locally. In the case of central electrolysis platforms or specially built energy islands, on the other hand, large quantities of seawater are taken and the returned cooling water may be concentrated with the brine in one place, which is expected to have stronger influences.
column5:
we believe that producing green hydrogen offshore can have lower environmental impact than onshore production, assuming seawater desalination is used in both cases. however, the specific environmental effects of offshore hydrogen production will vary significantly based on how electrolysis and desalination facilities are implemented.

when water extraction and the discharge of cooling water with salt brine are distributed across multiple locations in the north sea, the marine environment can process these impacts more effectively. in contrast, concentrating large-scale water extraction and discharge at centralized electrolysis platforms or energy islands would likely create more pronounced environmental effects due to the concentrated release of heated, salt-concentrated water in a single location.

we are actively studying these potential environmental impacts through our involvement in the h2mare hydrogen lead project, particularly focusing on the implications of future offshore electrolysis operations.

column3: Jedes Kind wei√ü: Wasserstoff ist das neue Erd√∂l ‚Äì so weit so bekannt. Das Fraunhofer ISI hat nun den Rechenschieber ge√∂lt, um nachzurechnen, wer das Zeug denn f√∂rdern wird. Oha: Deutschland nicht ‚Äì zumindest d√ºrften hierzulande bei kostenoptimaler Entwicklung bis zum Jahr 2050 keine Elektrolysekapazit√§ten entstehen, zumindest wenn es allein nach Kosteneffizienz geht. Obwohl doch in der Nationalen Wasserstoffstrategie irgendwas von 10 GW bis 2030 steht. Na gut, mit 218 TWh wird Deutschland lediglich einer der gr√∂√üten Verbraucher innerhalb der EU sein, deren Bedarf bei bis zu 3.400 TWh liegen wird. Der gr√∂√üte H2-Produzent Europas w√§re mit einer Kapazit√§t von 130 GW √ºbrigens Frankreich ‚Äì womit die wohl die Elektrolyseure betreiben‚Ä¶ Ebenfalls vorne dabei: Spanien (120 GW), Gro√übritannien und Norwegen (je 70 GW). Die Produktion von H2 innerhalb der EU sei preiswerter als der Import ‚Äì aber nur, wenn die Erzeugerl√§nder ihre erneuerbaren Energien auf mindestens 70 % ihrer Maximalkapazit√§t ausbauen w√ºrden, so die Forscher. Ach, und ein europaweites H2-Fernleitungsnetz ist nat√ºrlich auch n√∂tig.
column5:
i want to point out that while everyone knows hydrogen is the new oil, recent calculations by fraunhofer isi show some surprising facts. germany won't be producing hydrogen - if we look at cost-optimal development until 2050, germany won't build any electrolysis capacity, at least when considering cost efficiency alone. this contradicts germany's national hydrogen strategy which aims for 10 gw by 2030.

instead, germany will be one of the eu's largest consumers, needing 218 twh, while the eu's total demand could reach 3,400 twh. france will become europe's biggest hydrogen producer with 130 gw capacity - though we should question what power source france will use for those electrolyzers. spain (120 gw), the uk, and norway (70 gw each) will also be major producers.

the researchers found that producing hydrogen within the eu would be cheaper than importing it, but only if producing countries expand their renewable energy to at least 70% of their maximum capacity. and of course, we'll need a europe-wide hydrogen pipeline network to make this work.

column3: Die europ√§ischen Fernleitungsnetzbetreiber Gasgrid (Finnland), Elering (Estland), Conexus Baltic Grid AS (Lettland), Amber Grid (Litauen), GAZ-SYSTEM (Polen) und ONTRAS Gastransport GmbH (ONTRAS) haben erfolgreich eine Vormachbarkeitsstudie f√ºr den Nordic-Baltic Hydrogen Corridor (NBHC) abgeschlossen. Die Studie, die im Januar 2024 begonnen wurde, definiert die wichtigsten Bedingungen f√ºr die Umsetzung des NBHC, der erneuerbaren Wasserstoff zwischen den sechs beteiligten L√§ndern transportieren soll. ‚ñ∂ Bis 2040 soll der Korridor j√§hrlich bis zu 2,7 Millionen Tonnen erneuerbaren Wasserstoff nach Mitteleuropa transportieren. ‚ñ∂ Die Vormachbarkeitsstudie hat ergeben, dass der NBHC einer der ersten betriebsbereiten Wasserstoff-Korridore in Europa sein k√∂nnte. ‚ñ∂ Die NBHC-Pipeline soll einen Durchmesser von 1.200 mm haben (DN1200) und sich mit mehreren Verdichterstationen √ºber eine L√§nge von etwa 2.500 km erstrecken. ‚ÄûDer NBHC wird der europ√§ischen Wirtschaft eine Vielzahl von M√∂glichkeiten er√∂ffnen, sowohl f√ºr die #H2-produzierenden Regionen als auch f√ºr die Verbrauchszentren in den beteiligten L√§ndern. Der neue Korridor st√§rkt die Flexibilit√§t und Versorgungssicherheit und bringt den Wasserstoff von den Produzenten zu den Absatzm√§rkten. Die Anbindungen des deutschen Wasserstoff-Kernnetzes, das die beteiligten FNB in den n√§chsten Jahren schaffen werden, werden weitere Wasserstoffm√§rkte und -speicher innerhalb der Europ√§ischen Union erschlie√üen", so Ralph Bahke, ONTRAS-Gesch√§ftsf√ºhrer Steuerung und Entwicklung.
column5: i believe the nordic-baltic hydrogen corridor will create numerous opportunities for the european economy, benefiting both hydrogen-producing regions and consumption centers across our participating countries. the corridor we're developing will transport up to 2.7 million tonnes of renewable hydrogen annually to central europe by 2040, using a 1,200mm diameter pipeline stretching approximately 2,500 kilometers with multiple compressor stations. this new corridor will enhance flexibility and security of supply by connecting producers directly to their markets. furthermore, through connections to the german hydrogen core network that the transmission system operators will establish in coming years, we will unlock access to additional hydrogen markets and storage facilities within the european union.

Die Nordsee entwickelt sich zu Europas gr√∂√ütem Wasserstoffkraftwerk. Dank des hohen Windpotenzials des Meeres planen die Regierungen der Nordseeanrainer, bis 2030 mindestens 120 Gigawatt Erzeugungskapazit√§ten von Offshore-Windstrom aufzubauen. Wir schauen auf die Infrastrukturprojekte.

Das Vereinigte K√∂nigreich plant bis 2030 Wasserstofferzeugungskapazit√§ten von 10 Gigawatt aufzubauen. Norwegen plant Projekte mit einer m√∂glichen Kapazit√§t von knapp 8 Gigawatt im Jahr 2030. D√§nemark wiederum will bis dahin 4 bis 6 Gigawatt gr√ºnen Wasserstoff herstellen k√∂nnen.
Diese Entwicklungen k√∂nnten Deutschland zugutekommen, das zuk√ºnftig einen enormen Bedarf an gr√ºnem Wasserstoff haben wird.
column5: the north sea is transforming into europe's largest hydrogen power plant. based on the sea's high wind potential, north sea bordering governments are planning to build at least 120 gigawatts of offshore wind power generation capacity by 2030. let me break down the infrastructure projects: the united kingdom plans to build 10 gigawatts of hydrogen production capacity by 2030. norway has projects planned with a potential capacity of nearly 8 gigawatts in 2030. denmark aims to produce 4 to 6 gigawatts of green hydrogen by that same year. these developments could greatly benefit germany, which will have an enormous future demand for green hydrogen.

column3:
üöÄ üá∫üá∏ The potential for hashtag#OffshoreWindEnergy on the US West Coast is huge: With the recent granted 5 offshore wind leases in hashtag#California and the ambitions the State has set to reach net-zero, it is great to see such a path getting started to decarbonize the fifth largest economy of the world and this with huge potential for the local society and environment. 
 
But it will not be smooth sailing to reach these goals ‚Äì plenty of challenges need to be overcome to establish hashtag#offshorewind as a reliable source of energy for the consumers along the US Pacific Coast. And we as an industry need to address and discuss them transparently to jointly work on solutions that finally lead to a hashtag#Sustainable long-term development and implementation. And to avoid similar challenges we currently see for some of the US East Coast projects, where some plans were probably made too shortsighted and where we as industry were potentially also too afraid to openly discuss in order not to risk the growth of this new flower ‚ÄúUS Offshore Wind‚Äù. üåª
 
Many of the challenges we will see in California are not different to those from the East Coast. But I would like to point at 3 specific ones that are very different and that I also address in the podcast:
 
üëâüèº We deal with a hashtag#floatingoffshorewind technology that is not yet commercially ready for GW-scale projects and in water depths of more than 1000m

üëâüèº We deal with an advanced offtake challenge with great wind conditions in the North and most consumer centers in the South of the State, framed in a generally difficult new-build transmission infrastructure market

üëâüèº We have to develop a local supply-chain as a MUST, since support from Europe or Asia will be difficult ‚Äì these oversea supply markets are too far away and thus too costly as well as the logistics non-sustainable ‚Ä¶ and by the way, these other markets will be busy themselves to build their own capacity!!
column5:
the us west coast has immense offshore wind energy potential, particularly with california's five newly granted offshore wind leases. however, implementing offshore wind projects along the us pacific coast faces unique challenges that must be addressed openly, unlike the east coast where our industry's reluctance to discuss challenges has led to shortsighted planning. 

three specific challenges distinguish the california offshore wind projects: 


first, the floating offshore wind technology required for california's deep waters (over 1000 meters) is not yet commercially viable for gigawatt-scale projects. second, california faces a complex power distribution challenge - while the best wind resources are in the north, the main power consumption centers are in the south, complicated by difficulties in building new transmission infrastructure. third, california must develop its own local supply chain, as sourcing from europe or asia is impractical due to distance, cost, and sustainability concerns. additionally, these overseas markets will be occupied with building their own capacity. 

these challenges require transparent industry discussion and collaborative solutions to ensure sustainable long-term development and avoid the pitfalls we're currently experiencing with east coast projects.

column3: ‚ÄúThe global offshore wind industry faces a trilemma. It has to strike a balance between interests from investors, developers, suppliers, and the general public. column5: the global offshore wind industry faces a challenging trilemma involving the need to balance the interests of investors, developers, suppliers, and the public. i strongly believe that by incorporating a more balanced market design and embedding sustainability criteria into the auction schemes, the industry can drive greater innovation, promote a diverse and equitable competitive environment, and accelerate the overall growth of the sector. achieving these goals requires an improved and fair global framework. i view the global offshore wind alliance (gowa) as a vital global platform and working group, and i am excited to contribute my insights and vision to its efforts.

¬´Absurd!¬ª ‚Äì ¬´Unm√∂glich!¬ª ‚Äì ¬´Katastrophal!¬ª Die europ√§ische Windbranche ist in Aufruhr. D√§nemark ‚Äì ein Schl√ºsselakteur bei der Umsetzung europ√§ischer Ambitionen f√ºr die Windkraft ‚Äì hat vor wenigen Wochen dem Ausbau von Windparks auf See einen herben Schlag versetzt. Die Zulassung gewisser Projekte verstosse wom√∂glich gegen EU-Regeln, so die Sorge der Regierung, die sie darauf prompt erst einmal auf Eis gelegt hat.

Das schade nicht nur den Zielen D√§nemarks bei der erneuerbaren Energie, sondern auch der EU, meint die Industrie warnend. Und zeigt: Rhetorisch wird die Windkraft als zentrale Technologie f√ºr Europas Energiewende gefeiert, der Ausbau prallt jedoch immer wieder auf b√ºrokratische H√ºrden ‚Äì die nicht nur von Gegnern der Windturbinen errichtet werden.

D√§nemark ist f√ºr diesen Plan eine Schl√ºsselregion. Bis 2030 hat sich das Land vorgenommen, Offshore-Windparks in der Gr√∂ssenordnung von 13 GW zu bauen. Insgesamt wollen die Anrainerstaaten der Nordsee bis dahin 76 GW erreichen. Gleichzeitig kommen zwei der weltgr√∂ssten Windunternehmen aus D√§nemark: der Turbinenhersteller Vestas und die Energiefirma √òrsted.

Seit Anfang des Monats ist n√§mlich bekannt, dass die Zulassung einer gewissen Klasse von Offshore-Windprojekten ausgesetzt wurde. Dabei geht es um die sogenannte ¬´Politik der offenen T√ºr¬ª f√ºr Offshore-Projekte, die es in D√§nemark seit den 1990er-Jahren gibt. Im Rahmen dieses Programms konnten sich Entwickler aus eigenem Antrieb ‚Äì also ohne an Ausschreibungen der Regierungen teilzunehmen ‚Äì f√ºr die Entwicklung von Windprojekten an einem selbstgew√§hlten Standort in der Nord- und Ostsee bewerben.

Das Programm scheint jetzt jedoch ein Opfer seines j√ºngsten Erfolgs geworden zu sein ‚Äì und hat einige Beamte in Kopenhagen aufgeschreckt. Am 6. Februar gab die d√§nische Energieagentur bekannt, dass es wom√∂glich gegen die Beihilferegeln der EU verst√∂sst. Um m√∂glichen Komplikationen mit der Wettbewerbsaufsicht in Br√ºssel vorzubeugen, habe sich die Agentur deswegen selbst direkt an die Europ√§ische Kommission gewandt.

Die Aussetzung der Genehmigungen sei ¬´eine ernste Situation¬ª nicht nur f√ºr die Energiewende, sondern insbesondere auch f√ºr die Marktteilnehmer und Investoren, gab auch Lars Aagaard Anfang Februar zu. Aber, so der d√§nische Energie- und Klimaminister: ¬´Regeln m√ºssen eingehalten werden.¬ª

Die d√§nische Energieagentur sagt, der Stopp betreffe 33 aktive Bewerbungen. Das entspr√§che √ºber 20 GW, dabei kann nicht davon ausgegangen werden, dass alle Projekte ein gr√ºnes Licht erhalten.

Seither schimpft die Branche. Gerade zu einer Zeit, in der erneuerbare Energien doch schneller und im grossen Stil ausgerollt werden sollen, sei diese Intervention ein schwerer Schlag, sagte Kristian Jensen, der CEO des Verbands Green Power Denmark. Der CEO des Windgiganten √òrsted beklagt sich regelm√§√üig √∂ffentlich auf Twitter.

Auch der europ√§ische Verband Wind Europe mischte aus Br√ºssel mit. Die Entscheidung sei einfach ¬´absurd¬ª, sagt der Gesch√§ftsf√ºhrer Giles Dickson im Gespr√§ch: ¬´Wenn man die Zielmarke von Projekten verschiebt, die sich bereits in der Entwicklung befinden, verliert man sehr viel Zeit.¬ª

Die Regierung in Kopenhagen hat sich zu anspruchsvollen Zielen verpflichtet. Bis 2030 soll die Kapazit√§t der Offshore-Windanlagen um 9 GW steigen. Heute sind es laut dem europ√§ischen Branchenverband Wind Europe rund 2 GW.

Das grunds√§tzliche Problem in der EU sei jedoch: ¬´Es klafft eine L√ºcke zwischen den Ambitionen der Regierungen und der Marktentwicklung. Wir sollten 30 GW pro Jahr bauen, um die Ziele zu erreichen.¬ª Im vergangenen Jahr waren es gerade einmal 15 GW. Entwicklungen wie in D√§nemark d√§mpfen den Ausbau nur weiter.

the danish ‚Äúenergy island‚Äù projects and the recent suspension of offshore wind project approvals under the ‚Äúopen-door policy‚Äù highlight a severe contradiction in denmark‚Äôs role as a leader in renewable energy. denmark‚Äôs government halted these projects citing potential conflicts with eu state aid regulations, impacting 33 applications equivalent to over 20 gw of capacity. this pause not only undermines denmark‚Äôs own renewable energy goals but also jeopardizes the eu‚Äôs broader climate ambitions. 

while denmark has committed to ambitious targets‚Äîexpanding offshore wind capacity by 9 gw by 2030‚Äîthis decision reflects a growing gap between rhetoric and action in europe‚Äôs energy transition. the suspension sends a troubling signal to investors and developers, threatening denmark‚Äôs position as a leader in green technology and renewable energy markets. bureaucratic delays, competing policy objectives, and financial pressures are creating significant hurdles. this intervention further highlights europe‚Äôs struggles to balance rapid renewable energy expansion with regulatory and economic frameworks. 

to move forward, denmark must urgently resolve the regulatory uncertainty around the suspended projects, while ensuring that its new tender-based approach does not discourage private investment. additionally, europe must address the broader issue of slow permitting and regulatory inefficiencies, which hinder its ability to meet renewable energy targets and maintain global competitiveness in the green energy sector.

column3: üó®Ô∏è Stefan Kapferer, hashtag#50Hertz-CEO: ‚ÄûDie Ostsee bietet noch viel Potenzial f√ºr den Ausbau der Offshore-Windenergie und daher f√ºr l√§nder√ºbergreifende Projekte, um diese Potenziale m√∂glichst effizient √ºber hybride Interkonnektoren oder Energieinseln zu erschlie√üen. Die Zusammenarbeit mit den baltischen Staaten und ihre st√§rkere Anbindung an das kontinentaleurop√§ische Strom-verbundsystem ist wichtig f√ºr ein klimaneutrales Europa und zudem sicherheitspolitisch von gro√üer Bedeutung. column3:
Die deutsch-d√§nische Zusammenarbeit beim Gro√üprojekt Offshore-Windenergie hat k√ºrzlich einen neuen Meilenstein erreicht: Ein neuer Interkonnektor erm√∂glicht k√ºnftig den Transport und Austausch von Offshore-Windstrom in beide L√§nder. Bei dieser sogenannten Combined Grid Solution (CGS) handelt es sich um eine Innovation, denn es entsteht die erste Stromverbindung zwischen zwei L√§ndern, die sowohl Offshore-Windstrom an Land transportiert als auch Kapazit√§ten f√ºr den Stromhandel bereitstellt. Bundeswirtschaftsminister Peter Altmaier bezeichnet das Projekt berechtigterweise als ‚Äûeurop√§isches Leuchtturmprojekt f√ºr die grenz√ºberschreitende Zusammenarbeit im Bereich Windenergie auf See.‚Äú

Dabei scheint es aktuell so, dass eine deutsch-d√§nische Windenergie-Kollaboration durchaus etwas einseitig ausfallen k√∂nnte. Die D√§nen werden in Zukunft n√§mlich dank ihrer sehr ambitionierten Klimaziele √ºber eine ganze Menge Strom verf√ºgen, den sie Richtung Deutschland senden k√∂nnen: K√ºnstliche Energieinseln sollen in den kommenden Jahren einen Zehn-Gigawatt-Windkraftcluster bilden ‚Äì zun√§chst jeweils eine in Nordsee und Ostsee, bis 2030 noch weitere. Dabei wird das Land den entstehenden Windstrom h√§ufig nicht selbst und sofort gebrauchen k√∂nnen. Deshalb werden die Energieinseln den Strom √ºber Sektorkopplungsanlagen in andere Energieformen wie Wasserstoff umwandeln, aber auch in andere L√§nder exportieren. Der Grundstein f√ºr die Belieferung von Deutschland wurde mit dem k√ºrzlich eingeweihten Interkonnektor gelegt. In Zukunft sind auch √úbertragungsleitungen in die Niederlande und nach Polen geplant.

Die d√§nischen Klimaprojekte erf√ºllen eine klare Vorbildfunktion

Solch gro√üe Vorhaben ‚Äì immerhin handelt es sich bei den geplanten Energieinseln um nichts geringeres als den gr√∂√üten Offshore-Windpark der Welt ‚Äì sollten die deutsche Regierung meiner Ansicht nach in Erkl√§rungsnot bringen, denn sie machen deutlich: D√§nemark ist Deutschland beim Thema Energiewende deutlich voraus. Tats√§chlich hatte D√§nemark schon immer einen kleinen Vorsprung im Kampf gegen den Klimawandel, denn bereits Anfang der 90er hat das Land das Thema Windkraft f√ºr sich entdeckt. Fast still und heimlich haben die D√§nen seither eine Vorreiterrolle inne. 2017 wurden bereits 43% des dortigen Energiebedarfs durch erneuerbare Energien gedeckt.

Auch das von der d√§nischen Regierung im Juni verabschiedete Klimapaket hat wieder Vorbildfunktion: Egal ob beim Ausbau der erneuerbaren Energien, bei klimagerechter Stadtmobilit√§t oder beim Umstieg von fossilen Heizsystemen auf klimaschonende Mittel ‚Äì D√§nemark ist in fast allen Bereichen weiter als Deutschland. Zwar haben sich beide L√§nder √§hnliche Ziele gesetzt ‚Äì Klimaneutralit√§t bis 2050 ‚Äì doch nur in D√§nemark scheint dieses Vorhaben aktuell tats√§chlich realistisch.

Klimaschutz vs. Wirtschaftlichkeit: Die Bundesregierung muss umdenken

Woran hakt es also in Deutschland? An gutem Willen fehlt es zumindest nicht, wie das k√ºrzlich verabschiedete Konjunkturpaket belegt. Damit wurden bisherige Ziele nach oben korrigiert, sodass zum Beispiel die Offshore-Windenergie bis zum Jahr 2030 20 GW statt wie bislang geplant lediglich 15 GW produziert. Auch in Bereiche wie die Wasserstoffindustrie, die etwa die Speicherung √ºbersch√ºssiger Offshore-Windenergie erm√∂glicht, wird ordentlich investiert.

Dennoch muss man feststellen, dass es an dem Mut fehlt, der ambitionierte Projekte wie die d√§nischen Energieinseln erm√∂glicht. Das liegt besonders daran, dass in der Bundesrepublik Klima- und Wirtschaftspolitik h√§ufig als Gegens√§tze betrachtet werden. Statt wie D√§nemark die Energiewende als Wirtschaftsmotor der Zukunft zu begreifen, gilt Klimaschutz in Deutschland vor allem als wirtschaftliche Belastung. Das Vertrauen in die Lukrativit√§t erneuerbarer Energien ist gering. Die Industrie darf derweil nicht mit allzu vielen Grenzwerten und Auflagen geg√§ngelt werden, so die oft einhellige Meinung der Regierenden. Dieser Ethos war in den letzten Monaten h√§ufiger in Aktion zu beobachten: Die 9 Milliarden teure Rettung der Lufthansa wurde etwa von der Regierung an keinerlei Klimabedingungen gekn√ºpft, ganz anders als z.B. die Rettung von Air France in Frankreich.

Die Bundesregierung hat mit dem Konjunkturpaket durchaus signalisiert, dass sie gedenkt, eine europ√§ische F√ºhrungsposition im Kampf gegen den Klimawandel auszuf√ºllen. Damit ihr das auch gelingt, muss sie allerdings ihre Haltung gegen√ºber dem Klimaschutz und dessen Wirtschaftlichkeit √ºberdenken ‚Äì und sich ein Beispiel an den Nachbarn im Norden nehmen, die ihr um einige Schritte ‚Äì und einige Energieinseln ‚Äì voraus sind.
column5:
the danish energy island projects demonstrate a bold, forward-thinking approach to renewable energy development that germany should emulate. these projects exemplify how climate action can serve as an economic driver rather than a burden. denmark is setting the global standard with its ambitious goals, including a 10-gigawatt wind energy cluster and integrated solutions for exporting energy and converting excess electricity into hydrogen. these initiatives showcase denmark's commitment to achieving climate neutrality by 2050‚Äîa goal that appears realistic in their case due to consistent investment and innovation.   

germany, despite recent steps such as increasing its 2030 offshore wind energy target to 20 gw and investing in hydrogen technologies, lacks the courage to undertake initiatives of this scale. a persistent perception that climate action conflicts with economic growth is holding germany back. unlike denmark, where renewable energy is treated as an economic opportunity, germany often views it as a financial strain. this mindset must change if germany hopes to lead europe in combating climate change.   

germany‚Äôs government must recognize the economic potential of renewables, adopt a more ambitious stance, and embrace transformative projects like denmark's energy islands. by doing so, germany can not only catch up but also establish itself as a leader in the global energy transition.

denmark is about to gain an additional island‚Äîthe world‚Äôs first energy island, to be established 80 km off the coast in the north sea.

the energy island will be constructed as an artificial island designed to collect and distribute electricity from surrounding offshore wind farms. initially, the island will have a capacity of 3 gw, enough to power 3 million european households. over time, the capacity will be expanded to 10 gw üòµ

while the exact design is still being finalized, the island, capable of handling 3 gigawatts of offshore wind power, is expected to cover at least 120,000 m¬≤, which is equivalent to 18 football fields ü§ò

eventually, the capacity will be increased from 3 to 10 gigawatts, enough to power 10 million households. when expanded, the island is expected to occupy a minimum area equivalent to 64 football fields.

upon completion of the first phase, denmark‚Äôs offshore wind capacity will be nearly four times larger than it is today. by the time the energy islands are fully built, the installed capacity will be seven times greater than our current capacity üí™

stop the economic madness and abandon the energy island bornholm project. energy island bornholm, initially presented as a profitable venture, is now expected to be neither socio-economically nor project-economically viable. the latest calculations indicate a support requirement of a staggering 31.5 billion dkk, despite the fact that other offshore wind projects can be built without subsidies. however, politicians have imposed a subsidy cap of 17.6 billion dkk.  

despite a shortfall of 14 billion dkk, parts of the project have already been tendered, and the remaining portions are expected to be tendered in multiple stages throughout 2024. proceeding with a tender process for an underfunded project is extremely risky, as it is likely that several contracts will be signed, which will not be free to cancel if it turns out the project cannot be realized.

the planned hydrogen pipeline between denmark and germany can help ensure that surplus electricity from future energy production is used where it is needed. the pipeline allows us to use surplus electricity to produce hydrogen, which can then be exported to germany and other european countries.

it is crucial for the industry and the green transition that the danish government provides clarity on the regulation of the hydrogen pipeline network, including pricing for using the infrastructure.

we look forward to continued dialogue with the government and other authorities to ensure the best frameworks for future offshore wind and hydrogen projects.

column5:
the danish energy island projects and broader climate goals are in a state of critical stagnation. despite political promises made in 2019 to reduce denmark‚Äôs co2 emissions by 70% and align with the paris agreement to limit global temperature rise to 1.5¬∞c, no bids were submitted for today‚Äôs tender for 6 gw of offshore wind. the planned north sea energy island, a cornerstone of green energy infrastructure, has failed to move forward due to the lack of readiness in supporting technology and infrastructure, which will not be operational before 2030.

the current approach is insufficient. power-to-x technologies, crucial for the green transition, are not ready for industrial scaling and require significant investment, which is not being prioritized. meanwhile, the new energy projects, such as the energy island at bornholm, face delays as they compete for the same limited funding. this lack of progress has left denmark dependent on gas and biofuels for energy, contradicting the country's aspirations of becoming a green energy leader. notably, biofuels exacerbate co2 emissions, despite being counted as renewable energy.

globally, we are on track to reach a 1.6¬∞c temperature rise by 2024, making the 1.5¬∞c target unattainable. with current policies, temperature increases of 2.1‚Äì3.5¬∞c are likely. it‚Äôs time for honesty and a shift in focus. instead of clinging to unrealistic climate targets, we must address the consequences of climate change through measures such as protecting denmark from rising sea levels and significantly increasing investments in renewable energy and battery storage. this proactive approach will restore denmark‚Äôs leadership in the green transition. 

we knew the challenges from the beginning. large-scale investments were required, power-to-x technology wasn‚Äôt ready, and biofuels were an unsustainable option. despite these known risks, action has been delayed. who will take responsibility for these shortcomings, and how do we move forward effectively?

column5:
bornholm is ready to make the energy island project a success, provided the necessary support is secured. the project has the potential to succeed on multiple levels:  

1. **local success:** the energy island can gain widespread public support if it creates tangible value for the local community.  
2. **economic success for bornholm:** the project can drive job creation and business development, ensuring bornholm‚Äôs long-term economic sustainability.  
3. **national and global success:** the energy island can help denmark achieve its climate goals and lay the foundation for a new export success story. as the world‚Äôs first energy island, the project can serve as a technological and operational model for europe.

bornholm is prepared to move forward, but achieving these outcomes requires national political backing and initial support to launch the project effectively. with the right help to get started, bornholm can fulfill this vision and turn the energy island into a motor for local, national, and international success.
column13: Who benefits socially and economically from energy islands? Is it fair?

what does energy island bornholm mean for local development, how can energy island bornholm serve as a launchpad for energy islands as a new danish strength, and how do i handle security? these were three key questions when minister of defense and venstre chairman troels lund poulsen, together with peter juel jensen and lea wermelin, visited baltic energy island, where my chairman claus m. andersen, mayor and board member jacob tr√∏st, and director s√∏ren m√∏ller christensen welcomed them.

regarding local development, jacob tr√∏st emphasized that bornholm sees the energy island as an opportunity for local growth and, in the long term, local economic sustainability. however, for this to succeed, there is a need for financial resources to invest in future business development.

energy islands are not just a good idea. they are also a necessity to achieve the goal of installing the many gw of offshore wind set as political targets in the esbjerg and marienborg declarations. most of these gw are located so far offshore that the electricity must be collected at sea and sent to land from there. energy island technology is, therefore, essential, and if i do not use denmark‚Äôs head start with energy island bornholm to turn it into a danish strength, other countries will simply take the lead.

security is on everyone‚Äôs mind. how do i ensure that the new large facilities and the connections i will depend on in the future are protected from terrorism and hybrid warfare? during the meeting, these topics were discussed, and i explained that at my upcoming baltic energy island summit, i would focus on the issue.

a big thank you for the visit!

tomorrow ‚Äì thursday ‚Äì i have the opportunity to present my research in just 12 minutes at this year‚Äôs folkem√∏de. it will be condensed, exciting, and maybe even a little provocative üòä.

the event takes place on thursday at 4 pm at the new research stage, supported by the carlsberg foundation, as part of the ‚Äútrain a researcher‚Äù concept. here, the audience gets a chance to help train researchers like me to improve at communicating our messages clearly and effectively. the aim is to contribute scientifically grounded knowledge to the democratic conversation, which is at the heart of folkem√∏det.

at gr√∏ngas in hj√∏rring, a small-scale energy island has been established. what was once a traditional biogas plant on g√•restrupvej is now a site demonstrating power-to-x and co2 capture on a small scale.  

this setup achieves one of the most energy-efficient power-to-x processes possible by converting co2 immediately upon production. unlike other facilities where co2 is captured at a biogas plant, liquefied, and transported to a hydrogen plant, the hj√∏rring approach eliminates the need for transport and the energy-intensive cooling process.

column3:
Det er m√•ske det mest banebrydende projekt, vi har landet i de 15 √•r, vi har v√¶ret v√¶rt for forsknings- og demonstrationsprojekter," udtaler jeg, Claus M. Andersen, direkt√∏r i Bornholms Energi & Forsyning.

Kraftvarmev√¶rket p√• Skansevej i R√∏nne kommer snart til at l√¶gge bygninger til projektet Second Life for Powerplants.

En r√¶kke europ√¶iske pionerer indenfor energiteknologi har teamet op for at l√∏se en af de st√∏rste udfordringer i den b√¶redygtige omstilling: at opsamle og lagre energi fra sol og vind, s√• der ogs√• er str√∏m og varme p√• overskyede dage uden s√¶rligt meget vind. Budgettet er p√• 100 millioner kr., hvor EU har bidraget med en st√∏tte p√• 60 millioner kr.

Ideen bag Second Life for Powerplants er at genbruge kraftv√¶rkernes oprindelige teknologi ‚Äì og bygge videre p√• medarbejdernes kompetencer. Derfor genbruges dampturbine, generator, kontrolsystemer og adgangen til elnettet og fjernvarmenettet. Kraftv√¶rket f√•r tilf√∏rt tre nye forskellige lagringsteknologier: et saltlager, brugte elbils-batterier og et h√∏jteknologisk svinghjuls-batteri (flywheel). Konceptets hjerte er et avanceret styringssoftware, der skal s√∏rge for, at der i fremtiden altid vil v√¶re varme og str√∏m til r√•dighed ‚Äì selv p√• en overskyet dag, hvor flagene h√¶nger.

"Vi vil f√• en uvurderlig viden om, hvordan vi i fremtiden skal h√•ndtere og gemme sol og vind - og hvordan vi effektivt kan sikre balance i elsystemet. Vi vil f√• h√•ndfast viden om, hvad der kr√¶ves for, at vi for alvor kan drage nytte af b√•de sol og vind - uden at det skulle blive v√¶sentligt dyrere for bornholmerne. Vi vil f√• tydelige indikationer p√•, hvad der skal til af investeringer for, at vi endegyldigt kan sige farvel til olien og nedfase flisen," forklarer jeg.

Jeg p√•peger ogs√•, at de erfaringer, projektet h√∏ster p√• Bornholm, let kan kopieres andre steder og g√∏re det langt lettere, billigere og hurtigere ‚Äì f.eks. at konvertere et polsk kulkraftv√¶rk til at v√¶re fremtidens fleksible energilager med sol og vind.

"At vi kan lande s√•dan et projekt p√• Bornholm, kunne indikere, at vi m√•ske b√∏r overveje at skrue lidt op for forventningerne til, hvor meget ekstra aktivitet p√• √∏en, den bornholmske energi√∏ kommer til at skabe," afslutter jeg.
column5:
this might be the most groundbreaking project we‚Äôve landed in the 15 years we‚Äôve hosted research and demonstration projects.

the combined heat and power plant on skansevej in r√∏nne will soon house the second life for powerplants project.

a number of european pioneers in energy technology have teamed up to solve one of the biggest challenges in sustainable transition: capturing and storing energy from solar and wind power, ensuring electricity and heat are available even on cloudy, windless days. the project budget is dkk 100 million, with eu support amounting to dkk 60 million.

the idea behind second life for powerplants is to repurpose existing power plant technology while building on employees' skills. this means reusing the steam turbine, generator, control systems, and connections to the electricity grid and district heating network. the power plant will be equipped with three new storage technologies: a salt storage system, used electric vehicle batteries, and a high-tech flywheel battery. at the core of the concept is an advanced control software designed to ensure the availability of electricity and heat ‚Äì even on overcast days with no wind.

"we will gain invaluable knowledge about how to handle and store solar and wind energy in the future ‚Äì and how to effectively ensure balance in the electricity system. we will obtain solid insights into what it takes to fully utilize solar and wind power without significantly increasing costs for bornholm‚Äôs residents. we will also get clear indications of the investments required to finally say goodbye to oil and phase out wood chips," i explained.

i also pointed out that the experiences gained from the project on bornholm can be easily replicated elsewhere, making it much easier, cheaper, and faster to convert, for instance, a polish coal power plant into a flexible energy storage facility for solar and wind power.

"the fact that we could land such a project on bornholm might suggest that we should consider raising our expectations about the additional activity the bornholm energy island will generate for the island," i concluded.

two overwhelming and inspiring days on a study trip with stevns municipality on bornholm are coming to an end. the impressions were so numerous that it feels almost impossible to pick the most exciting part to describe. we heard about ambitious, grand visions and the small, local initiatives within communities. üòÉ

Det er bekymrende, n√•r embedsv√¶rket tager stilling i politisk varme kartofler i den offentlige debat. Senest er Energinets direkt√∏r for megaprojekter, Hanne Storm Edlefsen, igen ude at forsvare energi√∏projekterne, der begge har enorme samfunds√∏konomiske underskud og dermed stiller danskerne d√•rligere. Den d√•rlige √∏konomi har endda f√•et de √∏konomiske vism√¶nd til at anbefale at droppe projektet, hvis ikke der kan fremvises positiv samfunds√∏konomi. Der er alts√• ingen tvivl om, at projektet er st√¶rkt udfordret.

Det forplumrer derfor debatten, n√•r en h√∏jtst√•ende embedsmand her i artiklen p√• dr.dk og i andre sammenh√¶nge negligerer valide argumenter, som store milliardudgifter, og i stedet fremf√∏rer meningsl√∏se argumenter som, at projektet jo har en lang levetid. For det har ganske enkelt intet med sagen at g√∏re: Projekter med negativ samfunds√∏konomi stiller danskerne ringere og b√∏r droppes - uanset hvor lang eller kort levetid projektet har.
 
Det betyder faktisk noget, n√•r en direkt√∏r for Energinet udtaler sig, fordi Energinets medarbejdere med rette har ry som upartiske, saglige og fagligt dygtige mennesker, og derfor er det ekstremt giftigt for debatten, at en direkt√∏r gentagne gange fremst√•r som energi√∏projekternes st√∏rste lobbyist.  

DR‚Äôs historie handler om pr√¶cist det, vi l√¶nge har advaret mod i Kraka Economics: At regningen for at droppe Energi√∏ Bornholm vokser for hver dag, politikerne t√∏ver med at l√¶gge projektet i graven.
 
700 mio. kr. er indtil videre brugt p√• bl.a. forunders√∏gelser og modning af projektet, og den regning forventes gradvist at stige til 1,2 mia. kr.
 
Det er jo ikke i sig selv hverken underligt eller kritisabelt, at det koster penge at forberede etableringen af store, dyre anl√¶gsprojekter. Men det er til geng√¶ld kritisabelt at forts√¶tte med at h√¶lde penge ned i det hul, Energi√∏ Bornholm udg√∏r. Der er overvejende sandsynlighed for, at projektet slet ikke gennemf√∏res, fordi politikerne har sat 14 mia. kr. mindre af til det, end Energistyrelsen forventer, at der er behov for.  
 
Det sandsynlige pengespild bliver desuden kun endnu v√¶rre, s√• snart de f√∏rste deludbud (af fx kabler) afg√∏res i starten af 2025, for de kontrakter er naturligvis ikke gratis at rive over, n√•r man ultimativt finder ud af, at projektet ikke kan gennemf√∏res inden for den fastlagte st√∏tteramme.

Projektets levetid er i denne sammenh√¶ng flintrende ligegyldigt. Og det er bekymrende, hvis debatten bliver afsporet med vr√∏vleargumenter.
column5:
it is concerning when civil servants take a stance on politically sensitive issues in public debates. recently, energinet's director of megaprojects, hanne storm edlefsen, has again defended the energy island projects, both of which have enormous socio-economic deficits and thus put danes at a disadvantage. the poor economy has even led economic experts to recommend dropping the project unless positive socio-economic benefits can be demonstrated. there is no doubt that the project is highly challenged.

it muddies the debate when a high-ranking civil servant in this article on dr.dk and in other contexts neglects valid arguments, such as large billion-dollar expenses, and instead presents meaningless arguments like the project's long lifespan. this has nothing to do with the matter: projects with negative socio-economics put danes at a disadvantage and should be dropped, regardless of the project's lifespan.

it actually matters when a director of energinet speaks out because energinet's employees rightly have a reputation as impartial, objective, and professionally competent people, and therefore it is extremely toxic for the debate that a director repeatedly appears as the biggest lobbyist for the energy island projects.

dr's story is precisely about what we at kraka economics have long warned against: the cost of dropping energy island bornholm grows every day politicians hesitate to bury the project.

700 million dkk has so far been spent on, among other things, preliminary investigations and project maturation, and the bill is expected to gradually rise to 1.2 billion dkk.

it is not in itself strange or criticizable that it costs money to prepare the establishment of large, expensive construction projects. but it is, however, criticizable to continue pouring money into the hole that energy island bornholm represents. there is a high probability that the project will not be completed at all because politicians have allocated 14 billion dkk less for it than the danish energy agency expects is needed.

the likely waste of money will only get worse as soon as the first subcontracts (e.g., for cables) are awarded in early 2025, because these contracts are, of course, not free to tear up when it is ultimately found that the project cannot be completed within the established support framework.

the project's lifespan is completely irrelevant in this context. and it is concerning if the debate is derailed with nonsensical arguments.
column13: Who benefits socially and economically from energy islands? Is it fair?

column3:
Gevinsterne ved √∏get forsyningssikkerhed er ikke nok til at give positiv samfunds√∏konomi af Energi√∏ Bornholm. En aktindsigt, som Klimamonitor omtaler, viser, at den √∏gede forsyningssikkerhed vil have en v√¶rdi p√• cirka 150 mio. kr. i 2032.

Selvom det ikke er en fyldestg√∏rende analyse af forsyningssikkerheden, er effekterne s√• beskedne, at det er sv√¶rt at forestille sig, at det kan vende et stort minus til et plus, siger Frederik L√¶ss√∏e Nielsen.

I oktober anbefalede de √∏konomiske vism√¶nd at droppe Energi√∏ Bornholm, hvis ikke der kunne fremvises positiv samfunds√∏konomi. I samme omb√¶ring efterlyste de en analyse af blandt andet forsyningssikkerhed. Meget tyder dog p√•, at det ikke er nok til at vende samfunds√∏konomien.

Adjunkt i klima√∏konomi, Peter Kj√¶r Kruse-Andersen, peger desuden ganske rigtigt p√•, at det heller ikke er s√• afg√∏rende, om projektets samfunds√∏konomi lige sniger sig over nul, da man skal vurdere projektet op imod det mest oplagte alternativ, og i den sammenh√¶ng har han meget sv√¶rt ved at forestille sig Energi√∏ Bornholm som vinder.
column5:
the benefits of increased supply security are not enough to make the energy island bornholm project economically positive for society. according to an analysis referenced by klimamonitor, the increased supply security will be worth approximately dkk 150 million in 2032.

frederik l√¶ss√∏e nielsen stated that, although the analysis of supply security is not comprehensive, the effects are so modest that it is hard to imagine it could turn a large negative into a positive.

in october, the economic experts recommended dropping the energy island bornholm project unless positive economic benefits for society could be demonstrated. at the same time, they called for an analysis of supply security, among other things. however, there is much evidence to suggest that this is not enough to turn the project's economic outlook positive.

climate economics assistant professor peter kj√¶r kruse-andersen also rightly points out that it is not so crucial whether the project's economic outlook just barely goes above zero, as the project should be evaluated against the most obvious alternative. in this context, he finds it very hard to see energy island bornholm emerging as the winner.

Tyskerne f√•r st√∏rst gevinst af Energi√∏ Bornholm, hvis projektet bliver en realitet. St√∏ttebehovet til Energi√∏ Bornholm er svimlende 31,5 mia. kr., men selvom det er danske skatteborgere, der st√•r med st√∏rstedelen af regningen, er det ikke dem, der f√•r det st√∏rste udbytte. 

Energistyrelsen forventer, at cirka to tredjedele af den producerede str√∏m fra energi√∏en bliver sendt til Tyskland, hvilket i praksis betyder, at danskerne ender med at betale for gr√∏n str√∏m i Tyskland. 

Vi skal have mest muligt klima for pengene. Opfordringen er derfor klar: Drop Energi√∏ Bornholm.
column5:
germans will benefit the most from the energy island bornholm project if it becomes a reality. the energy island bornholm project requires an overwhelming subsidy of dkk 31.5 billion. however, even though danish taxpayers will bear the majority of the cost, they will not receive the greatest benefit. the danish energy agency expects that approximately two-thirds of the electricity produced on the energy island will be sent to germany, which effectively means that danes will end up paying for green electricity in germany.

we need to get the most climate benefit for the money. the recommendation is therefore clear: drop the energy island bornholm project.

column3:
Ministeren √•bner endelig for at droppe Energi√∏ Bornholm
 
M√•ske er der alligevel lys forude for de danske skatteborgere, der ellers l√¶nge har stirret lige ind i en regning p√• 31,5 mia. kr. for en energi√∏ med negativ samfunds√∏konomi.
 
Klima- energi- og forsyningsminister Lars Aagaard vil if√∏lge en artikel i Jyllands-Posten nu tage fat i partierne bag det gamle beslutningsgrundlag omkring Energi√∏ Bornholm. Sammen med dem vil han diskutere de store √∏konomiske huller, og om man skal finde de manglende penge, eller om man ender med at droppe energi√∏en. 

Baggrunden er det floppede havvindsudbud forleden, hvor ingen opstillere √∏nskede at byde p√• de 3 GW i Nords√∏en. Udbuddet skulle ellers sikre en p√¶n del af finansieringen til Energi√∏ Bornholm, og det er blandt andet de manglende milliarder, ministeren nu skal finde sammen med aftalekredsen.

Men noget tyder p√•, at partierne bag energi√∏en kan blive n√∏dt til at finde langt flere penge, for regningen vil formentlig kun v√¶re vokset, n√•r Energistyrelsen inden l√¶nge kommer med nye beregninger af projektets i forvejen elendige √∏konomi. 

Heller ikke opstillerne selv lader til at tro p√•, at projektet kan blive til noget, if√∏lge Bornholms Tidende, der har talt med mere end 20 interessenter i projektet. Det er simpelthen umuligt at f√• √∏konomi i projektet, som det ligger i dag, er meldingerne fra branchen.

I Kraka Economics opfordrer vi Lars Aagaard til hurtigst muligt at f√• taget de dr√∏ftelser, han selv l√¶gger op til, med forligskredsen. Det er tid til at tr√¶ffe den eneste ansvarlige beslutning og droppe projektet i nuv√¶rende form. Det er ok at blive klogere - specielt n√•r det drejer sig om regninger til danskerne, der formentlig efterh√•nden overstiger 40 mia. kr. for et projekt med d√•rlig samfunds√∏konomi.
column5:
minister finally opens up to dropping energy island bornholm

perhaps there is finally hope for danish taxpayers who have long faced a bill of 31.5 billion dkk for an energy island with negative socio-economic impact.

according to an article in jyllands-posten, minister for climate, energy, and utilities lars aagaard will now engage with the parties behind the original decision on energy island bornholm. together with them, he will discuss the large financial gaps and whether to find the missing funds or ultimately drop the energy island.

the background is the recent failed offshore wind auction, where no developers wanted to bid on the 3 gw in the north sea. the auction was supposed to secure a substantial part of the funding for energy island bornholm, and it is among other things these missing billions that the minister now has to find together with the agreement group.

but it seems that the parties behind the energy island may need to find even more money, as the bill will likely only have grown when the danish energy agency soon releases new calculations of the project's already poor economics.

neither do the developers themselves believe that the project can be realized, according to bornholms tidende, which has spoken with more than 20 stakeholders in the project. it is simply impossible to make the project economically viable as it stands today, the industry reports.

at kraka economics, we urge lars aagaard to take the discussions he himself proposes with the agreement group as soon as possible. it is time to make the only responsible decision and drop the project in its current form. it is okay to become wiser‚Äîespecially when it concerns bills for danes that probably now exceed 40 billion dkk for a project with poor socio-economic impact.

column3:
Mange ser med sp√¶nding frem til Power to X (PtX) og hvilken rolle denne energikonvertering skal f√• i den gr√∏nne omstilling. Masser af begejstring og seminarer rundt om i Europa hvor udbygningskort vises frem. EU lokker med covid-tilskud p√• 750 MRD Euro til PtX-anl√¶g og overregionale brint-infrastruktur (r√∏rf√∏ringer, kaverner osv.).

Det jeg savner i diskussionen er hvad vi g√∏r ved den relativt d√•rligere konvertering fra El til Brint; som med de teknologier jeg kender n√¶ppe kommer over 50% i dag eller i n√¶rmeste fremtid. Jamen vi kan jo udnytte den til varme-produktion alts√• fjernvarme!

Se nu Esbjerg. I 2023 lukker Esbjerg-v√¶rket som var p√• 378 MW og Danmarks femte st√∏rste og klarede foruden el-forsyning ogs√• varmen til Esbjerg. Varmeforsyningen skal fremadrettet klares med en havvandsvarmepumpe p√• 50MW, 60MW flisanl√¶g og 30MW el-patron som alt nu er under opf√∏rsel.

N√•r jeg s√• h√∏rer om de andre planer i Esbjerg for energi-konvertering:

¬∑        H√∏st PtX Esbjerg p√• 1 GW

¬∑        H2 Energy p√• 1 GW

¬∑        Brint-fabrik fuldt udbygget p√• 12 MW

¬∑        Forskellige Pyrolyse-anl√¶g p√• > 10MW

Alle n√¶vner at spildvarmen kan udnyttes til fjernvarme; men vi taler her om ca. 20 gange det behov Esbjerg potentielt har! Er det bare mig som ikke kan l√¶gge tallene sammen.

Energi-√∏er i Nord- og √òsters√∏en. Samme tab ved konverteringen. At foretage energikonverteringen p√• s√∏en hvor der til dato ikke er behov for fjernvarme taler ingen om. Rige amerikanere taler om at bebo Mars og M√•nen og at mennesket skal blive et interplanetarisk v√¶sen! Det er formodentlig billigere at bebo Nords√∏en p√• kunstige √∏er og dermed udnytte fjernvarmen, men det er vel n√¶ppe planen?
column5:
the enthusiasm surrounding power-to-x (ptx) and its role in the green transition is evident, with numerous seminars and large-scale plans being discussed across europe. the eu is even offering significant financial incentives, including ‚Ç¨750 billion in covid-recovery funds, to support ptx plants and hydrogen infrastructure like pipelines and storage.  

however, the conversation often overlooks the poor efficiency of the conversion from electricity to hydrogen, which, with current technologies, struggles to exceed 50%. one suggested solution is to use the excess heat for district heating, but this raises serious practical concerns.  

take esbjerg as an example. when the esbjerg plant‚Äîa 378 mw facility that supplied electricity and heat‚Äîcloses in 2023, its heating will be replaced with a combination of a 50 mw seawater heat pump, a 60 mw biomass plant, and a 30 mw electric boiler. yet, plans for energy conversion in esbjerg include:  

- h√∏st ptx esbjerg with 1 gw capacity  
- h2 energy with 1 gw capacity  
- a fully built-out hydrogen factory at 12 mw  
- various pyrolysis plants exceeding 10 mw  

all these projects claim their waste heat can be used for district heating, but the combined output would be around 20 times the actual heating demand in esbjerg. this mismatch highlights the inefficiency and lack of foresight in these plans.  

on a broader scale, the same inefficiency exists for energy islands in the north and baltic seas. performing energy conversion at sea, where there is no need for district heating, exacerbates the issue of waste. while some envision humans colonizing mars or the moon, perhaps it would be more practical and cost-effective to build artificial islands in the north sea to utilize this excess heat. yet, even this is unlikely to be part of current plans.
column13: Power-to-X and energy storage

column3: Nogen skal nok forklare til dem der bestemmer, at det er ikke alt der skinner der er guld. PtX brint og eFuels er en god id√©, anvendelsesmulighederne er mange, CO2 besparelsen er relativ billig, men at tro det udelukkende kan baseres p√• overskudsst√∏m fra sol og vind er naivt. Frem mod 2030 forventes af brintbranchen en samlet Brint kapacitet p√• 6GW(kendte projekter). Den totale installerede vind kapacitet i DK er lige nu p√• lidt over 6GW. Hvor skal str√∏mmen s√• komme fra? Anl√¶ggene og processerne er simpelhen for dyre til at st√• stand-by og hvem skal prioriteres ‚Äúoverskudsstr√∏mmen‚Äù?
column5:
the belief that power-to-x (ptx), hydrogen, and efuels can be entirely based on surplus electricity from solar and wind is unrealistic. while these technologies are promising, with numerous applications and relatively low-cost co2 savings, they require more reliable power sources.  

as of now, the total installed wind capacity in denmark is slightly over 6 gw, while the hydrogen industry expects a total hydrogen production capacity of 6 gw by 2030 from known projects. this raises a critical question: where will the electricity to power these processes come from?  

the ptx facilities and their associated processes are too expensive to be idle and depend solely on occasional surplus electricity. additionally, decisions will need to be made regarding how surplus electricity is prioritized among competing demands. simply put, not everything that appears attractive is practical or sustainable without addressing the underlying energy supply challenges.

column3:
Om mulig Energipark Vall√∏;

Den Gr√∏nne Borgergruppe er imod solceller og vindm√∏ller i skove og det √•bne landskab. Gruppen er opst√•et i forbindelse med den foresl√•ede Energipark Vall√∏, som ligger syd for Herf√∏lge. 
Deres bekymringer om projektet, st√•r beskrevet i FB-gruppen som:
1. Negativ p√•virkning af beskyttede dyrearter og naturomr√•der
2. St√∏jgener fra k√¶mpe vindm√∏ller, der rager h√∏jt op over tr√¶kronerne
3. √òdel√¶ggelse af skovomr√•der
4. V√¶rdiforringelse af boliger
5. Visuelle gener og st√∏jgener fra solceller
Sp√∏rgsm√•let er om nogle vindm√∏ller og solceller vil √∏del√¶gge omr√•dets natur. Det mener jeg faktisk ikke. Der er nemlig tale om en produktionsskov, hvilket ses tydeligt p√• nedenst√•ende Goggle foto. Den m√¶ngde skov der √•rligt f√¶ldes vil ikke √¶ndres af at m√∏llerne etableres i omr√•det. En milj√∏konsekvensrapport skal dokumenterer dette i den videre proces.
Fordelen ved placering i et stort skovomr√•de er at der opn√•s lang afstand til n√¶rmeste naboer og dermed sikres at ingen borgere bliver generet af st√∏j. Men det er jo selvf√∏lgelig et f√∏lsoms sp√∏rgsm√•l om vi kan have m√∏ller i Danske (produktions) Skovomr√•der, og en s√∏gning p√• nettet viser ogs√• mange indl√¶g mod projektet. En underskrifts indsamling mod projektet har i skivende stund 1900 underskrivere. S√• inden tvivl om at "natur-argumentet" f√¶nger let i folks f√∏lelser. Og segmenterne "Atomkraft ja tak" og St√∏jbergs "Nej til Jernmarker" har let spil til at f√• f√∏lelserne ekstra h√∏jt i spil. Om vi nogensinde f√•r unders√∏gt om det faktisk er d√•rligt for naturen tvivl jeg p√•. Projektet falder sikkert fordi politikerne ikke t√∏r g√• op mod folkestemmningen. Det store tavse flertal, som nok fint kan leve med projektet ytre sig nemlig ikke.
Mange energiparker er i disse √•r faldet og det er dybt alvorligt at den Gr√∏nne Omstilling nu g√•r i st√•.
Det har altid v√¶ret s√•dan, at NIMBY tilgangen har haft lette vilk√•r. Det var ogs√• regional politikere og politikere Gentofte, som fors√∏gt at f√• stoppet vindm√∏llerne p√• Middelgrunden. Kun fordi vi skabte et st√¶rkt folkeligt mandat, og en st√¶rk alliance med K√∏benhavns Kommune, lykkedes det at f√• Svend Auken, som minister til at tillade projektet. Embedsv√¶rket og DN gjorde hvad de kunne for at tilladelserne ikke blev givet. 
Har Danmark virkelig brug for disse Energiparker p√• land?
Ja i h√∏j grad n√•r nu fatamoganerne om Energi√∏er og Havm√∏lle enmas falder sammen. Hvis vi skal omstille Danmarks samlede energibehov, har vi brug for store m√¶ngder VE. Alle v√¶rkst√∏jer skal i brug. Vall√∏ Energipark kunne v√¶re et skridt p√• vejen.
column5:
regarding the proposed vall√∏ energy park:

the green citizens group is opposed to the installation of solar panels and wind turbines in forests and open landscapes, especially in relation to the vall√∏ energy park, located south of herf√∏lge. their concerns are summarized in their facebook group, which include:
1. negative impact on protected animal species and natural areas.
2. noise pollution from massive wind turbines towering above the treetops.
3. destruction of forested areas.
4. devaluation of nearby properties.
5. visual and noise disturbances from solar panels.

however, i do not believe the installation of wind turbines and solar panels will destroy the natural environment in this area. vall√∏ energy park is located in a production forest, as shown in the attached google photo. the amount of forest felled annually will not increase due to the establishment of turbines in this area. a full environmental impact report will be prepared in the ongoing process to verify this.

one advantage of locating the energy park in a large forest area is the substantial distance between the project and nearby residents, ensuring that noise disturbance to local citizens is minimized. but this remains a sensitive issue, as public opinion on having turbines in danish production forests is divided. a quick online search reveals many protests against the project, with a petition against it currently gathering 1,900 signatures. it's clear that the "nature argument" strongly resonates with people. 

in my view, however, whether the project actually harms nature is unlikely to be thoroughly investigated. the project will probably fail because politicians are afraid to go against public opinion. the large, silent majority that could support the project does not speak up.

the failure of many energy parks in recent years is a serious issue, as the green transition risks stalling. nimby (not in my back yard) sentiment has always been a powerful force. even regional politicians and some in gentofte tried to stop the wind turbines at middelgrunden, but only through a strong public mandate and a strategic alliance with copenhagen municipality were we able to convince minister svend auken to approve the project. the bureaucracy and danish nature conservation (dn) did everything they could to prevent the necessary permits from being granted.

does denmark truly need onshore energy parks? yes, very much so. the illusory promises of energy islands and offshore wind farms are fading. to meet denmark's overall energy needs, large-scale renewable energy (re) is essential. all available tools must be used, and the vall√∏ energy park could be a significant step forward in this transition.
column13: Marine life and evironmental impact of constructing energy islands

column3:
Ramb√∏ll har netop vundet udbuddet som teknisk bygherrer√•dgiver for Energinet p√• el-transmissionsanl√¶gget p√• Energi√∏ Nords√∏en, som bliver et af verdens f√∏rste og st√∏rste offshore el-infrastrukturprojekter til dato. Kontraktens v√¶rdi er p√• 225 millioner kroner og l√∏ber over 10 √•r. 

‚ÄùVi ser meget frem til samarbejdet med Energinet p√• opgaven. Det er et afg√∏rende bidrag til den gr√∏nne omstilling, at vi lykkes med at lave et effektivt og skalerbart koncept for fremtidens offshore el-infrastruktur, som vi skal i gang med her,‚Äù siger John Ammentorp, landechef for Ramb√∏lls energiforretning i Danmark. ‚ÄùOpgaven er af stor teknologisk betydning for Danmark. Energi√∏en i Nords√∏en bliver den f√∏rste af sin slags i verden, s√• projektets l√∏sninger og de unikke kompetencer vi opbygger i Danmark undervejs bliver epokeg√∏rende for fremtidens offshore el-infrastruktur. Projektet bliver derfor en meget vigtig showcase for Danmark over for resten af Europa, Asien og USA, som kigger p√• lignende vision√¶re projekter inden for havvind og energihubs,‚Äù siger han üåé.

Vi har samlet vores perspektiver i tre bundlinjer for Energi√∏ Bornholm: 1Ô∏è‚É£ Klimam√¶ssigt: Projektet vil i sig selv fortr√¶nge 3 mio. tons CO2 om √•ret, men endnu vigtigere bane vejen for flere energi√∏er, der er afg√∏rende for den gr√∏nne omstilling i EU. 2Ô∏è‚É£ Industripolitisk: Bornholm vil som eksisterende √∏ v√¶re den ideelle testplatform for fremtidens energi√∏er. column5: i believe that the energi√∏ bornholm project is a valuable investment in denmark‚Äôs and europe‚Äôs future. the project is designed to significantly reduce carbon emissions by displacing 3 million tons of co2 each year, while also paving the way for the development of additional energy islands that are crucial for the eu‚Äôs green transition. energi√∏ bornholm will serve as an ideal testing platform for future energy islands, granting danish companies a competitive advantage in the development of innovative energy island technologies. additionally, the project is strategically important for energy security, as it combines electric trade connections with substantial amounts of green energy, marking a significant step toward reducing the eu‚Äôs dependency on russian energy. although current economic assessments suggest a negative net effect of 4 billion danish kroner, those calculations fail to account for the many positive externalities stemming from the project‚Äôs innovative nature. this project is not only one of the largest climate initiatives ever undertaken but also sets the foundation for greater energy self-sufficiency across europe.
